title: Fine Drone for the Money
text: It easy to charge, store, take off, fly, land, and take photos. I wish the camera made photos that could be enlarged.

title: My husband loves it!
text:
Would not calibrate. So disappointing as it was my a birthday gift for my husband.
Revision : Works GREAT! Very very powerful batteries. Performance is excellent. Don't hesitate to get this one it is a great little drone for the money. Excellent purchade.

title: My Foldable Vaca Drone "HS 720"
text:
[[VIDEOID:61f52fe954b9387d0799a4276217dbef]] Great Beginner or Experienced Drone operators with camera and video that pivots downward a full 90 degrees give the pilot great views and options, one fault is it's not on a gimbal but at this price point it can be expected. Super quiet brushless motors, 1 battery and usb charger, nice controller. Comes with decent quality carrying case that stores everything perfectly, along with a zippered compartment area, where you can keep the manuals and spare props, yes you get a set free with the drone!

Flies well in the wind I put it up in winds that were around 15-18 mph and it handled them well, of course the advertised battery life suffered and was only about 17 minutes but it was fighting the wind the whole time. On a less windy day it was almost 24 minutes of total flight time!

If your looking for a drone to learn on at a decent price point this is a good one and it's the right size, this is my 3rd Holy stone drone and I'm pleased with the product, I own the 700d, 270, and now this bad boy. All the features like follow me and point of interest work as expected I have yet too use way points on any of my birds, but the WiFi connection and FPV work well too.

I bought this one too go on Vacation with us in April to florida, mostly because of its footprint and portability, it is a little smaller than the 270.

Eventually I will be spending a ton on a DJI Mavic pro as I want to have a drone with autonomous flight and obstacle avoidance, but these drones have definitely exceeded my expectations and well worth the $$$ spent and are a great addition too my 7 other flying machines I have! So I highly recommend this unit!

title: Great unit
text: They make a quality unit. Has a lot of features for the price and they are very customer responsive!

title: GREAT Customer service!
text: As others have stated, this is an easy drone to learn on. I had a problem with the Tap Fly function. It would not go any further than the second Tap Point. The Holy Stone customer service responded to my query almost immediately when I asked for help. After trying various remedies to the problem they put out a new S/W App that fixed the problem I was having. All of this happened very quickly! Now I am flying and using all the features of the drone. It is a really fun drone to fly, especially for the price point! I would recommend Holy Stone products to anyone wanting to start having fun with a drone!

title: Cheap battery charger
text: Drone has a pretty good distance, the live view streaming distance is much less than control distance. I live in a country town and the video feed cuts out about 150 meters with an altitude of about 70 meters. My biggest compliant is the cheap battery charger. Because of the battery charger I‚Äôm considering to return this drone.

title: What a great drone!
text: I had written to Holy Stone prior to buying the HS 720 just to get more information and they were extremely helpful. My HS 720 4K drone arrived and it was almost too much to have to wait to charge the battery. I had watched a number of YouTube video reviews on this drone so when I read the manuals it was a breeze. I have an aviation background but have never flown a drone before. This Holy Stone was made for beginners but has the feel of more than a toy. On my first flight I had very few problems and the ones I did have were operator error, not the HS 720. The good news is that while learning, if you go through all the preflight procedures, and you get worried about your drone just let go of the controls and it stops, hovers and waits for you. I even flew it out of range and lost the signal and got really worried until I saw it coming back to me and then I took over once more. The Return To Home feature is worth is weight in gold. The camera was clear and photos were nice. I would highly recommend this HS 720 to anyone and especially a beginner, but it is capable of doing most everything you need.

title: Great drone for price
text: Just got this drone a few days ago and so far it seems like a great drone at a great price. It has a lot of features that I did not expect at this price which is a nice surprise. Happy with this purchase so far and will update the review after further use.

title: awesome in every way...
text: A wonderful product and company.

title: Fun, but sometimes it has a mind of its own
text: We are first time drone users. We are learning but had a couple issues early in that the drone would go off on its own. Holy Stone helped us when we had an issue. Now getting the hang of flying this. Had great fun today.

title: High quality, with long lasting battery
text: I've had the drone for a couple weeks now.  It takes a bit to get use to, but is extremely fun.  The camera quality is good without the memory card, but very good with the card (make sure to get the recommended memory card).  Learning to fly is much easier in a wide open field.  Once you get the hang of it you can start using in more constrained spaces.  Don't let the battery get to low, especially around trees or objects as the return home feature will kick in and may cause unexpected movement.

title: I'm impressed!!!
text: I have some friends who are really into droning and they were recommending that I buy used or refurbished for twice the price I paid for the HS720. I told them how much I was going to pay and showed them that the specs of this drone matched much higher priced drones on the market. They laughed at me and said go ahead, you'll see when you try to fly it. I did fly it and I'm the one laughing now. Absolute blast! great buy.

title: No idea how it works - I sent it to the brave fellas defending Ukraine
text:
This was our token of help for the brave soldiers defending Ukraine from the Russian animals.

Hope it can help them at least a little bit.

If you think it makes sense, buy some, find someone who sends them help and join the effort!

title: Control doesn‚Äôt alway control.
text:
When drone goes into low power mode it will automatically return and land. Mine did just that but my battery was low.

Drone went into landing mode then took off again (sideways) slamming into my cars door. This caused a dent and scratches on driver side door. Drone fell underneath car and tried taking off again. Drone wouldn‚Äôt react to control. Drone self destructed slamming back and forth underneath car and floor.

Scratches and dent on car door plus price of drone‚Ä¶. Would‚Äôve been better off buying a higher quality drone.

title: Good value for the price
text: I like the gps tracking and overall performance for the price. I wish it had collission avoidance. My main problem was learning how to calibrate the gps. Overall I'm impressed, however, now that I've learned to use it.

title: Holy Stone Drone
text: I have had several drones before this one from other companies, and I would have to say that without a doubt the Holy Stone is by far the Best Buy for the money. The customer service is also excellent. When contacting other companies I could never get a good solid answer or any help. Holy stone is quick to answer the phone and have been invaluable with every issue I‚Äôve raised with them. I can‚Äôt say enough good things about this drone and this company.

title: Great Customer Support
text: The first Drone delivered had a problem responding to the remote control right joy-stick.  But customer support quickly sent a replacement. Although this Drone is fairly simple to fly, I would not label it good for beginners. I've been flying mini Drones for years and in my opinion, this Drone does require some solid experience before you attempt to fly it. The reason I say this is because there is no room for error if you crash. The Drone is made of plastic and will break.

title: A good drone for beginners.
text: This drone is user friendly and ready to go right out of the box.  It is our first drone and is easy to learn to operate.  The buyers have many uses for this item, ours is to document our retirement home being built and protect the farm.  Buy this drone!

title: Easy to fly for beginner
text:
This my second drone I purchased from Holy Stone. I am a beginner at drone flying. The times I‚Äôve been able to fly the hs 720 have gone great. For a beginner the home button is a drone saver. The picture quality is very good when recording on my phone and I‚Äôm looking forward to seeing how it records on the sd card.
The only thing I‚Äôm not sure of is the sd card doesn‚Äôt look as Secure as it could be.

After having more time to fly the drone I‚Äôm even more satisfied than I was when first beginning you use it.

I like everything about it. And Now find that the SD card is secure and it holds a lot of pictures and videos.

title: The product is something I use to take photos on 42 acres I live on  Works Perfect no problem
text: I bought this to look at property I live on 42 acres it is a lot of fun easy to operate. Look at videos on utube and watch closely before use it will save  lot of time and it is very use full. It helps in setting up for the first time and shows just what you will read in the instruction book . I would rather watch the videos instead of reading the instructions. Either will get you in the right direction . I have never flew one but watching videos and playing with controls get to know them I fled for first time never had a problem . Set it up and never had a problem. flew for 26 minutes it beeped low battery pushed home button went to home spot hovered and I landed it.  PERFECT FIRST TIME. learn before first use your first flight can be perfect too

title: Best Drone-Responder
text:
I like the most expedient RTH feature of any drone I have flown so far. The H/S 720 beats the others hands down,
when it comes to maneuverability and control monitoring . Thanks again

title: More than a toy
text:
Wow, I thought I gave up on flying RC 40 years ago after the build, fly, crash, repair, fly, crash era but the urge has never left me. I've tried other drones that were glorified kids toys but I couldn't resist and got a Holystone HS720. I've learned to be patient and used the 6 hrs of battery charge time to read and re-read the manual. BTW, the manual is online so it can be downloaded and enlarged for "old eyes."
After the preliminary pairing and GPS matching I pushed a button and up it went, 5 ft and just hovered as if to say "what next." Next was the testing, I don't think the 720 needed testing as much as I did and I am pleased that I passed and have been up and flying 3 times. Surprising how fast 25 minutes go by. My only recommendation is get a spare battery or maybe two. Happy flying!

title: Seem pretty easy. Watch you tube video
text: Great for first time flying. Had it up and going in about 30min. After battery charge.

title: Fantastic!
text:
The. Holy Stone HS720-4K is hands down the best drone I‚Äôve even owned. They really stepped This is a great drone with fantastic features normally found in drones used for the commercial marketplace. This drone has never let me down, with a simple (RTH‚Äù return to home button it simply comes back to you if you‚Äôve lost sight of it or just want to let it do all the work. Also this drone came with spares, not just a few extra propellers but an entire set! If this is the future of the company, they are going in the correct direction.
I love that it comes in a semi hard case, the drone is completely protected and the case is easy to store. The remote is comfortable and even fits my large hands with gloves and fits my iPhone 12 without removing its case. The display is easy to read at a glance and very accurate. The joysticks and buttons are layed out well.
The ‚Äúfirst setup setup‚Äù before flight was extremely simple, I went from out of its case to flying in less than five minutes. It surprise me when I was flying in a light wind, 5-10mph with no drifting. The adds claim that you can fly for 26 minutes, so far I haven‚Äôt timed it but I still haven‚Äôt flown long enough to kill the battery on the first flight. So far I couldn‚Äôt be happier, it‚Äôs the first product that not only does what it‚Äôs advertising but exceeds it.

title: Love our drone
text: Good quality. Super easy to set up. Takes a couple flights to get use to it.

title: I re-ordered it
text:
Well, had a friend who purchased this after I returned mine being frustrated with the Chinese or Japanese writing and the demand to allow it to control my phone for calls. Wanted nothing to do with that. Then a friend said he didnt have to do that, so I repurchased it. It flies extremely well (I used to fly RC aircraft) and has some wonderful features, such as return to base - which was accurate only 1 in 4 times. I had a 3 ft by 4 foot landing pad in the grass - I had to control it those other 3 times to get it on the pad)
A couple things which are not mentioned in the instructions - the distance and altitude units are not mentioned. I am guessing it was in meters, but dont know for sure. The range of my signal (with a brand new phone) was 130 units until the video image was lost. The drone was still controllable.
The worst thing about the drone was the video imagery. It broke up frequently even at 12 meters(?) distance with a clear line of sight. It was intermittent and really wrecked some video I was taking. It may be I have a bad antenna or loose connection on the drone, I dont know. Considering returning it again, but will check with HolyStone first as I do like the machine.
One other thing I would like to see as an option (maybe it is) is the ability to change camera lenses - its a wide angle lens and I would like perhaps a 2x lens if made.
Overall, for learning, its a great machine. For photos - also very good. For video, I have my doubts.

title: Very easy and fun to fly and operate
text: The drone takes off and hovers well. The follow me option works and the drone will stay at the same altitude and follow as long as it remains connected to your phone. The circle around a point works well and is easy to engage. This function is very good for taking a 360 degree video. The return home function works well both when I prompted it to and once when the drone lost signal. I have a vinyl ‚Äúlaunch pad‚Äù and the drone came back and landed right on the pad. From what I have noticed the drone needs a line of sight to stay connected to the remote control unit. The camera is good and provides good pictures, and is controlabale from the remote. Still pictures can be taken and sent directly to your phone, but videos are best stored on an SD card and then downloaded to your phone to keep the videos from being choppy due to signal loss.

title: Great buy Great drone!
text:
So solid, so simple to fly, works perfect!
Camera use all is so simple, just use your phone and that's all
A very smart high tech simple drone.
Awesome!!!

title: Great drone and Holy Stone support is AWESOME!!
text: When I originally purchased this drone, not all the functions worked with the app. Selina from Holy Stone reached out to me and sent me a replacement drone. I hadn't had time to test it out due to the crazy world we're living in now (pandemic). I finally unboxed the new drone, took it for a test drive and it now works flawlessly!! This drone rocks. Unbelievable picture and video quality even without a SIM card. All the functions on the APP are working as expected now too. This is a GREAT drone for beginners. Easy to operate and the return to home button can get you out of a jam with just the press of a button. I really want to thank Selina from Holy Stone for her patience and more importantly her support. I look forward to using this drone more and more. It's a great drone for the price. You won't be disappointed!!

title: It was great...til it became a zombie drone!
text:
Second day flying it, it was responsive and seemed like a real value.
We did simple stuff and then I was walking/flying it home very close to it when it lost its mind! It stopped responding to controller, went way high, zipped around hitting trees, came at me, then flew into a tree and got stuck!
More excitement than I need. We are returning the zombie to Amazon ;)

title: Quality Drone, Very Pleased!
text: Outstanding drone! It's actually my first drone and I love it! Easy to fly and land, video quality is really nice, great still shots as well. Battery life is Great! First flight was over 20 minutes with constant video recording and still had 2 bars left on the battery. I did look at the Mavic Pro at first but I couldn't justify the cost. I'm very happy with the Holystone HS720.

title: Wow! Excellent flier.
text: [[VIDEOID:b0ac7a0cdff2eb810e04050f3f270633]] Extremely stable flier. Everything works. Handles wind. Video straight to camera is excellent. Too powerful for indoors. Prop guards and headless would be good for beginning flights. Charger is slow, 2 batteries takes 8 hrs and they fall out easily. Spare parts like propellers not available. Very compact package.

title: Nice quality, flies easily
text: I bought this and the instructions are not easy to follow. The manual is better than the quick start guide but I ended up watch YouTube to fully understand how to fly the drone. Now this is why I did not give five stars... my drone was up about 75 feet in the air and I pushed the land button. When I did, all four motors quit and the drone crashed breaking one of the arms. I emailed the customer service number and after exchanging 3-4 emails with as many people; it was determined they did not have spare parts here in the USA.  To my surprise, Amazon delivered a brand new drone yesterday!!!! Wow that‚Äôs impressive but I still cannot give 5 stars because there is no easy way to buy parts which are inevitable when you own and fly a drone. If sellers or in this case ‚ÄúAmazon ‚Äú were to stock parts, I‚Äôd definitely be giving five (5) stars.

title: After 2 months
text: I've had the product for a couple months now. Very easy to fly and does a good job with the wind. Remote control could be designed a little better to hold your phone. Also the camera is not as clear as I had hoped.

title: Great beginner drone. Easy to learn use, easy to use.
text: Easy to use, very good for beginners.  Camera takes good pictures.

title: Mostly Positive with a Negative
text: This is a well made, well designed Drone that is easy to fly and fun.  I am a beginner and it was easy to fly and control right out of the box.  But because I was a beginner I was concerned about safely and storage of its Li-Pol batteries.  HS batteries with the drone are expensive relative to others so quality is not the issue.  But neither in it‚Äôs Amazon listing, nor website or printed literature could I find data on how to get to storage charge and how to discharge.  And that was a deal breaker for me because Li-Po batteries require good handling and storage.  And I would have rated this product four stars easily if it was not for the apparent limitations of the charger that while good did not allow for a storage charge or discharge setting and I did have an automatic landing due to low battery that really was not low which also made me question the charger/battery arrangement.  I returned the product reluctantly but for peace of mind for an Amazon credit.

title: Great Features and Best Bang for the buck and great customer support!!!
text:
[[VIDEOID:1e7caeba2f69e544a37626dac14ebefe]] Did hours of research on several drones and finally ordered my HS720 a few days ago. It arrived yesterday and I must admit I'm very impressed with the quality of the product. I had an issue trying to get my Galaxy S7 to sync with the HS720 but that was my fault. I didn't read the quickstart guide. I was using Ophelia GPS that was referenced in all the reviews I watched on Youtube. I called Holy Stone and got help right away and Darrel informed me that I should be using Ophelia Go. I installed that and it connected right away.
The Video on this Drone is amazing. The clip I attached shows the 4K quality without any artifacts while moving. This is an impressive piece of technology!

Easy to take pictures or video.  Well worth the money. Stp wasting your time on hard to fly cheaper models. WORTH THE MONEY.

title: Great Beginner Drone
text: I've enjoyed this drone, some issues to get past like Tapfly (be sure to have iphone in Airplane Mode), make sure to calibrate it on every flight.  I have GPS issues and connectivity issues time to time why I gave it a 4-star.  I have enjoyed this drone since I have purchased it.

title: So much fun for a first time drone operator
text: Great out of the box experience.  Easy to set up and fly.  First flight was a total success and hit the ‚Äòreturn to home button‚Äô and it comes right back.  So cool!!

title: Nice drone by Holy Stone but buy an Amazon extended warranty for it
text:
It tells you lots when a company only provides a 90-day warranty for their top of the line $400 drone. If you are going to purchase this item, you definitely want to purchase the Amazon extended warranty. My dilemma was that my drone decided (I'll use that term) to stop communicating with me just outside the 90-day warranty. It worked flawlessly up to that point. Images and videos were outstanding. I was about 25 feet up when it suddenly rose on its own to about 50 feet and flew into a tree near us. It wasn't windy, and it was in a location where I had flown dozens of times before. I was holding the controller, not touching any of the controls. Company support reps were kind enough to spend time with me on troubleshooting this issue, but in the end said, sorry it's out of warranty, the board is bad, nothing they can do, but you can have 20% off on a new one. At that point, I decided that I will never buy from Holy Stone again because I don't think they actually believe in their own product. I flew the unit the other day and will continue knowing that I'll have to spend at least twice as much if I want good support. When it crashes and burns, I will go better. It is probably one like DJI that offers two exchanges within a year, with an optional 2nd year if the first year doesn't use both exchanges.

UPDATE: Holy Stone contacted me and sent me a new HS720 4K. Unexpected and I appreciate it. I'm improving my rating, but I recommend that anyone purchasing a drone, purchase the Amazon extended warranty, checking the details first. Thank you, HS!

title: My drone is always disconnects from the phone.
text: I have a problem with my drone that I purchased from you guys! It was a present for my boyfriend on his b-day. The packaging and an overall quality of the drone are pretty good and my boyfriend was really happy about his present, but when he finally got to it(I purchased the drone month in advance and was not able to test it before), he was not able to fly it. The issue is that when the drone is connected to his phone through wi-fi on the drone app the status shows as "online" or "connected" and it stays like this for the next 5 minutes when you fly the drone, but then suddenly drone loses connection with the phone, and the app, and just stays in the air. We tried to fly the drone couple of times, but the issue is still there. It just freezes in the air after 5 minutes. Please advise! The phone we are using is Samsung Galaxy 10

title: Drone flew away, Battery issues

title: Does everything it says it will do...
text: Not exactly my first drone if you consider all the $10-$20 mini drones you get around Christmas time, but this drone is my first "real" one. Its very intuitive and makes flying approachable. I was surprised at what I was doing right out of the box. It has plenty of power, camera works and looks great. All the features work great! I love it. Came in a very very nice carrying case. It says you can get another battery for free if you write a review which is honestly why I'm writing this, and good thing because it seems that spare batteries don't exist for HS720, hopefully soon??? title: Easy to use
text:
So we have never used a drone and we were able to figure this one out. Read the directions before flying! My teen son figured he would fly and read as he got it going not a good idea. Comes with extra blades good thing. Our GPS signal was weak here so we couldn‚Äôt try the return to home or plot a course on the map for it to fly on its own. I think my friend is interested in this now. We left the plastic over the camera lens for practice, good idea for initial flight if your new. I was able to land it easily on septic tank pipe first try. We kept it in slow mode since we are noobs but looking forward to using this on our Alaska outings. Should fit nicely in my day pack in its cary case.

Pic quality is blurry because we intentionally left plastic over lens. That blast pipe behind us is what I landed it on in one attempt. Smooth and easy in slow mode

title: Backyard Toy Only
text:
[[VIDEOID:83255fa96964fb2387ea0dc4d661f0a1]] My wife bought this in November 2019 for me as a Christmas present and by the time I was able to fly it I could not send it back.

First the good things about this drone, it's very quiet, looks good, flight time & seems very stable in windy conditions.

Bad things, Holy Stone claims it can fly at a distance of up to 200 meters = 656 feet line of sight with video fly capability. However this is not true, I was only able to fly up to 93 meters = 305 feet before losing video signal and the whole time I was in line of sight with no obstructions & no power lines.

I contacted customer support and sent them some videos of the problems I was having with the Drone and they suggested I try using a different cell phone, fly area, turning off mobile data & putting my phone in airplane mode nothing worked no changes. After jumping through all the hoops their final conclusion was, I was past the 90-day warranty and they were not willing to do anything about it.

If you plan just to fly this drone in your backyard only at no more then 300 ft this drone will be perfect for you.

title: Make sure to follow FAA Rules before flight and register your faa.gov account.
text:
Very nice drone. Very affordable. Very easy to use.
Highly recommend holystone hs720 to all.
Make sure you follow all the FAA guidelines it's very important to know the boundaries. When you buy this you must register at FAA to get the registration ID also put that idea on the Drone itself as you can see in my picture it's covered that is my FAA ID number on the Drone. Enjoy responsibly.

title: Would buy again
text: Seems to be well-made I‚Äôve only used it once. The set up of the compass and GPS is straightforward but a pain.

title: HS720 - Compact and solid drone. Hurry! Go buy one!
text: I had this drone on my wish list for a couple of months and decided to purchase the drone when I saw that it was on sale. Boy am I happy I did. Received my drone today and I couldn't wait to fly it. Took it out of the box and immediately noticed the nice carry case. Unzipped the carry case and was pleasantly surprised at the size and the quality of the drone. The battery was half charged, so only wanted to do a test flight. Even at half charge, I got about 12 minutes out of it, but enjoyed all 12 minutes of flight.

title: Great Drone

Easy to fly right out of the box. Looks good. It‚Äôs compact.
It was easy to set up and connect to my phone.

It comes with a very convenient case with handle.

title: Dead batt but! Good quality. For new version

When flyable will update

title: Read this before you buy
text:
Good-its small, nice carrying case, good controller, above average battery life/flight time for size, lots of options like auto return, and durable
Bad-loses connectivity while in flight, easily susceptible to wind, long time to charge the battery (6-8hours), and not easy to control.

I decided to return mine after several times it lost connectivity with my phone and landed itself causing me to try and find it. Good drone if youre just going to fly it over head but i wouldn't trust it out of your sight range.

title: Happy with my purchase
text: Nice little drone to start with. If you're a gamer, my done is, I'm not, it's a cinch to learn.

title: Easy to fly.
text:
Has all of the features I need. Easy to fly, and basically it will almost fly itself!

A lot of fun!

title: GREAT DRONE!!!!!!
text: I own both high end and budget drones. This is the perfect balance between both. Thank HolyStone!!!

title: Really fun drone!
text:
I bought a small, kid drone to test out whether or not I'd like it. I hated it - it was too light, and even in the lightest breeze it wouldn't control easily -

THEN I got the Holy Stone drone! What a difference! This is a really great product. The self start instructions are very user-friendly and easy to understand. The drone works great and is weighted enough so that it doesn't blow away lol - Plus that, I like the idea of the propellers folding in, so that it's more compact when not using it.

My only feedback on a kind of negative is that the propellers show up in the video as you can see from the example I uploaded. I was intending to use this for some of my marketing, but unsure I can use this one for that - However, this is still a 5-star drone!

title: Great drone
text: This is my first drone and it has worked out great.  It is easy to use and has some great features for the cost.  I would recommend this drone to anyone new to the sport.

title: Excitement
text:
My husband was so excited when he received this as a Christmas Present. He thought it was wonderful. He registered it also. However, when hooked up to wifi the Holy Stone would only go up to about 40 foot and then it stopped and wouldn't go any further.

Real nice Holy Stone

title: Second set of eyes.
text: This was my second purchase of drones and this is a quality tool. I use it to check tops of buildings for maintenance issues, and for fun we put it in the follow mode and it follows us everywhere. Once I have it fully mastered will get more.

title: Second set of eyes.
text: This was my second purchase of drones and this is a quality tool. I use it to check tops of buildings for maintenance issues, and for fun we put it in the follow mode and it follows us everywhere. Once I have it fully mastered will get more.

title: Bad connection to the app
text: The drone itself is pretty cool. Not a bad price. But I hate the app. Maybe it's my phone idk but the drone's Wifi doesn't like to to connect to my phone. It will connect but it takes a while. Then the most annoying part is once I start flying, the video sucks. It's choppy/cuts out and doesn't look like the advertised 4k. But it's not the quality I'm most annoyed with, it's the fact that I literally can't use the video because it's choppy. (Works for a second or two then doesn't for 3 or 4 seconds.) Is it my phone or is it the app/drone? Idk but I literally can't use this drone like this.

title: Great Drone !!!
text: Let me start by saying hats off to holy stone and there line of drones. This is my second holy stone drone and could not be happier I started with holy stone with my 120d great drone by the way. My son was really interested in learning to fly drones so I ended up giving my hs120d to my son which needless to say I needed a drone now for myself so I ended up back on amazon and I was surprised to see the hs720 new drone from holy stone so just like everything I compared all the specs with other drones in its class and let me say this the hs720 was very comparable to top of the line drones that are much more expensive so I figured seeing how I was satisfied with my previous experience with holy stone I would go ahead and order this HS720. Let me say that I am very happy I did its an awesome drone that does exactly what I expected it to do and some. Firstly the drone came with a very durable carrying case that holds drone, controller and extra batteries way cool that I did not have to purchase that. When I opened it up I was very anxious to fly this baby so I quickly was able to look through quick guide to learn how the drone operates and calibrate it etc. Was able to have the app downloaded and drone calibrated in about 5 mins. Now that the drone is calibrated I was ready to test this drone out I was able to hit the take off button and it went up about 5 feet up and hovered very steadly considering it was a little windy out. I flew it about 100 meters out with no issues with wind so I decided to bring it up and send it out a little further I had it close to a mile out with the FPV going and no issues quite amazing for the distance I had it. After about 20 mins I heard my controller beep to let me know it had 2 bars left of battery and an about 4-5 mins later here comes the drone hovering over my head from where I took off from how cool is that I was able to fly my drone out of my sight an it knew to come back when it had low battery.  As far as design of this drone it was built solid not cheap plastic which I was also impressed with I honestly think that's why it handled well in the wind. So far this is my go to drone lately when I want to get good pics/video it has a crisp picture and pretty steady not as shaky as most drone videos are. It has a slot for sd card to record all your pics and videos so I was able to record some awesome footage and watch it on my smart tv in 4k. My overall experience with this drone really has been great and only complaint is I wish the controller was rechargeable but I was able to fix that with buying my own rechargeable batteries which on the controller it shows the battery life of controller and the drone so that way I know when my rechargeable batteries are ready to be charged which is great instead of guessing when its time to charge. Very easy drone to fly so its good for the rookies and the pros I am hard person to impress and I admit that but like I said I could not be happier with this purchase thanks holy stone I look forward to doing more business with you in the future.

title: Great drone with a lot of nice features
text: I chose a day with a steady 8-10 MPH breeze and found that it provided a little challenge to keep it hovering over one spot.  But it flew great.  I had flown RC aircraft a few years ago and found this drone much easier to control.  I have had numerous contacts with Holy Stone and they are very supportive and encouraging.  I think that part of their mission, other than profit, is promoting the expansion of drone enthusiasts.  Since this is my first experience flying a drone I cannot speak to other manufacturers products, but I would highly recommend the Holy Stone HS720 4K drone for ease of use, customer service, and providing a great product at a reasonable price.

title: Set up and customer service
text:
I ordered this drone from Amazon. I had difficulty with the set up, (it was my fault partially) There were no instructions I found. Later with another (same) drone from HS, I discovered a black folder with great instructions. It may have been in with the original one and I missed it in the black zippered compartment. Anyway I sent it back without giving it a chance. Now I have another one with instructions and the set up was simple step by step. The drone works great. I appreciate the gimbal turning the camera down 90deg for precise landing. Do I love this drone? Definitely! However I have to fly it in calm conditions until I get more experience with it.
I reccommend.

title: It's a good place to start
text:
I've had no problems from box to flight with this unit. My first flight was on a semi windy day, about 9 mph winds. It did handle pretty well, and stayed for the most part in one place. I do like the camera being a 4k. The software for the phone downloaded well, however I'm still not able to use certain function on this app. I think it's due to my Phone's model Moto G. But I'm able to view the flight through this app. I would recommend finding apps that helps you with the drone weather. This will help in determine whats a good day to fly.
My first drone I had a few years ago ended up in the trees. This flight went very well. Note, the higher you fly the more the drone tends to drift. There's alot of wind you can't see the higher you get, give your self plenty of room.
I think this drone is going to handle what I'm looking for. I was able to log into the faa.gov site and register this aircraft, and I looking forward to getting my drones license. At this point you don't have to this, but these regulations are coming. It's also best to get on the faa.gov site and look over the Drones regulations as well.
A question I had to HolyStone, they answered back fairly quickly. Again, I don't think you can go wrong with this purchase.

title: Good and functional drone for all levels
text: When we started looking for a drone to use, everything continued to indicate that this drone was the best option. It certainly does not disappoint. Equipped with a phenomenal camera, easy-to-use interface, and quick and simple set-up, this drone is fool proof, even for the most entry level hobbyist.

title: Great for a drone beginner!
text: Just received mine today. Easy to use, easy instructions and great camera. Flown in 0 degree weather and worked perfect. I have flown it a few more times. Have gotten some great video.

title: Good Starter Drone
text:
When I received this copter as a birthday present in 2019, I was an absolute newbie. However, with the fairly clear instructions and after downloading the app, I was up and running in no time! I will get obsessed with it for about a week, and then neglect it for months on end, so I've never really gotten proficient with it; but I'm retiring soon and hope to be able to dedicate more time. It has been very forgiving of my learning cure, and multiple ugly crashes have not resulted in any debilitating damage to the fuselage or the rotors.

My impression is that the controls are very sensitive and make shooting smooth video somewhat difficult, but I see other posters' clips and think it may just be my lack of skill. I get 30 full minutes of operational time, but a spare battery would be great since the charging time with the included USB charger is quite long - about six hours. My biggest personal problem relates to my "old eyes;" it is difficult to transition from following the copter to the controls with reading glasses. If I get another plane it will have the ability to interface with a VR headset.

title: Suicidal drone
text:
Terrible drone has mind of its own and all it wanted to do is die.
Followed the instructions and started off at an open field, everything is good until it takes off ,the very next moment it goes away and crashes. I don‚Äôt recommend at all.

title: Not Totally Satisfied
text: This drone is ok. The battery charger is absolute trash. That alone would make me not want to buy it. It states that it can operate for so many minutes before charging, but that is misleading. The run time is the time using both batteries. So you may not need to charge, but you do have to stop flying and change batteries. Also, don‚Äôt operate it in your house. My cabinet doors look like they were attacked by saw blades because I thought it would be cool. Absolutely not.

title: Excellent drone for beginners!
text: This is our first drone and it is really easy to learn for beginners! We were surprised at how good the quality of the video and pictures were and how quiet this drone is! The app makes it very easy as well and there are some cool features like calling it home and it turns around when the battery is low. We are excited to fly some more and practice getting really cool shots! The only thing I didn't like was when you have the camera angled all the way up you can see the blades in the frame.

title: Nice drone
text: All

title: Very Nice so far.
text: Very user friendly.

title: Great fun
text: My son and daughter love this. Very easy to fly

title: It's good
text: I had to call support because it wasn't connecting to wifi and the remote properly. Turns out I was the only problem. After the HS110G this is so much better. Had two of those and it was one failure after another with that model. Poor quality control. This however is awesome HS 720k. Had this flying with the remote 1st  5 minutes. Connecting to the phone and the remote took longer than that, but worth it. Great video but no sound. The HS110G had a sound option but I wasn't able to activate it as I couldn't get everything to work.

title: AVoid ALL Holystone products
text: This company is based in Schenzen, where they source cheap parts via the Chinese market and use low quality connectors in their production . None have the TPS option , keeping connectors from backing out of their sockets .  I have had so many quality issues with Schenzen based drone MFG's.  You want to make your spouse happy? souce DJI/EXO both USA mfg's , a bit more in cost, but quality far exceeds these toys , and yes , they do source parts that are MFG in China, but made to a US MFG spec , and that makes all the difference. Let's support US companies .

title: Excellent drone and takes beautiful pictures and video
text: This is our first drone.  I researched drones for awhile and bought this one due to recommendations from other drone users.  It is easy to fly, takes great video and pictures, and comes in a really nice case.  Unfortunately, after using it a few times, we had problems (not with the drone, but our own ability) and it crashed into our garage door and broke the propeller arm off.  We didn't think it was repairable but called Holy Stone customer service anyway.  We found out they do not repair drones but told us to send them a picture of it and they would do what they could to help us.  Immediately after receiving the picture, they sent a link of a You Tube video that shows how to repair it and sent us the parts we needed.  I can't think of any other company I have dealt with that was so quick to respond and helpful.  Excellent product and customer service. We will definitely buy from them again.

title: It's a bad purchase
text:
You'd probably be better off buying a 'used' or 'refurbished DJI drones than this one.
1. Control stickers aren't on the remote, foolish to assume everyone knows the standard controls
2. Drone is not very nimble, or responsive to controls takes a while for it to respond
3. Follow me feature doesn't work
4. Cannot fly in the slightest wind
5. Camera is worse than the ones that came in phones 10-15 years ago
6. No support

title: Updated! Thought there was only one battery but second was hiding! Great Customer Service!!
text: When I initially reviewed this drone I had thought it only came with one battery rather than the two it was supposed to have. I was wrong. The second was hiding and the super helpful customer service rep helped me find it. Afterwards, the company even reached out via email also to make sure I got the no longer missing battery before Christmas. This company really does have wonderful customer service. Hopefully my son loves the drone. He will.open it tomorrow! Thank you Holy Stone!

title: Easy to fly. Camera‚Äôs stability is lacking. Excellent customer service and support.
text: Drone is fast and not too difficult to fly. Camera takes great pictures and videos. Major drawback is the stability of the camera.  Quite jiggly.  Every time drone comes to a stop; camera wobbles exceedingly up and down while drone is stabilizing itself. Furthermore, drone‚Äôs flight range is great but far exceeds camera‚Äôs bluetooth connectivity; whether it be distance or height. Contacted Costumer Service and response was prompt and courteous.

title: great drone for the price.
text: The hs720 is a great drone. Its easy to fly and takes pretty good pictures and video. Their customer service is outstanding. If you have any issues they are more than happy to help. Good customer service is hard to find these days.

title: HS720 Very  Nice.  Easy to Use.

I explained what happened and they said they would send me a new drone. I received the new drone, which has been updated. Love it. Great customer service. Thank you HOLY STONE
I wrote the review below when I first bought this drone. Have to do a update review. The drone was working great and then just fell out of the sky. It fell in some woods. I found it and now it will not turn on. Not sure where can I get it fixed. Not to happy

I love this drone. It was very easy to learn how to fly and comes right back to back to you with the push of one button. The drone folds up into a very small carrying case and would fit right in to a back pack. It takes great pictures and video. Would recommend for almost any age, its that easy to fly. You do need a cell phone to fly it also

title: Great drone for beginner.
text: This drone is the perfect drone for someone like myself who is just starting out.  Easy operation and has returned home perfectly each time.  Just remember to calibrate each time you use.

title: This is a real drone not a child‚Äôs toy.
text:
Let me start that I‚Äôm 61 years old and not a gamer. I read the instructions 3 times. I‚Äôm good with electronics. I had to get my son to show me how to fly this drone. This is not a toy this is a high tech. The video is amazing.
If your a gamer you probably could fly this drone in 15 min. My son just laughed at me and said don‚Äôt worry Dad your just a old timer. He told me at least I made a good choice. I‚Äôll just use this drone as a bonding tool to spend time with my son. üòÉ

title: Unstable
text: It works, nice video, but kind of unstable in flight.  Probably good for the price point, though.

title: Best drone for the buck!
text:
I love the drone but i lost signal n it took off
I literally got it today and was super excited but now I can‚Äôt find it.. plus my iPhone 11 screen shattered because of the controllers poor design because I couldn‚Äôt fit it in slot without taking my case off smh.. so please be careful people..

UPDATE: Holy Stone refunded me my money and sent me another drone for free. I am extremely satisfied and impressed with their speedy customer service! Best drone for beginners, it has all the features as them $1000 drones do but for the price you can‚Äôt beat it. I think also would alter the controller to fit your phone better that‚Äôs the only minor set back on this drone honestly.

title: Drone fun
text: Very good design, I purchased because of the reviews on YouTube. I learned drones are more difficult to fly than it looks. Plan on crashing a lot at first. I was disappointed because the propeller screws cam loose and I lost some blades and screws, manual didn‚Äôt mention checking that, but a little common sense should have let me know..lol. Also these drones are NOT toys. Would purchase again. Probably will after I destroy this one. I only gave a three star rating because I‚Äôm a beginner and my rating is based on that.

title: Awesome drone!
text: Awesome drone and compact for travel. Great options and stable too. Easy enough to learn and take great video and pictures for this price range of drones

title: FUN & EASY!
text: [[VIDEOID:9c9a40c940355e70aa7d44d964cc97bc]] I bought this as a birthday present for my husband. He flew the drone first try like a pro. He did sit down and read (all) directions and made sure it was calibrated correctly. I did buy a 2nd battery which I do advise, since it takes 6 hours to charge a single battery. Happy with my purchase, and he's happy with his birthday gift!

title: Wow....small foldable drone with big heart!
text:
Love the fact that when the HS720 is unfolded that it has almost the size of HS700D and same power and flight time!
The HS700D weighs 600 grams with battery and the HS720 weighs 475 grams with battery. The HS720 folds down to fit in your hand! The HS720 has long flight time just like the HS700D. The stable 2K photo and video capability is awesome with no jello like shaking problems due to the good vibration dampers. The build quality is great and Drone is worth every penny! Buy it!

title: Great features with exceptional customer support
text:
I did a lot of research on the $200 to $700¬† drones going on sale for black Friday. I found the Holystone HS720 on Amazon with a cyber Monday deal. After much reading of reviews and watching videos on YouTube especially one from "Captain Drone" l decided to go with the HS720. It has features that are usually seen on drones that are twice the price.¬† It's advertised run time is 26 minutes. I have not flown it that long yet. It takes good pictures not as many camera options as the dji but at half the price it's good enough. The camera can remotely tilt 90¬∞, allowing you a variety of angles.

It uses GPS and has an assisted Intelligent Flight function to help you supposedly never lose your drone. The drone should automatically return to you whenever the battery is running low or when the signal is lost. I have heard of some fly always but the customer service reps have been replacing the drones. If you go online to the Holy Stone groups on Facebook you will soon learn that Holy Stone customer service is exceptional, which is a very important feature to me.

This is my first drone and I am very happy with it. Also it is a very quiet drone and comes with it's own compact carry case.

title: Great drone
text: I have tried a couple of other drones first and this one tops them all. It is a great drone for beginners like me. The camera is really nice and takes good pics and videos. It‚Äôs really nice to be able to adjust the camera in flight. I would recommend buying this drone to friends.

title: Amazing product and incredible customer service
text: This is an amazing unit.  I was hesitant ordering it, but I didn't want to shell out the money for a DJI Mavic 2 Pro.  Amazon offered this as an alternative and wow, was I pleasantly surprised when it arrived.  Very well-crafted drone, full of features that rival the DJI Mavic 2 Pro.  The carry case is tough, durable and fits the drone precisely.  The drone is easy to fly and if you are new to drone flight, the unit makes it easy to learn.  Love the flight time, but also, I was shocked when the company swiftly addressed my questions with detailed answers.  I highly recommend.

title: Easy to use for beginner and fun.
text:
After a false start with the HS700 model (it did not work) I got this instead. I liked the packaging with included box but came to realize that it is not convenient because it is only large enough for the included accessories and nothing else. I've purchased an extra charger because the included one is so slow and I've also acquired three additional batteries for the same reason.

Also, the shape and construction of the charger is awful. There is no way to lay the battery flat on a surface and attach it securely to the charger. The only option is to line the parts up delicately and place it in a location where it won't be disturbed because the slightest disturbance will disconnect the charger from the battery. I am 3D-printing cradles to solve this problem.

As a beginner with no experience (with UAVs - I am a Part 61 pilot of "real" aircraft) - I cannot compare this to other drones. I can report that it is easy enough to learn to fly but there are plenty of gotchas that can creep up on the inexperienced operator and the included manual is spartan, only covering basic operation.

My biggest concern and warning to users would be to check the propeller screws for tightness after about each hour of flight time. They work themselves loose, something I learned the hard way and was fortunate enough to discover during a takeoff when a propeller separated from the drone. Given my experience with airplanes, I should have thought of this myself, but I didn't. This should be in the instruction/maintenance manual. I would put Loctite on the screws but I plan to replace the blades regularly as they get worn from occasional mishaps.

Beyond that, beware the return-to-home feature, how it works, how its parameters can be set and under what circumstances it is initiated and how/when it can be disabled. Think through the implications carefully. Failing that, never fly the drone when the battery indicator is below 3 bars, or if you do, only fly it near the ground within a very short distance with no tree canopy. Google around on this. 'Nuff said.

The Ophelia Go app does not run on my main phone. It gives no clue why and there is no good reason for it. I suspect the SW has code to do a rooted check and they don't disclose this but I have not investigated further. This is annoying, but the positive side is I can leave my main phone connected to the Internet while the dedicated flight phone is using the drone as a WAP and is thus offline.

I've tried the orbit mode and the snap to path mode and they seem to work but I haven't use them extensively enough to comment further.

Also, I purchased a pair of Firehouse Arc 2 strobes to velcro to the front (white) and rear (red). This is extremely helpful in assuring I have visual confirmation of the craft's location and orientation at all times. Prior to installation, I would sometimes momentarily lose sight of the drone or become unsure of its orientation amongst visual background clutter. The strobes eliminate this problem. This also increases visibility for others, airborne and otherwise. I think all drones of this weight should have such strobes integrated. It's annoying to spend $60 for a pair of blinkin' lights but necessary in my opinion.

Finally, I attached reflective tape - red on the left side and green on the right for additional safety. It is only slightly helpful at close range, but not really necessary.

As to competition, I've found a seemingly comparable drone at a slightly lower price that actually includes a 3-gimbal mounted camera. Nevertheless, I'm happy with this purchase and the photos and video I've gotten are OK with the simple shock absorber/dampening system of this device. This is only a toy and a learning experience for me.

And my cats are only slightly wary of the craft. A neighborhood dog lost its mind and I had to land it so he would calm down.

UPDATE: The Ophelia Go app does run on my rooted main phone. I apparently missed a warning prompt about not having Internet connectivity in earlier attempts to use it. AOS warns the user about this after connecting to the drone WAP and the user must explicitly accept the condition before completing the connection. I think I missed this because the prompt times out.

Also, I took off yesterday by using the throttle only with no pause to a fast ascent. The craft started drifting off position dramatically and my attempts to control it led to amplified oscillations leading to a crash. I suspect that sensor calibration - possibly compass - was somehow knocked off by my method of operation but I really don't know why it happened and it is very concerning. I await a spare part to replace a broken propeller arm.

I also ordered a XIMI X8 SE 2020 because I'm hooked and I want to get some stable video. I tried image stabilization in post-processing but the results were unsatisfactory. Nevertheless, the HS720 has produced some interesting and useful videos for me.

title: Easley
text: Great for beginners

title: Cool beginner Drone comes with nice features and extras (RTF) - quality issues
text:
This is my first drone. I had been holding out until i could find nice features at a decent price and i think this is it. I used to fly mini RC planes for a few years but got tired of the hobby and was running out of places i had room to fly.
The drone rekindled my RC interest with the features, price and limited space needed to fly.

The drone has many auto features that are very handy. The auto take-off and landing is nice to have when your new. I didn‚Äôt trust it at first so I did both myself but when I used it it handled the job well.
The noise level of the drone in flight isn‚Äôt bad. If you get this about 20feet in the air you don‚Äôt hear much of it so you don‚Äôt have to worry about this drone attracting a lot of attention.

The camera quality is ok. This is something I would like to upgrade at some point. However for the price I can live with it.
The FPV camera transmission is a a second or two behind reality so be aware of that when flying that way.
The drone flys well. Responds to input well and is easy to control, even in small spaces. If you fly this in small spaces you wont get to enjoy all the features.
The extras are a case and controller.

A couple negatives about the drone. THe app has crashed on my IPAD pro while recording/transmitting but I have recorded on my iPhone for a full season with no issues so I would say the app is 100% reliable at this point for all devices.

I‚Äôd recommend This drone to other new comers. Just read the instructions and make small movements on the controls. You‚Äôll figure it out in no time.

Update: after owning for a week and flying daily I started to notice the fpv range on mine is shorter then listed in the manual. I can only get 100m before it drops out and 125m before it is total gone. Make all the app controls almost useless.
Went flying yesterday and almost immediately after I launch the drone (used safe lift-off button) the drone wanted to fly away on me. Not like wind moving it but control inputs were wrong. Constant forward and to the right drift. I would counter on the controls and after 20 seconds it seemed to work properly. I enjoyed the rest of the flight no issue for the whole battery. Went out this morning and same issue after lift off except this time it really pulled forward and to the right. I tried to increase altitude to see if I could get more space from the ground but it started to speed away on me. I hit return to home and it started to turn but went down at an angle very fast and crashed. Not sure why it seems to get lost like that.
I did buy 2 of these drones, 1 for me 1 for my son. His doesn‚Äôt seem to have this issue at all. He also gets double the fpv range on his hs720 @ ~300m.
I think something was up with mine from the beginning not sure if a component failed or something was damaged in shipping.

title: Cool beginner Drone comes with nice features and extras (RTF) - quality issues
text:
This is my first drone. I had been holding out until i could find nice features at a decent price and i think this is it. I used to fly mini RC planes for a few years but got tired of the hobby and was running out of places i had room to fly.
The drone rekindled my RC interest with the features, price and limited space needed to fly.

The drone has many auto features that are very handy. The auto take-off and landing is nice to have when your new. I didn‚Äôt trust it at first so I did both myself but when I used it it handled the job well.
The noise level of the drone in flight isn‚Äôt bad. If you get this about 20feet in the air you don‚Äôt hear much of it so you don‚Äôt have to worry about this drone attracting a lot of attention.

The camera quality is ok. This is something I would like to upgrade at some point. However for the price I can live with it.
The FPV camera transmission is a a second or two behind reality so be aware of that when flying that way.
The drone flys well. Responds to input well and is easy to control, even in small spaces. If you fly this in small spaces you wont get to enjoy all the features.
The extras are a case and controller.

A couple negatives about the drone. THe app has crashed on my IPAD pro while recording/transmitting but I have recorded on my iPhone for a full season with no issues so I would say the app is 100% reliable at this point for all devices.

I‚Äôd recommend This drone to other new comers. Just read the instructions and make small movements on the controls. You‚Äôll figure it out in no time.

Update: after owning for a week and flying daily I started to notice the fpv range on mine is shorter then listed in the manual. I can only get 100m before it drops out and 125m before it is total gone. Make all the app controls almost useless.
Went flying yesterday and almost immediately after I launch the drone (used safe lift-off button) the drone wanted to fly away on me. Not like wind moving it but control inputs were wrong. Constant forward and to the right drift. I would counter on the controls and after 20 seconds it seemed to work properly. I enjoyed the rest of the flight no issue for the whole battery. Went out this morning and same issue after lift off except this time it really pulled forward and to the right. I tried to increase altitude to see if I could get more space from the ground but it started to speed away on me. I hit return to home and it started to turn but went down at an angle very fast and crashed. Not sure why it seems to get lost like that.
I did buy 2 of these drones, 1 for me 1 for my son. His doesn‚Äôt seem to have this issue at all. He also gets double the fpv range on his hs720 @ ~300m.
I think something was up with mine from the beginning not sure if a component failed or something was damaged in shipping.

title: Don‚Äôt bother

text:
Everytime I calibrated the drone and had in GPS mode it would either Toilet bowl really badly, or would drift off 20-30 feet to one side or other. I packed it back in box it came in, got in contact with Amazon and sent drone back. Ended up getting a Ruko F11 GIM. Took it out after it came and thing held GPS position very well and worked Great.
After return Holy Stone contacted me, we discussed issues and Holy Stone has sent out a Replacement HS720 Drone. So I am going camping tomorrow and will leave another update once I return from camping.

title: Had a problem, but they fixed it... edit. New problem now.
text:
Super easy to fly until it doesn't respond and crashes. I just got this yesterday and it worked great! It definitely worked better just flying it alone and not attached to the phone. I think other wifi networks mess with it so it's less responsive.

Anyway, this was BS how this happened. I'm a pretty decent drone pilot, and usually fly free mode drones, this is my first GPS drone so it's super easy to handle. It worked great yesterday for one flight after the battery charged. Worked for one full battery today... then just now not even 3 minutes into my flight and I'm bring I back down to land and it decides to just flop over upside-down causing the damage seen in the pic. less than 24 hours it took for this thing to malfunction. Hopefully they fix my issue for me.

Edit* they sent a brand new drone free of charge.

Edit again* the free one they sent only connected the GPS once, hasn't connected since and hasn't been able to be flown at all. I've been so busy with work I've only tried a few times to troubleshoot, but solved nothing. Just get an Exo Drone or save up for a DJI, the extra BS you have to go through to get something that works isn't worth a free anything.

title: Issues with remote communication
text:
I read the reviews here and watched multiple video reviews of this drone, HS720, prior to purchase.
Reviews were decent, the price and what seems to be "quality" looked good so I took a chance.
Ended up having similar issues as many other have stated.
I was calm day, sunny, and I was at a park that usually has other remote planes flying in it ... There was no one else there this day.
First fight was just up and then panned about 90 degrees then hit the home button. (all good)
Landed within about two feet of take off.
Set back in original start place, started up, took off, up about 30 feet, panned about 90 degrees again, then decided to fly forward, good, then back, at that point the drone acted like it was hit by a gust of wind and started going around in a circle. I hit home, no response, it circled lower and the crashed into the grass, no damage.
Turned the drone off and back on recalibrated and tried again. Same issue, once I attempted anything other than panning it would start a large circle. (Toilet Bowl)
On this last try it circled until it hit a tree and broke an arm.
I have email into Holystone but it's the holiday weekend so I'll have to wait.
Will update if and when I know more.
For now, I have a broken drone that I would not trust flying ever again, even if fixed.
Had about 3 minutes of actual time that I could control and fly it.
Hoping the service is as good as other claim.

title: It is a $250 Drone - Remember That!
text: This was my first drone purchase.  I was so excited and impressed with the concept of aerial photography that within two weeks I upgraded the drone for a better quality camera drone.  During that two weeks I managed to crash the HS720 several times and one crash critically damaging the drone.  I replaced the HS720 with another one and around that same time my upgraded camera drone (Mavic Mini) arrived and I started flying that one exclusively.  The HS720 did not get much (if any) flight time.  So it was stored away fro several months.  When the Mavic Air2 was released I purchased it and then that drone became my primary and still is to this day.  I do fly the Mini from time to time and often fly both the Air2 and the Mini at the same time.  Especially when doing sunset shots where the drone is hovering stationary.  Recently I offered the HS720 to a friend for a vacation weekend use.  I figured I should reacquaint myself with the Holy Stone drone and the Ophelia app.  After flying the DJI drones for nearly a year it was extremely difficult to go back to flying the HS720.  I have flown the drone extensively these past two days to ensure I could at least answer a question when posed by my friend borrowing the drone.  As other reviews have stated, this drone is not very stable in flight.  Hovering is generally a 3 to 5 foot (1-1.5 meters) affair as the drone refuses to be stable when hovering.  The controls are very sensitive.  When directing the drone to go backwards if the joystick is at all anything back directly pushed back the drone will go off in side way directions.  You have to be very careful flying this drone and have plenty of open space for it when the controls do not do exactly what you were intending.  The past two days I have nearly crashed the drone several times.  Don't get cocky!  Is it a bad drone?  It's not horrible, but it is no DJI that is for sure.  But it cost $250!  It's not going to be a DJI drone.  Is it a good drone?  It's not great, but it is relatively good (3 stars).  It is a decent beginner drone, but for a "beginner" drone it is very difficult to fly with confidence.  I tell you I really struggled several times in controlling the drone.  Be patient and don't do quick movements with it until you become very proficient.  Fly it in LOW mode!  Keep it within site and if you panic as you are about to hit something - remember what I already said - fly it in wide open space!  So if you buy this drone, fly it carefully and cautiously.  I really believe that 99% of crashes are pilot errors and not the drone's fault.  Although drones can have a mind of their own as well.  Even my DJI Mavic Air2 decided to take a 200 foot (60 meters) nosedive one day for no apparent reason - destroying it! (Thankful for DJI insurance).  So buy it, fly it for a while, then upgrade to a higher end drone like the Air2 and you will be amazed how much easier it is to fly.  Best of luck with your drone purchase and enjoy the hobby.  I certainly do.

It takes very good pictures and video and being able to adjust the camera angle is a must.  I am trying to load a video for this review but Amazon is not letting me for some reason. text:
This has been the best, most entertaining and fulfilling purchase I have made in ages. Don't let the price fool you, this thing is awesome!! It was extremely easy to learn to fly, and the quality of video images are nothing short of incredible!

My plan was to buy this unit as an eventual throw away to learn with, and then move on to a high dollar unit.

Thing is, why would I? This thing is a blast to fly, and it is free from the restrictions and requirements of the larger, heavier drones. This isn't a commercial class done, but it feels so much better than any "toy class" drone that I have experienced. The video imagery is breathtaking, and unit is highly responsive, with smooth flight and transitions. I'm honestly hoping that Holy Stone is working on their next quad copter product. The HS720 is amazing, but from what I see with this company, they will continue to develop and design the most amazing products for the consumer.

Thank you Holy Stone!!

Update: I had an incident caused by local interference. I contacted Holy Stone in an attempt to save my drone. Holy Stone stands behind their products, and their customers. I cannot begin to express how great their product and their Customer Service is.

title: Excellent drone for the price! (At least I thought it was...)
text:
***Update 6/13/20***

After a few flights I couldn't get over the camera quality. The pictures it takes have a purple hue to them and are very very digitized looking. Not to mention the propellers showing up in the photos and the fish eye effect. The video is shakey due to a two axis gimble. There is no way it is recording in 4k either. It shows a lot of "jello" and pixelization. It just doesn't look good.

I researched more about DJI and ending up getting a Mavic Air Mini. For the price difference I felt it was the better choice for me.

The HS720 isn't a bad drone. It is very capable and flys well. Distance is questionable and we as the picture and video quality for me.

I was looking at picking up a new one for a bit...I had previously purchased a pretty inexpensive one for my daughter for Christmas a few years back. In the hopes she would use it more than me...well...I used it more than her and was looking for something more substantial.

I had looked at the more expensive brand (DJI) my neighbor has one and they are very nice...however...I'm still new to the game and didn't want to drop that much on something that I need to learn more about. I came across the Holy Stone HS720. I read the reviews, watched the video reviews. Saw videos and pictures the drone has taken and I decided for the price and everything it offers this would be the one...actually it was between this and the HS270...I decided since it was my birthday the HS720 was it!

I took it out for one flight yesterday and it performed pretty well...it was too windy to do much of anything else, but it handled well and did what I wanted it to do! I will update more once I give it a full workout!

So far very pleased with the purchase, it is well built, it does not feel cheap at all and the carrying case is top notch! Very pleased with my purchase!
