title: Excellent drone with great picture and video quality!
text: Really impressed with this drone. The case it comes with is perfect. I will say that an instructional video would be perfect for a beginner or even intermediate to make sure they know what they‚Äôre doing. All in all, definitely recommend.

title: Holy Stone HS720
text:
Just recently purchased the Holy Stone HS720. The maiden flight didn't goes as well as I thought it would due to MY error. :/.
The Holy Stone HS720 is a top notch drone with many things to learn. With repetitive flying that learning curve will diminish. I absolutely love flying the Holy Stone HS720.
My only dislike is the connection between the Battery and USB Battery charger. It's kinda like the charger just sits there and I've found a couple times where the charger had fallen out of the Battery. That is my only dislike. :)
All in All A++++++

title: Dron
text: I liked everything except the control does not hold the cell very well

title: Compact and reliable.
text: The folding design is excellent for space savings. They included a very travel friendly semi-hard case. Images and videos captured are the best I have seen from this brand. Onboard GPS and Optical sensor make it very steady and reliable when in the air. Long lasting 26mins of flight time.

title: simple to fly
text: This was my first drone and I found it was fast to learn and easy to fly  The photos and videos were outstanding.  most importantly I had a problem and I called them on a Sat. afternoon and they were there and the company followed through on what they promised in a timely matter.  Great company

title: Thanks
text: Excelente drone easy to fly and recorded

title: Great drone and response time.
text: I ordered the holystone 720E. It was delivered quickly and works perfect. Any questions I had got answered very quickly. I am very happy and highly recommend it.

title: Great drone, spend the time to get familiar with it before you get ambitious!
text:
This is a great, easy to fly (for a drone) product, although it's susceptible to being moved by even light breezes. While I was learning to fly it, I left it hovering in front of me while I was looking down at the controller. The wind blew in into me, which was really painful. But that's operator error, and not the drone's fault. Lesson learned!

Setting up and pairing the controller was easy. The controller has a mobile phone mount, which works well, although I had a bit of trouble getting the phone app set up properly. The QR code in the instruction book downloaded the Ophelia GPS app. I couldn't get it to work with my Galaxy S9 phone, but the text referenced the Ophelia Go app, which I downloaded manually and worked great.

This is a well made small aircraft, but definitely not a toy. Spend the time in an open, still place with lots of room (not inside) to get to know the controls and how the drone responds before you take it into the real world!

title: Received defective drone but made right by Holy Stone in less than 48 hours!
text: I received a defective drone that departed controlled flight and none of the failsafe features activated or worked.  It climbed out of sight and then departed for parts unknown and is lost.  That kind of stuff happens from time to time with complex electronic gear.  But what makes this an exception 5 star review is that Holy Stone made this right by getting me a replacement in less that 48 hours after contacting them.  The customer support rep on chat (Roxanne..LOL) was exceptionally polite.  They are obviously working out of China as the hours of operation are 5:50 pm PST until 1200 pm PST.  Her English was close to perfect, she was patient, prompt and POLITE.  I cannot say enough good about this company.  Their product is exceptionally priced for the amount of features.  As I said, these are complex electronic devices using numerous types of frequencies and satellites....stuff happens.  This company understands that and makes sure that their customer is first and foremost and makes things right.  I cannot recommend them any more highly.  Simply the best.

title: Excelente
text: Muy f√°cil de usar

title: Great drone and package.
text: The HS 720 is the whole package it's well worth more than the money. The package includes so much you would expect to pay much more for this kind of quality. The support you have available from Holy Stone is above and beyond. Very helpful, and responsive.

title: Great first drone
text: This is my first drone and I didn‚Äôt want to spend a bunch of money but also didn‚Äôt want a piece of junk. Overall I think this is a great drone. Still learning how to fly it but great for a beginner. Calibrating it every time is a little annoying but if that‚Äôs the least of my worries I‚Äôll take it. I will also be looking at getting another battery when available.

title: Flies amazing for a lower prices drone
text: Right out of the box I was impressed with this drone. This is my first drone ever and it was pretty simple to set up. The only problem I had at first was with the compass calibration. Got it figured out and then took it out on a first flight. This thing gets you excited to fly it every time and the video quality to me is pretty good. I since have learned to fly it pretty good now after a couple of function control flights. Have seen my neighborhood from an aerial view now which is sooo cool. I'm learning more and more each day with this drone. I'm very happy with my purchase and would recommend this drone to anyone who love to or wants to fly these things. Even my kids are so amazed by it's flight. I'm glad I researched and purchased this drone. Do yourself a favor and buy this one if your looking to get into drone flying. You won't be disappointed. I love it.

title: Great first impressions
text: Drone just arrived today, first impressions were great the case that come with it is absolutely amazing everything fits and is neatly stored. The directions were easy to understand and the app was free. Great drone I would recommend this for sure.

title: Easy to use
text: I flew the drone this past weekend for the first time and it was awsome. Took some amazing pictures of our property and I picked up on how everything works pretty easy.

title: Nice! Very stable
text:
I've been buying and playing with small drones for years. Never have I seen one this stable. WELL DONE! Second, I crashed it in a branch of a tree, I thought it was done. To my surprise the 25 foot fall was survivable. Inspected it and sent it up again. Great flight time, I got 30 min on it and it still had more. Great case comes with it too!
All this little guy needs is another battery.

Update: They want you to jump through hoops to get a second battery for free ie: rate 5 star, write a review, get your email and phone number.... ect. I personally think that is shady and bad business.
Oh yeah, NO EXTRA BATTERY SENT! after you do all their requested tasks. Not cool. So be warned... don't expect anything.
Update: Purchased on 9/28/19 Fast shipping. 1st update 3/15/20
Shortly after the 1st update I received a battery, a charger and a set of blades. 3/10/20

title: Not recommended for beginner but good quality
text: Purchased for 16 year old he likes it probably a little more for a 16 year old who isn‚Äôt totally savvy with drone but a good one to start out with to learn  comes with extra blades needed for beginners

title: Easy To Learn and Use
text: The Drone was ready really quickly, just charge the battery and follow a couple of simple instructions and its flying. The app was super intuitive, so the photos and videos were easy to take and load onto my computer.

title: For the price it's a really good drone
text: Very quiet for quad copter. Special features work well. Customer support was great. Had run in with cherry tree, new arm was ordered and installed in record time. I am very happy with this drone.

title: Great Value!
text: Highly recommend this drone.  All the features I was looking for at a great price.  Took a little while to learn how to calibrate it - put it on the ground and turn it (3) complete turns clockwise then turn it with the camera facing straight up and turn it another (3) times clockwise.  Put it back on the ground and wait a minute or two...done!

title: Good quality for the price!
text: It's no DJI, but it's not bad either. A little touchy on the controls, but very robust. I have crashed it pretty good three times already and it's still kicking. The WIFI range needs to be much longer. But for the money it's not a bad drone. The camera is shaky as its not on a gimbal, but it does take good video.  All in all, its worth the money as you do get what you pay for. If you want cinema quality, this isn't your drone. If you want a good drone to learn on, this is it for sure!!

title: The Holy Stone
text: Nice drone, good value, good features like GPS.  Things can go wrong.  Make sure you have enough GPS signals or you‚Äôll be flying this thing against the wind which is difficult.  Video and photos are good.  SD micro card needs to be small 32 max.  Single axis gimbal means video can be shaky so flying steady is important.  Camera up/down movement is a bit jerky.  Might be unskilled operator.  I‚Äôm happy to fly this drone, my first.

title: Very nice
text: Great drone for the price. My 1st very easy to use and learn.

title: Great, stable, fun drone with decent camera
text: Amazing drone.  Easy to fly.  Have not tested out all features yet but having fun with it.  2k camera is great.  Not sure if there are blade guards to purchase somewhere.. had 2 small crash landings, my error.  Definitely worth the money.  Very stable flight.  Delivery was faster than expected and comes in a great case.  They have answered a few questions speedily.  Great beginner drone that makes it exciting for future purchases.  Great pics and videos.  Def recommended drone from a great company.

title: Ok drone
text: The Holly Stone is ok, a bit clumsy to use, not a lot of features.  Fortunately, I wrecked the Holly Stone and got a DJI.  Recommend you spend the extra bucks for a DJI.

title: Great Customer Service
text: I purchased this drone for my dad and he wanted me to leave this review: Thank you HolyStone for a great customer service department. The people I talked to were all wanting to make sure I was operating it right and happy with my purchase. I've been flying radio control for 8 years now and many of our club members are moving on to drones. None are as nice as my HS720. Pass a "ThankYou" on to customer service for me.  Thanks, Alex Lombardo

title: Fun Drone
text: We purchased this drone for our 11 year old daughter because we liked the features like "return home" and 4k video.  She learned to use it fairly quickly, although mastery will take some more time.  I wish there was a screen on the controller, but the phone attaches securely.  The battery like is long enough for a good session of play.  Sometimes it is a little fussy when we are trying to start it up, but once it gets going, it works well.  Overall, really good product for the price.

title: Great drone!
text: Received this drone as a gift and it is outstanding. I am new to drones so I was quite nervous but the set up was easy and learning to fly the drone was even easier. It takes great pics and videos, and battery life was good. I was also surprised by the lack of noticeable lag time on the video stream when flying the drone (I am sure there is technical language to say this easier). In any event, great drone!

title: GREAT DRONE WITH TONS OF FLIGHT TIME.
text: So I've had this drone for about a week or so now and I'm absolutely in love with it. I wanted a drone for a long time now and finally got myself one (thank you stimulus check üòâ). I've done alot of research on drones and I was looking for something with decent flight time and easy to handle and with the holy stone 720 it has all that and so much more. I havent even used all the features yet cause theres so many lol but I'm definitely looking forward to.... customer service is beyond helpful too. They responded to my emails almost instantly and helped me out ... I highly recommend this drone to everyone. I'm so so happy with this thing

title: Nice drone, cool features and great price!
text: This drone is great for beginners, its super easy to fly. Very cool features that include return to home, orbit flight and follow me. You can also plot a course on the map and the drone will follow. Its a high end drone for a great price. My only issue is the 5-7 hours for the battery to charge.

title: Worked great for a couple of uses
text: Worked great for a couple of uses, but then lost usability through the phone (no left or right turn anymore). Contacted customer service several times, and went through all the trouble shooting. Never heard back from them again. Getting a better brand now..."You get what you pay for".

title: Great drone easy to use fun to fly
text: It is an awesome drone. But you must pay attention to directions. I forgot to rotate before flying and it chased me around for a few before I got it back. Lol. Lots of fun and very user friendly.

title: Performs as advertised and a great value for beginners
text: [[VIDEOID:3a33ae97068537ea4899a729b546fa60]] The functions and features make for a great learning quad copter and so affordable in comparison to comparable quad copters.  I live by the coast and a constant off shore breeze, this little beast handles great.  The gps function is pretty amazing, reducing the risk of losing the quad copter.  Last but not least, the outstanding customer service, the best I‚Äôve had with Amazon sellers.

title: Holy Moly!!!!! Holy Stone Is First Class!!!!
text: [[VIDEOID:296da36e1695f5e218198ebc14734eec]] Holy Stone is a very good drone company,, I had a problem and it was corrected quickly than I expected,, my experience with HOLY STONE IS GREAT!!! My drone flys just like it‚Äôs supposed too,, I will recommend anyone who‚Äôs looking for a drone to buy from HOLY STONE

title: Awesome little drone
text: Very impressed with this drone.  Easy to use, and works very well.  Was looking at this one and the new DJI Mini Drone, and ended up going with this.. no regrets.  Great video, and operates very well.

title: Good Drone for the price
text: This is my first drone. I learned how to fly after about 3 flights. Its pretty durable. I would get the other battery because you only get 20min of flight per battery.  The real negative is that you lose video feed after about 80m. So the drone can go 300m but you cant see anything because your phone lost connection. So actually the usable space is much smaller than they advertise.  If you want to upgrade the streaming feed it you better a expert with electronics. NO WIFI NO VIDEO FEED.

title: Why it do that
text: I didn‚Äôt like it at all first time I used return to home it flew away never saw it again

title: Extremely excellent customer service
text: I need to say that this company customer service!!! WOW!!!! No need yo say that the drone is great!!

title: Very easy for novice/first time drone owners
text: [[VIDEOID:9e924c6f41eb90f26d16831caa104a73]] We were purchasing some property and I had a need to get above the tree line to see what was around us. I decided that the best approach would be to use a drone, so I started doing my research and decided on the Holy Stone HS720 based on other reviews and videos. I hit the nail on the head. I listened to the folks who said to "read the manual" and "watch the videos"- I would suggest that anyone following, do the same- it helped tremendously. This drone was extremely easy to fly from the get go and the automatic landing and return home functions are your best friends. I have a lot more testing to do but so far, super happy with my purchase.

title: WOW! HS720 Drone is Jam-Packed with Awesome Features that Perform as Promised
text:
[[VIDEOID:23ac3de0f154e8217f445f1c4f352f18]] I upgraded to the Holy Stone HS720 drone after gaining some flying experience with a toy drone and all I can say is ‚ÄúWOW‚Äù. After shopping and evaluating several drones, the HS720 is great value that is jam-packed with features and does not disappoint.
My first flight was delayed because the drone was delivered with a faulty remote. I called Holy Stone, got through immediately and spoke with a representative who was genuinely concerned about the problem. Shortly after hanging up I received an email asking to confirm my shipping address and took delivery of a new remote a few days later. The Holy Stone customer service experience is GREAT.
Equipped a new remote, I was ready for my first flight. The drone is easy to set-up and works perfectly out of the box. I was impressed with how take-off, hovering and steady flight control are all effortless using the responsive remote joysticks. The Follow Me, GPS return to home and Orbit functions all perform as promised from both the remote and the smartphone app. The camera is steady and the lens angle is easily controlled while viewing a high quality live image on a smartphone which fits securely in the remote. Foldable arms and carrying case make for a compact package that is perfect for grab and go. Be sure to pick up a micro SD card because the HS720 drone‚Äôs compact size and convenient carrying case will mean more flying opportunities and great quality images at locations that might otherwise be missed. The HS720 is lots of fun and I look forward to many enjoyable hours of use.

title: One Great Drone!
text: Love my Holy Stone 720!

title: First Flight
text:
[[VIDEOID:e527b3a7f50d3a490e356ace844d8d6]] After two emails my problem was solved. Answered within couple hours Just a beginner learning fast. Drone is easy to fly better then my first one. Batteries do last as they say, camera take good pictures and videos. Holystone people are fast, great to answer any questions. Recommend it? Yes

ken t

title: Fragile, ok video.
text: When this drone is working it works great, the problem is it doesn't get great range and it had FlyAway issues. I use return to launch and it took off into a tree on my first flight. It broke the shoulder piece that holds the arm which is not replaceable. I glued it up and flew again a week later. This time it was my fault that it crashed but it can only be repaired so many times. The video is shaky and washed out, and if it had better wifi range I would recommend it. My doesn't fit in the holder at all, so it's tough to film and fly at the same time. It's cheap, so I expected issues, but for me it's a no go.

title: Great Drone
text:
Android users may experience app connection issues. This has been associated with Motorola 5G, other models may vary.
My issues were resolved by putting the phone in Airplane mode then starting the WIFI connection. Everything works with M RC PRO app. I was *not* able to get the Ophelia Go app to work when the drone/phone were outside my home network area.
Other than a android specific connection and app issues this is great drone even for beginners.

title: easy to fly

I called  Holy Stone and they suggested a Galaxy A 71. which is the 3rd phone this month . I have not tried to link it yet as I am so tired of being disappointed.  I will try to link it this week end.  If I cant get it to link I will give the drone to my Brother.

title: Great drone

I also have another much larger drone that I fly regularly. I bought this one to carry in my truck all of the time but I'm afraid it is destined for the landfill. If you are a beginner not a good choice been flying a long time and still had problems not crashing it.

I feared I lost it a few times. I am still testing the drone and will update as I see any issues or positive things.

title: Flies Great

title: A preliminary Report on my HS720
text: I could not get the unit to recognize the GPS and compass location since I live up in a mountainous location. I shared my issue with HS and they suggested I look at a YT Video. I did review 2-3 videos and still could not get the unit to connect with GPS. So I was going to return the unit.. JUNE worked with me and told me to try in another location. I did and still no Joy. She decided to send me a new unit and told me NOT to return the old unit. They were apologetic about the delay in my enjoying the HS720. I have not even had the chance to fly the HS720 but I am in love with the attitude of the company and their commitment to their consumers and product. I worked in China for 15 years and have a feel for their manufacturing and TTF and find that Holy Stone's model is new and refreshing. Reputation, respectability, and product reliability are what is making this company Shine.  They have placed the bar far above many of their competitors. title: Great product backed by great customer service
text: The HS720 was just as described, easy to fly and comes in a very nice case with all you need to get started.  I had a minor camera problem which upon contacting the seller they rectified promptly and I am more than satisfied.  You will probably want to go ahead and order another battery.  The say it runs for 26 minutes but that seems to be a stretch.  My Iphone 8 plus barely fits in the controller holder and that is after taking off the OtterBox.  Overall I am very happy with my purchase.

title: My first Drone, won't be my last
text: Holy Stone HS720 is a very nice drone for anyone. I found it very easy to get the hang of it. I did watch a lot of videos to learn basics. I have gotten a lot smoother in my flights. Video is pretty nice, not great. Can get pixelated, motor vibration visible sometimes and not very smooth gimbal action.  But for the price point, I am very happy. The customer service and response is fantastic! That is very important.

title: Great drone
text: Great drone for  beginners, with lots of extras you usually only find on the more expensive models.

title: Customer service is superior!
text: The 720 is easy to understand and operate.  Customer support is immediate and thorough.

title: Great follow me!
text: Great fun! I bought a new onewheel and it follows me great with great footage! Also use this for my kids youtube Ruppy Puppies! Works great!

title: customer service/a good drone
text:
I reviewed a number of drones and settled on this one. It is not difficult to fly but as a beginner I maybe should have taken a bit more time to orient myself to the controls/features. The drone took a few knocks on grassy/sandy surfaces but was very durable and sturdy, no damage. We took the drone out to an open area that was primary concrete and I proceed to crash it into a wall and I mean "crash"! My son and I couldn't believe it wasnt in a pile of pieces.
The drone was only with minor physical damage but would no longer respond to the controls properly, I called the Holystone and explained to them what happened, they said "still under warranty send us some pictures of the drone damage and we will get a new one out to you". I notified them, sent the pics I received a brand new drone in less than 7 days. In the meantime I have oriented to the controls and will go to a open grassy place to safely orient myself to flying and not crashing! I first flew it at the beach so I got to work with the features before the battery ran out, it lasted as advertised for greater than 20min, the carrying case is nice.
I like the control hand set, my phone fits in without problems (iphone 11), a bigger phone may have a problem.
Nice screen controls, easy to visualize, nice features to bring the drone back to home. I should have purchased a landing pad right away and I do have one now. If I decided to upgrade in the future Holystone is where I'm going 1st. we're waiting for the rain to pass by and then get started on some flying.
So a very nice drone, the blades are in the pictures but for my 1st drone I'm not worried about that and one gets enough of a "scene" to crop if necessary. I like the features for the money that I spent.
The customer service! I have a feeling that they would have found a way to take care of me even if the warranty had expired, "a feeling".
All I wanted them to do was repair it, I would have paid for the repair. That's it, Thanks Holystone

title: Very good for a beginner
text: I had some issue on the first one then they send me a replacement I don‚Äôt have no problem on that the customer service is very good very professional thank you for your help

title: Great quality, awesome drone, reasonable price!
text: A great product for the price. Holy Stone is equivalent in quality to higher priced drones.

title: Excellent purchase
text:
Holy Stone 720G

This is a great drone, which you should purchase. It flies smoothly with very responsive controls. Want a great platform to both learn and execute terrific photos and stunning video? Pick one up without breaking the bank.

The HollyStone HS720G is a capable drone with lots of fancy features. Lots of opportunities to learn and grow on your drone journey. Buy one, it will make you happy and satisfied.

title: Super easy
text: Everything is great about it

title: Holy stone has been great
text: [[VIDEOID:147187ff034b91b825c95b32d5af2a65]] Great product works flys wonderful easy to learn thank you team holy stone

title: It flew away on its own
text:
Update they sent me. New one since mine flew away on its own. Great customer service.

Like others said it just went crazy and flew away. Up. Down. Right. Left. GPS home. Nothing worked and I watched it fly away. Gone forever.

title: Small and foldable
text: Holy stone drone HS720 looks some nice and amazing..

title: Proceed with caution..
text:
After a bit of research, I decided to give this unit a try. Out of the box (and charged up) it worked great. After an hour or so of fly time the drone lost its ability to hover in place and would start moving all around (usually starts in circles) when it should have been still. Once this starts, if you do not quickly regain control the unit will go out of control and eventually crash (while you are helplessly watching).

So, I returned for a replacement as I did really like it before the issue began. Received the replacement and similar story, out of the box it worked great, but in this case that only lasted around 15 minutes before the same issue began. I worked with customer service (who are very responsive) to try to see if it might be something I am doing or something I am missing but no solution. The replacement drone was returned, and I went with a different brand and am very happy with that purchase.

For the price point this is probably the best value out there, but there are clearly some defective units out in circulation. If it were not for the hovering issue, I would have definitely kept. But after 2 units with the same failure, I would not recommend. An out-of-control drone of this weight can be very dangerous, especially if you are planning to use around your neighborhood.

title: Great 1st drone!
text: Love this thing

title: Great flyer, can lose signal.
text: Im loving my HS720! App was easy to use have had an easy time learning to fly as this is my first one. My only issue is losing signal (WiFi from phone to drone) as it flys out of sight or more than 150 yards out. It will still respond to controls, but if you can‚Äôt see it, that‚Äôs tough.

title: Amazing Drone at an even better price!
text:
This drone is AMAZING!! When I unboxed it I was not expecting it to be so nicely packaged in it's own protective case. When I was looking at drones I did not know about Holy Stone at first but after reviewing different drone companies I found that they are a great company with great products. The HS720 is an impressive little drone and it is exactly what I was looking for. The foldable arms and the additional features like the follow me and the auto return home are great features for this drone. This was easy to connect to my phone and getting it setup to fly was easy too. The instructions are great and they provide a lot of great information without being overly complex. I have flown this quite a lot since I have gotten it and I found a few things that would be nice to have for add on accessories like longer landing legs so it is not landing directly on the body, new vinyl skins or other color body pieces and possibly and upgraded camera. I would highly recommend this drone to anyone looking for a great quality product that doesn't break the bank.
UPDATE - I have been flying this drone for a while now and it is even better than advertised or any of the other reviews. I have been able to fly it in cold weather and also in winds of about 15 - 20 mph and had no problems at all. It holds its ground and has absolutely no problems. The batteries in it last approx 22 - 26 minutes depending on the wind and temperature. This drone is comparable to some higher end drones but this one outdoes them with a longer flight time and a better price.

title: The seller was very accommodating to make things right.
text: I went through 2 drones within 3 days. The first one steered out of control and broke. Amazon and the seller worked with me to make it right. Seller not only gave us a new drone but also refunded our money for all our trouble.

title: This is a fun drone to fly !!!
text:
I liked how easy it was to setup .
Wish it came with propeller guards and larger case.

title: Extremely Fragile for a Beginner model drone
text:
Had it 3 days. Was flying in tap fly mode. Noticed that it was going towards a pole and tried to abort the flight and nothing would respond. Unit hit the pole and crashed in the grass. Broke off two arms, stripped out the threads on one of the rotors, and then got ghosted by Holy Stone customer support. I asked them if parts were available, was a beginner drone really supposed to break so easily, and if they thought it was repairable. They responded with a list of questions. I responded and then No response back.
This was not my first drone, just first with these capabilities. Not impressed with the strength of the unit, nor Holy Stone.
If it had not broken so bad on such a minimal crash, this would be a 5 star review.

title: Great Beginner's Drone.
text: Today, I fly for first time the Holy Stone 720.  The experience was incredible.  Is so easy to control, even for me that never flew one of this machines before.  The pictures and video at 2K are amazing.  The remote control is  limited to take photos, Low and Hi Speed, Launch and landing, Return to Home feature and the vertical angle of the camera.  To use other advanced features like Follow me, Point of interest, Maps, Tap to fly and many other goodies, you need the phone app.  It uses a 32GB Micro SD to storage video and photos or can storage in the phone.  The GPS feature keeps the drone in an stable fly but wind gusts can move a little.  The battery last over 26 minutes even using the video, photos and landing lights.  It weighs almost 16 onz. so you have to register with the FAA (just $5.00 for recreational purposes).  Good for the price.  The remote control should has other features, like Follow me, integrated.  I'm very satisfied with this purchase.  The only limiting feature is the FPV because is from a Wi-Fi from the aircraft and with the distance, it disconnects frequently.

My experience with holly stone customer service:

Had issue with battery which not lasted for more than 2-3 mins after full charge , contacted customer support got response with in few hours. At that time there is no spare battery available in stock and they said they will place order once they are in stock , Received regular updates regd inventory , received new battery last week and new one last for about 20-25 mins.

title: Far more trouble than expected
text:
My expectations were not particularly high, this was purchased as a personal toy to have a little fun with photographing my gardens from above. Mistake. To begin with, the directions are vague, without much information on which buttons were indicated by names. It could have used one of those photos with the lines pointing to the parts with labels. It sort of doubles the frustration of learning something new when you have to resort to trial and error to figure out what the buttons and knobs are supposed to do. Labels would be so useful.

Then getting the software and hardware to sync up was frustrating. It is far from automatic, with many more parts to the sync up than expected. One must first get the actual drone to sync with the remote. That went pretty smoothly. Then there is the need to sync the wireless settings in your phone to the Holy Stone WiFi. Not so smooth. Before the snyc is complete, the drone shuts itself off. This happens with annoying swiftness and frequency. Just when you just about have all the syncing done, the drone shuts itself off and the app makes nasty constant beeping. Then you get to start over again.

The app is another cause for exasperation. As near as I can tell, there is no real documentation for it. Online videos all show what must be an earlier version of the app that has "Start" on it. The version that actually comes with the QR code does not. There is a small box labeled "Enter Device" which does get you to another screen. At this point there are more instructions for continuing the snycing process. It does not work well, with no indication of whether any individual step succeeded or failed. Again, the drone keeps dying and the process needs to be started over again.

After about an hour of this nonsense I got the drone into the air. It flies well, though far from intuitively. Some actual instructions about how the thing is supposed to work would be useful. I discovered that the with the right control stick, pushing up moves the drone in the direction the head was pointed on takeoff. It does not matter how the drone is rotated the directions remain the same. It is useful to point the drone toward the north on takeoff and think of the directions as compass directions. The yaw (turning the drone more or less in place) and the altitude control of the left controller is much more intuituve: up is up, down is down, right turns the drone clockwise, left turns it counter-clockwise.

The camera works pretty much as expected except that you do need to go into the settings and select the 4K option each time or low resolution photos are stored in the phone rather than they high resolution photos stored to the card in the drone. Again, there is a fair amount of confusion as you need to figure out that the onscreen white button takes a photo and the onscreen red button begins a video recording. I was very interested in this part because the photos were the entire purpose of buying the drone.

Unfortunately, it is impossible to tell what the photos looked like because there is no apparent way to download the photos. The interface in the app lists only social media apps. There seems to be no way to download the photos into the gallery on the phone or onto a computer. The bluetooth option simply does not work. I can download photos taken by my phone from my phone to my computer via either bluetooth or usb cable, but not from the app that runs the drone. I don't know where the app hides the photos. I can access them only through the app--and the app will not allow any of the usual means for download. My choice is an array of social apps which I do not use. Another choice would be to attach a photo to a text message. However, my phone would then condense the attachment to a low res version--and I would have to send it to someone else. It will not take an email address. When I attempt to find the files by connecting the phone to my computer, they do not show up on any folder in the Intermal storage.

Next time I fly it I will take care to select the 4K option each time I get it going rather than assume that it will store that option at least until I turn off the app. It may be possible to get the photos off the card by removing it from the drone and putting it in a card reader. I hope so. At this point it seems as though I may have bought an expensive piece of junk that is only good if you want to post photos on Facebook.

I do realize that this is a sort of low end drone, but I would really expect that even if it was only a $100 drone I should be able to download the photos to use as I want. The $30 toy camera that I bought my grandson for Christmas does a better job. I should be able to do absolutely anything I want with my photos. I should be able to directly access them via the file system or bluetooth and do anything I want with them. I really can't say that I could recommend it to anyone unless you just want to have fun flying it around like a remote-controlled plane. But, you can buy those for much less.

For beginners, make sure to register with the FAA, know the laws in your area, and know where you can fly!

text:

As long as you practice in a wide open field it should be easy to use and learn. The camera takes a nice picture.

The only downfall is that if you take a picture straight on you can see the blades in your picture, you can get around this by slightly angling the camera down.

All around a good machine!

title: Good First Drone--Still Learning
text: Took this drone to my parents' house in the country for a first flight, and I was able to keep it aloft for longer than the advertised battery length. The connectivity with my phone was awesome, and the maneuverability was good for my first try, especially considering it was a little windy. I think it would be easier for someone who has recent experience playing video games; I haven't played video games since the original Nintendo gaming system, so it's been...a year or two. *lol* The camera got stuck facing downward, and right now I'm not sure whether that's a software issue or a mechanical issue, but it seems to be a common one, from what I can tell on Google. I am hoping to get that worked out and take the drone with me to Seattle next month for flights in some of the parks where it is permitted. I think this would be a great beginner drone for someone looking to get the hang of flying for pleasure and flying to take aerial video.

title: Great price compared to similar drones.
text:

title: Amazing quality drone for the money!
text: It is difficult to find a drone with all the capabilities of the 720 even near the price.  Many drones in this price range are just glorified toy drones.  On the other hand this 720 is much closer in capability and quality to a DJI Spark which costs $679 with controller and case.  The 720 is actually very similar in design and construction to a DJI Mavic. The 720 is solidly made, binds immediately to the controller and calibrates easily.  The FPV image is clear with extensive data about the drone being displayed in the app.  One reason I bought this was the return to home which works really well.  It landed within two feet of the launch pad.  It is very stable in flight with the GPS with a solid hover, even in some wind.  This drone is perfect for a beginner as it is easy to fly and you aren't learning to fly risking a $1000 drone.  Having the really nice custom case is a real plus. Highly recommended!

title: So far so good, but some issues
text: [[VIDEOID:d788643041dfd3f99abf156592245bad]] For a discount drone, this isn't too bad. It does do 4k video and it does have a decent camera on it. A few of the bad points on this, when I bought it the listing said it has image stabilization. This is incorrect (you can see this from the short video on my review). If you want the EIS you do have to go to the more expensive model. The listing I purchased from has been changed but just a heads up if you see this on here before you purchase. Next, the drone isn't very stable again you can see this in the video where I had it about 30 ft up in a hover, it rocks a lot side to side. This camera seems to over saturate the video a lot. There are camera settings that can be manipulated but first flight out of the box what you see in my photos and video are exactly what you can expect on the 4k setting. Last you'll notice in my photos and videos propellers, again this is straight out of the box and I'm sure you can move the gimbal to remove those from your shot but something to know ahead of time. Overall this is a great 4K drone for someone getting started in the drone hobby who doesn't want to spend too much a drone until they know they like it. It's also good if you're afraid you're going to crash as you won't be out much. Another big plus, the case that it comes with is really nice and not something you see with most drones. Having a case for the drone controller and batterie(s) is really nice. One suggestion, keep the foam that comes on the battery, this is great to have to keep a battery in the drone while traveling but also preventing the drone from starting up in transport.

title: Great customer support
text:
I did a lot of research on various drones and the reviews pointed me to Holy Stone for the quality and price. It was amazing to me that 4 little motors could lift the weight of the drone. I tried flying it in a nearby hay field but apparently I was to close to a lot of electrical impulses from power lines etc. I had to crash the drone in the grass to save it from something more damaging and the support team sent me the parts for repairs which I admit were beyond my capabilities so they had me send the drone back for a replacement.
Support response was excellent. I am looking forward to trying a new location and enjoying the drone.

title: Great flyer, takes very good video and photos
text:
I upgraded to this model from a less capable one, and that was a great decision. This drone is so much more capable, stable, and easy to fly than most anything else in its price class. In my opinion, it is a real bargain.
Pros:
- Folding and unfolding the arms is smooth and precise. With this unit, I don't feel like I may break something.
- First time use is well documented, and the drone lights indicate the working status all along the way.
- GPS satellite acquisition is pretty quick.
- It is very fast and responsive. Yes, racing models and much more expensive ones are faster, but at this class the speed and flight response is excellent.
- It is incredibly easy to fly. While a beginner can enjoy this immediately, I don't believe I will feel throttled back as I become a more proficient "pilot".
- The camera output truly is 4K (3840 x 2160) for both video and photos. I guess this is a change from earlier models, but I can verify that resolution.
- The battery life is very good. The flight time is quite good. With other models, I've felt like I just it got up and started to look around when the battery started to run low, but with this drone I've alway felt I had plenty of time to see everything, take plenty of photos, and capture a lot of video.
- I've tested the one-key return and low battery return home, and it usually lands with a foot of the takeoff point.
- The drone feels solid and sturdy. It feels more like high-end piece of equipment than a inexpensive toy. The build quality is very good.

Cons:
- Most of the issues I have are with the app, so technically should not apply to the device itself, since the app is not absolutely required. The app settings are a bit tedious, and some of the functions are made more difficult than they should be. There are some features I'd like to see like camera angle display, and the ability to save paths/routes. It would be nice to not see the beginner screen every single time the app starts. The good news is all my complaints could possibly be addressed with app updates.
- The battery charge time is long. It's a pretty big battery, so maybe this one just gets chalked up to physics. The charger must avoid a dangerous overheating or damage to the battery, so perhaps any quicker charging is not possible.
- Yes, there is some jello, but it's hard to imagine how to get around this without adding a couple hundred more to the cost. I balance any camera shortcomings with the fact that this is a sub-$300 drone.

Overall, I am thrilled with this drone. I find it pretty amazing that this level of quality, camera resolution, flight characteristics, and capabilities can be had at this price point.

title: Great for this beginner even with what I consider to be flaws.
text: This was my first drone and as a true beginner, I can say without hesitation that this drone is super easy to take out of the box and get flying. The remote control isn't bad but only got 3 stars because I the controls are backwards from what I am used to as a gamer, I am not sure if any drones are capable of allowing the user to customize what the controls do or not but if so, that would put the controller at 4 stars. The overall build is good, not very heavy and comfortable in the hand but the part that you place your cellphone on POV while in flight is not very good at all. I put my phone in it and about 3 seconds in, my phone fell out. The rounded edges of my iphone causes it to slide around and not sit in the cradle in anyway that is stable so I can not use that function unless I find another solution. The connection to the drone is quick and easy but the latency is about 3 or so seconds so you have to be in a clear open field because line of sight is the only way to fly it. Lastly, as a first time drone user I appreciate the durability of this little drone. I have flown it into two trees and a wall, and my dog managed to jump high enough to snatch it out of the tree and it still works with no issues. The battery life is about right, 20 or so minutes as for the rest of the functions that are used from the software, I am not sure because I can't put my phone in the cradle without it falling out but the big takeaway is that it is durable, fun to fly, and very easy for a beginner to take out the box and fly.

title: Great drone. So much fun to fly
text:
I‚Äôve had a couple of drones and this one is the most fun to fly so far. I once had an opportunity to fly a mavic pro and they are awesome but very expensive and out of my price range. This fits the bill perfectly.

This is a great little drone. Folds up to a small size and has a nice case with it. Very portable. The remote works really well and the first person video stream is a nice feature.
The battery really holds its charge and I get close to 25 minutes before landing every time. The charge time wasn‚Äôt as long as others have reported. It charged from zero in about 4 hours which is just fine.
Pictures are very clear and video looks sharp. There is a little wavering of the video but that is because the drone is so small that a gust of wind causes it to compensate quickly and the camera shock mount tries to compensate. I liken it to a person with a slightly unsteady hand.

The drone is fast. So fast that I have a great time making ‚Äúspeeder bike‚Äù perspective videos flying above the ground or even through trails in the woods.

I turned the saturation down on the camera as the colors were at first a little too saturated.
The photos stored in the app are really just for reference. Choose the photos you want and save them to your phone and they look so much better. For the best result use a mini sd card onboard the drone. Those pictures and videos look really good.

Pros: easy to fly, fast setup, great remote, small/compact, great still photos, nice video, long flight time on a battery charge, great height and sitance settings. Easy to land.
Cons: a little video wobble if windy kind of like a videographer with an unsteady hand (but not constantly), photos look soft in the app (save them to your phone to realize better resolution and save them to a sd card for even better resolution).

Would I buy this again? Yes
Would I buy this for a child interested in drones? Yes but also check out the hs270 for younger beginners.
Would I buy this for an adult? I did, and I am keeping it.
Would I use this for professional video and photos? Maybe, yeah, probably. There are far more expensive drones and cameras out there if you are looking to go pro with a drone.
Does the battery last as advertised? In my experience, yes.

text: Very impressed with this affordable drone. Took it to the beach with constant 15-20 mph winds and it remained steady in hover.  Would highly recommend.

title: Charge it, sync it, and fly it.  Just that simple.
text:
[[VIDEOID:bd2c1537182db691a00d08929a35287b]] Charge it, sync it, and fly it. Just that simple. One touch lift-off gets the drone in the air where it will hover until you push the control stick forward. It flies nicely, is very responsive and will quickly reach heights that make it hard to see.
Landing is also a one-touch operation. I flew to within about 25 feet of where I was standing, pressed the land button and it gently settled down for a perfect landing.
The carry case is awesome and is so nice I hated to toss it into my dirty ATV. It‚Äôs very well designed and offers superb protection should you hit a rough spot and bounce your drone off onto the floor. (Don‚Äôt ask me how I know‚Ä¶)
The directions are good and the ‚Äúquick start‚Äù is more than enough to get most people in the air. But with all the capability this drone has, you‚Äôre going to want to spend a little time with the manual to get the most out of it.
Pros:
‚Ä¢ Sleek, well-built and very sturdy. The time spent on development is evident.
‚Ä¢ Small enough to take with you everywhere yet big enough to handle itself in moderate winds.
‚Ä¢ GPS locked in quickly.
‚Ä¢ Awesome carry case that provides excellent protection.
‚Ä¢ Comes with spare propellers but unless you fly it into a wall, you‚Äôre not going to need them.
‚Ä¢ Easy to fly and the battery seems to last forever!
Cons:
‚Ä¢ The controller feels cheap to me. It gets the job done, but it‚Äôs nowhere near as refined as the drone.
I think this drone is advertised as being adult level, but I‚Äôm not all that experienced, and I found it very easy to fly. And if it gets to far away, just press that RTH button and it‚Äôll come right on back to you!

title: Will drift on its own, unstable at times when it should just be hovering.
text:
Update after help from HolyStone:
1) Before flying, turn the drone on to give it time to setting the GPS coordinate.
2) Also before connecting to the drone Wifi and before flying , go to the map view in the app, verify that the GPS circle on the map has settled close to your location, and isn't drifting.
3) Wait for the map to populate the view to your location.
4) I've noticed that when the remote antennas are close to the back of my phone, I have control problems. Lower the antennas on the remote away from the back of your mobile phone used for display.

After these steps, my flights have been reliable and stable without drifting or control issues.

First off, I'm new to drones.
Fortunately, this one is quick enough (for me at least) to learn, to recover from its behavior. I've not crashed it myself while trying to control it. It crashes because it drifts into obstacles.

There are times where it'll drift laterally; meaning I've commanded it to go forward, but it'll surprisingly drift sideways. Fortunately, I've had some practice sessions and learned to stay on top of it, respond and keep it from crashing itself.

In my fairly spacious back yard, I tried the return-to-home feature. Once, it worked well. (The device flies up to a certain altitude, flies laterally to the 'home' location, then lands.)

Second try though, it flew up as if it's going to return, then suddenly flew off in an unexpected direction. I reacted and got it back under control, flew it back myself.

Though this unit should be easy for new learners, I definitely recommend baby steps. Have it just hover, and learn to catch it when it drifts, then expand the experiments, watching carefully to recover if it 'departs'. One simply can't just let it be on its own; has to be watched and actively controlled.

I have been able to use it as intended; such as inspecting my roof, gutters, inspecting a neighbors roof for leaks, etc.

The video and still photo quality are usable. I've dedicated an old iPhone to be the display device.

UPDATE: I wanted to try the Tap-To-Fly feature today. But the map views are blank.

title: Thing attacked me!

title: Gambling???
text: Easy to fly drone takes pretty decent photos and videos. The price is pretty good but compared to the DJI Mini I have to say I‚Äôm going to go for the DJI Mini and I‚Äôll give my reason below. Now for HolyStone Customer Service... well.... they‚Äôre AMAZING!!! Unfortunately  I have a few issues that I wish I knew moooonths ago. If you‚Äôre in an area where there‚Äôs interference forget it your drone is going down or out of control and that‚Äôs because IN CASE YOUR DRONE STARTS GOING OUT OF CONTROL RELAX!!! RELAX!!! Up the altitude so it doesn‚Äôt slam into someone‚Äôs house, power lines or trees, pay attention to where the drone is facing and bring it in. If you can‚Äôt and all else fails CUT THE GPS!!!!!! Just know that YOU‚ÄôRE NOW IN COMPLETE CONTROL WHICH IS BETTER THAN THIS DRONE FLYING OUT OF CONTROL BUT KNOW THAT YOU NO LONGER HAVE AN OPTICAL FLOW SENSOR SO BE PREPARED AND PRACTICE FLYING IN THIS MODE ESPECIALLY FOR LITE WIND, BREEZE SITUATIONS. That has happened to me in places where there was no interference before and I saved my drone on numerous occasions because I was ready for it. Now here‚Äôs my major gripe!!! The reason for interference being an issue is because the FCC has a rule ‚Äúthat drones can not cause interference but they can not deflect interference either they have to accept/receive the interference, to me that second part gets me mad..... what sense does that make ‚Äúyour drone can not deflect interference?!‚Äù THIS IS THE MAJOR ISSUE!!!!! NOW REMEMBER BEFORE HOW I SAID DJI IS AHEAD OF THE PACK, WELL THIS IS BECAUSE DJI HAS ONE OF, IN FACT THE MOST IMPORTANT FEATURES EVER... The DJI APP has a feature in their app that allows you to search for interference BEFORE EVEN TAKING OFF!! Unfortunately HOLYSTONE DOES NOT have this feature in their app and that sounds like gambling, a $300 gamble and one thing I hate doing is gambling. It just so happened that the one time it failed me was over water, which I‚Äôve flown over on numerous occasions but for some reason on this particular day interference cut it out of the sky and it fell straight into the Long Island Sound, which I actually retrieved after 3 hours of looking on pretty nippy day mIght I add. THE ONE REASON WHY I DO SUPPORT HOLYSTONE IS BECAUSE THE CUSTOMER SERVICE. HolyStone Customer Service asked me for pictures of the drone and they replaced the drone 2 months and 2 weeks after purchase. NOW before you purchase call HOLYSTONE and ask them if they still have the 3 month free insurance if you purchase from Amazon. If NOT I suggest you go and fly in areas you plan to fly in within the first month just in case something happens you can get it replaced.  THE OTHER NEGATIVE.... the controller or transmitter... The drone is capable of going out 500 meters but the remote/transmitter only allowed me 350 yards, MAXIMUM! I figured I‚Äôll buy a stronger remote/transmitter unfortunately the problem with that is, is that the camera on HolyStone Drones has a 5.0ghz signal, the better remote/transmitters run a 5.8ghz signal for cameras, now, you most likely will be able to connect the drone to the remote but not the camera, so where‚Äôs the sense in that.  Other than the interference issue, I have had tons of fun flying my drones and would like to thank HolyStone for being the reputable company that it is! Just get the interference check feature and I‚Äôll be more than happy to be the first to purchase that drone! Until then my money is on a DJI MINI for $400 for that simple reason, that interference check is hands down the best feature these drones can have.

title: Great Drone and Amazing Customer Support
text:
The HS720 is a very good premium drone that works for beginners. This is my first drone and I had no trouble getting it setup and flying around my property using the remote controller and real time images via WiFi on my iPhone. I chose the HS720 because of the specified 2K video resolution, and indeed it takes good high-resolution video, but be warned, the video quality is only acceptable with a memory card that you will need to purchase separately, otherwise it is 720p with some obvious motion artifacts. So be sure to by a memory card and likely a spare battery as well, as recharge time is several hours with the supplied dual battery charger.

Since this is my first drone it is hard for me to compare to other drones, except for the superior specified video resolution, but what I can say is that in all my years of online shopping or buying consumer products in general, Holy Stone has the best customer support I have ever experienced. I have never received answers to my questions online so quickly, and when things did go wrong, they had a replacement shipped very quickly.

title: Quality and affordable!
text: I decided to purchase this drone to document an upcoming outdoor school event.  I chose this model based on battery life, automated features, and camera quality.  I am not a professional drone operator by any means, however, I have multiple lesser quality "toy" models that I have become proficient at flying.  This drone absolutely blows them away with the quality of construction and features.  It is very easy to control compared to completely manual flight drones.  It has an automatic take off and landing button as well as a return to home function.  It gives me good piece on mind to know that if it goes out of range, or I get disoriented flying, it can come back and land manually using gps.  I did test this feature several times and it worked flawlessly.  Do keep in mind that it does not detect obstacles and can still crash into them on an automatic return flight.  This is unlikely though because the drone will ascend to 100' before returning home and then descend straight down to land.  The camera seems good quality and functions well using a two direction gimble.  A three way would be better but you can still rotate the drone to compensate for this lacking feature.  Picture quality in first person view is very stable.  The follow me mode and point of interest mode work well and will come in handy.  The battery life is superb.  It seemed forever before the low battery alarm sounded!  It amazed me just how compact this drone folds up for storage.  You could fit 2 or three of these in a regular size backpack.  It and all of its components fit in a small zippered carrying case with room for an extra battery, of which, you will definitely want to aquire with how much fun this drone is to fly!

title: Great drone for a great price
text:
I was looking for a drone to capture progress pictures and videos of our home build project. I needed a feature set like that of higher end models but without the cost. I came across this drone in my researches and have been very happy with it. The one feature that has benefited me greatly is "point of interest." Being able to fly the drone to a specific location and it focusing on that point as it makes an orbital path is perfect for what I wanted to accomplish.

The only real issue is the video can be somewhat jiggly due the bands acting as a gimble, but as I am mainly after pics, I can either take pictures while the device in in flight or grab screen shots of from the video.

title: Give a 5 star & they promise a battery...
text:
[[VIDEOID:fe34948253e4f50c7d52de44dd17f770]]
That's the deal...5 stars for a free battery...which you'll never see.

To be clear, it's not a bad drone. It is very sensitive to wind...as my son found out on the first flight. Video is good quality, it takes a while to set up (it's a strange set up for GPS acquisition). It's not that it's a bad drone...but it's not probably worthy of all the 5 star reviews either. And at the time of ordering you couldn't buy another battery...and my son's crash kinda cracked up the original so I went along to get a free battery. That never happened.

Original Review.
I've only played with it a little so far, but I've been very impressed. I'm new to the drone and remote control flying world, so it's been a little bit of an experience. I got everything working and it takes nice video. I'm still learning, but I've been impressed with the return feature that brought it back to me after I lost control. The ease of use, and the follow me feature.

title: Excellent drone,easy to fly

text: Handling is super easy. We have had a few different drones but this one is awesome. Very quiet, low to the ground flight, great camera,  etc...

title: Trouble connecting to the required satellites.
text: The Holy Stone 720 must be connected to at least 7 satellites. I‚Äôve tried this in 2 different places and I guess there‚Äôs not 7 satellites in my area. Going to contact Holy Stone and if I can‚Äôt get satisfaction going to have to return it.

title: Junk - does what it wants to do...
text:
After getting good at it, I hit the return to home button, and it crashed into a tree. I fixed it with glue and tape. The Drone worked fine for a while until I took it to the beach. The controller showed 19 satellites and there was almost no wind. I hit the Return to Home button, and once again it flew away from me and went into the ocean.

Their Customer service is friendly, but lack knowledge of how the Drone works.

The only suggestion I can offer is, find someone who is proficient in using Drones, and ask them which is the best one out there. Do not use Youtube for research - most of the reviewers receive free drones in turn for a good review.

In short, $300 gone.

Update: This is the second Drone they sent me right out of the box. See Photo

title: Awesome fun! Good drone, until it fried itself a week after the 30-day window
text: I flew the Holystone HS720 drone to discharge the battery, in order to preserve battery life. After 10 minutes in the air, it started behavior strangely then crashed. I noticed a terrible burning-electronics smell, and noticed that part of the plastic cover at the top of the drone melted. The drone shorted and fried itself!

title: Good for Beginners
text: This is a very good starter drone for the price. It is a an inexpensive drone to learn how to fly and take pictures and video's. I initially had problems unlocking the motors to fly and I contacted Holy Stone by email. They replied less then an hour and provided some recommendations which I was able to understand and take flight with the drone.  I enjoyed this drone so much, I went big by purchasing more capable drone. The HS720 is a very good drone to start  with to see if drones are for you before purchasing a more expensive drone. I would recommend you purchase this drone before going big. If drones are for you, you can learn and make all the mistakes like I did before going big. If drone aren't for you after your experiences with the HS720, you minimized your expenditures.

title: Good Drone Great Price!
text: [[VIDEOID:4216adc83c0a472595f00aaa0ce78b22]] This is a good drone for the money. It‚Äôs gets the job done and is super easy to operate and fly. RTH feature works very well. Video is generally acceptable for this level of drone. Battery life is close to 25 minutes. The App is nice and works fairly well. Only issues are it takes too long to recharge the battery. 5-7 hours on average.  Also the connection between remote and drone will fail when you push the height and distance limits. All in all it‚Äôs a tremendous drone for $300 bucks.

title: Issues with major drift during first flight
text: Many customers are reporting on the Holy Stone Club Facebook group that their recently purchased HS720 drones are experiencing major drift during take-off, and erratic behavior during the first few flights rendering the drone completely unresponsive and in some cases causing it to crash into things. I wasn't too sure about the reports, but then upon receiving my HS720 and carefully following all of the instructions noticed that upon first take-off the drone suddenly violently drifted and flipped vertically before crashing into a wall. This was very unsettling due to safety concerns. Unfortunately, I do not have the free time to debug the issue or attempt to monitor the data coming back from the accelerometer and gyroscope sensors, but I would say there is a possibility that many of the recent HS720 cases being reported on the Facebook page by customers are perhaps connected to the same issue. My thoughts are that beyond this being a huge disappointment, it's really a safety concern and that these devices should be carefully inspected by a third party before being sold to consumers. I have considered emailing the FAA to notify them of the reports on Facebook and of course my experience on first flight. My dji Spark never once acted in such a manner, it is always stable and steady during take-off.  At either rate, potential customers please be aware of the issues and take certain safety precautions when operating this aircraft and any other drone, but especially this one.

title: Stable and Awesome
text:
[[VIDEOID:545154bda6d13c99ffe6f5a0addd0fc9]] The HS 720 is a really much improved drone from Holy Stone. 2K video is a really nice touch. Wish there was some EIS, but that can be done in post.
Probably the most stable HS drone I've ever flown. It handles really well in wind, but wouldn't fly any drone in over 15mph wind. More wind means more battery usage.
Instructions are very clear and easy to follow, just make sure you are calibrating every time. RTH works well. It uses the Ophilia app, which does have some bugs they are working on. Get a good SD card if you want better looking videos.
Being able to fold it up,put it in the case and put in my backpack makes this a game changer. On my bike and I'm off flying somewhere.
Overall, a really fantastic toy drone. Keep it up HS!

title: Great beginner drone!
text: Coming from FPV race drones, this one operates much differently. Great drone for beginners or aspiring photographer. It‚Äôs easy to set up and fly, and it takes quality photos. Holystone has also demonstrated great customer service. I would recommend this aircraft to a friend.

title: Unpredictable.

This is my second one, the 1st one self-destructed in an hour by running into my house as soon as I got it off the grown. title: It‚Äôs very easy to fly in for the price it‚Äôs just simply the best

title: OUTSTANDING!  Easy, intelligent and reliable
text:
I've had a number of different drones in the past from different manufacturers, but this one is by far the BEST!
Each one takes a little thought in getting it going correctly. But the HOLY STONE HS720E is by far the one that's actually helped me get itself flying correctly.
Right out of the box, go through the instructions a little bit (really, who really reads the instructions anyway?)
Yes, I had a problem. WIth pairing. But remembering what I went through with the HS700, I put my Android NOTE 10 into airplane mode, switched on the WIFI, connected to the HS720E and I was flying in under 8 minutes.
Actually, no I wasn't. The drone flew itself! That's how easy it is.
Great pictures (don't forget the "class 10" micro sd card). Quick to respond, did exactly what I told it to do, came back home within inches of where it took off from.
I don't have a vehicle, I have a motorcycle. With the case, and size of everything I need, it fits in the bag so I can take it with me anywhere I go. Another PLUS, in my opinion.
I have a limited area to fly in, with a small front yard, not much back yard, power lines about 200' away, and a few houses and construction neaerby, but I was able to maneuver between any and all of the obstructions.
Sure, I'd recommend this one to anyone who asks. Actually, I will even forget all the rest of the brand names I've flown in the past and just stick with the HOLY STONE 720E.

title: Impressive drone for the money
text: This is my first drone. I had no problems flying it and getting great video and pictures. There is a learning curve to smooth flight but that is on me. Don't forget to order a memory card to store video on the drone ( better quality ). Everything I have tried works exactly as advertised and I look forward to many more flights.

title: Customer service is amazing
text:
On my first flight, I did the auto takeoff and then went straight up. The drone suddenly veered to the left and crashed. There was no wind and the calibration was done successfully and correctly. I tried everything to recover, but the drone was unresponsive. I called customer service and sent them a pic of the damage. They concluded that the unit was defective, possibly damaged in transit and sent me a replacement free of charge. This was the easiest customer service experience that I have ever had with ANY company. EVER. Way to go Holy Stone!! A company who values its customers.
The drone is built. You can tell it is a quality piece when you pick it up. Also, it stays airborne nearly 10 minutes longer than other drones. Functionality puts it nearly on par with DJ Mavic. It is also MUCH quieter than the Mavic. Controls are super easy to learn, as is the app. Return-To-Home function works well and the drone lands within 3ft of the home point every time. In higher winds, things get kind of dicey pretty quick. I do not recommend flying in high winds. Pic/video quality is MUCH better when using a microSD.

title: Well made, easy to use, good images can be gotten (updated 10/25/2021)
text:
This is a well made drone. It uses high quality parts, especially at the price point. It is easy to fly (when you can find a place to legally fly it). Getting good video or still images is hit or miss. I have tried very hard to get good video, followed all the tips and done my best but my videos are still shaky in places and I have yet to get a well-focused still image. I send my concern to the vendor but have yet to hear back from them. I am sure they are dealing with manpower shortages like the rest of the world. I will keep trying and if I am able to manage to get some improvements I will revisit this review and share what I learn. It does have one other minor issue in that the return to home almost works but it never seems to get back to where it started in most cases. It is usually about 6-10 feet away. This is not a problem for me, but could be for someone operating off a boat...

So there are some things I have figured out over time. The first this is that Holy Stone's customer service will make every effort to make sure any problem is resolved and I want to give them very high marks for this. With regard to the area's I had difficulty with - here are some clarifications:

The drone relies upon GPS signals to return to it's home. You can get it to fly without a good GPS signal and you can even control it fairly well - but getting a reliable GPS signal makes this a much more usable platform. Since I was using this in a large building, the GPS signals were not that good. We opened up a roof panel (this is a large metal building) and once we got a usable signal good things started to happen. I figured out why it was so touchy to fly - it really wants a decent GPS signal.

One thing I will share is that if very stable high definition imagery is you goal, just spring for the 720E right up front. While the 720 has good imagery, the electronically stabilized circuitry in the 720E takes this to an entirely new level. This is especially important for any post flight editing you want to do but it also works with the Ophelia Go app as well.

title: Excellent drone
text: At first I thought this drone was low end.  after using it for 2 years now and about 20 flights, along with using a couple other brands, I realized this is a very good drone. It has similar quality photos and videos to a much more expensive model and the image stability is actually very good. The auto correct for a beginner pilot is a very good feature and the app works great. I did contact customer service after I crashed my drone and they were very helpful I highly recommend this company and would try other models if I get the chance

title: Excellent compact Drone

title: Even adults need some toys to play with
text: That's by no means to say this drone is a toy; the Holy Stone HS720 is an awesome aerial work of art.  I'm a novice to the drone world, so getting a drone with good stability and a GPS return to home feature were critical requirements for making my drone short list.  I also wanted a drone touting good camera resolution with the ability to remotely adjust the camera angle during flight.  Using this criteria brought my "drone to buy" list down to about three options.  I didn't want to spend too much on my first drone, and $300 was going to be a stretch at the time.  But when the "lightning deal" was offered by Amazon along with the 5% off coupon, I couldn't resist giving the nod to Holy Stone--and I'm certainly glad I did.  The HS720 offers a slick style that feels solidly constructed.  I love having the custom case (included) to keep everything protected and organized.  Since I'm still getting the hang of flying a drone, I haven't pushed it to its limits yet or experimented with all of the flight features out of fear that I will accidentally crash my new investment.  But this drone is very responsive to the transmitter, making it easy to maneuver through airspace.  The 4K camera takes great photos and videos, though I recommend using a TF card since it will get you much better video quality.  The return to home features work as promised, usually landing the drone within three feet of the launch point.  My only qualm so far is the 5-7 hour charge time between flights.  However, since most drones under $300 have to provide two batteries to achieve the 26 minute flight time this one can handle with one, I can let that slide.  The Holy Stone HS720 (4K) is an excellent choice for any drone novice, but still packed with all the advanced features that even the best drone pilots would be looking for.  In retrospect, $300 is a very good price for this drone, making the $240 I paid a steal of a deal!

title: Connectivity Issues
text: The item came and I spent two days trying to get it to connect to either of my two phones using the application that was supplied in the website.  I figure the app on the site would be up to date, it was not.  I updated the app.  Followed all the trouble shooting steps then finally contacted the manufacturer with a detailed e-mail about the problem and the steps I had taken as well as both my phone met the criteria for use with the drone. The response was confusing, I was asked about things that I had clearly stated in the e-mail and was told to try the things I had already told them I had done. Then after a second e-mail from mere-stating that I had obviously done what they were telling me to do and sent snapshots of the proof of me doing it.  They gave me the name of another older app to try.  It worked, Finally.  I am not certain if the older app has the same options and qualities as the app that was supposed to operate the drone but.....  It works, it flies, it takes picture and video's.... So I am pleased with the drone. It does as expected.  Just not to happy with the experience! But the issue was resolved!

title: Great drone! Bought another, just that great!
text:
Love this drone, first real drone that has great features to it, I've tried low budget drones but this drone is a must have for beginners! The return home feature works great! GPS mode is nice to have, especially if you're not a fan of keeping your drone hovering manually. Haven't tried the follow me mode, orbit mode, or programmed route just yet. Looking forward to trying that next!

Update: bought another one for a family member as a gift, again really great product, just a side note, make sure you have the GPS calibration completed before you take off, if you have a solid red lights and a solid yellow light instead of green the GPS signal isn't locked/calibrated! A quick fix is to fly the drone straight into the air a little bit and it'll get a gps signal, do not attempt to do a return to home when the light is still yellow and not green or else your drone will just land at it's current position just an fyi! Other than that great for beginners, wifi signal is ok, I'd say about 50m is optimal before you start losing a signal with your cell phone/tablet.

title: Hard to control
text: I bought this to inspect my gutters and roof so I could avoid climbing the ladder. I wasn‚Äôt able to figure it out and I crashed it multiple times. At one point, something I did caused it to shoot up to about 100 feet off the ground and I struggled to safely land it. I eventually got it down on the ground only to almost put it into a sewer. I had to quickly reach into the storm sewer opening while the rotors were spinning to keep it from falling into the abyss. Cut my hand and wrist in multiple locations.
