title: Batteries issues, awesome beginner drone.
text:
I bought the drone and a spare battery. I charged both batteries to full. I went out (in Seattle) to try the drone: The batteries (both of them) lasted max one minute each.

I called Customer Support and they will ship me an extra battery. Apparently charging the batteries overnight damages them.

Customer Support was excellent and the drone is great fun to fly.

title: Dropping my rating to 2 stars after 3 months.
text:
Very good first impressions after 4 flights. Solidly high quality build. First time drone pilot. Flew it easily using the "quick start guide" the first try in tight surroundings (house and trees). Flew over snow which may have confused auto hover, drifted around a little but easily controlled. Responsive but not touchy. Quick start guide does lacks some important details, highly recommend reading the user guide prior to flight. Else the sequence of lights. pairing, and beeps on start up my not be understood, and drone may not be properly calibrated with GPS and phone. This is important - I pressed home with drone hovering 10ft over landing pad on my deck and drone immediately zoomed 10ft ahead and slammed into my house - likely because of inadequate gps satellites at launch. No damage at all from crash - Solidly high quality build. Pro: Quick, agile, easy to fly, good battery, high tech features, rugged. Con: Battery charger has two spots but only charges one at a time. Instructions for drone and required app (Ophelia GPS) are confusing and incomplete. A concise pre-flight check list of initialization, calibration, pairing in sequence would be much appreciated. Latter is the reason or 4 (not 5) star rating. Camera performance to be determined. So far very happy with this drone. Customer service excellent to this point, although website can be glitchy using Spectrum cable and Firefox. I may receive a battery from HS for submitting a review, but either way this is my unbiased opinion.
Update March 11, 2020: Very limited range (150 m) for live video feed to your phone. HS confirmed that is their normal range. By comparison I watched an inexpensive ($199) Potensic drone yesterday that maintained live video feed at 550m. Without the live video feed to navigate and compose photos, the effective range of this drone is very disappointing. Video quality is jittery when drone is moving or in light wind. Camera gimbal has significant lag time and is too touchy for effective panning. I rate the video capability as 1 star, photo capability 3 stars, flight capability 5 stars. The HS 720 would be a solid 5 star intermediate drone if the video feed distance matched/beat the Potensic drone and camera gimbal issues were resolved. Fun to fly but frustrating as a video drone. Customer service was excellent, fast, and courteous .

title: AWESOME!!! - Built with VERY HIGH QUALITY PARTS!!! Not a Toy...
text:
For a number of years I have flown RC Helicopters / Drones (aka Quads) and now primarily RC Planes. Now having the desire to get back into flying Drones for just plain fun but also with the urge to do some professional photography I started searching for a Very High quality Drone, so after conducting a LOT of research I have chosen the HS720. Now having purchased the HS720 Drone because of all the AMAZING features that it had for it's price!!! I was searching for a Drone that has very long flight times which I found that the HS720 has. I also found it to be very easy to setup using the OPHELIA GPS Flight Interface App. Downloaded to your smart phone which allows you to control all the features on the HS720 Drone. I also wanted a very high quality Video/Photo Camera.
Below I have listed what I feel are some of the PROS and CONS of the HS720 Drone based on my own personal opinions.

PRO Flight Time 26 minutes

PRO Folds up easily for transport

PRO Comes with a very well made carrying case for transport

PRO HD Camera

PRO Maximum transmission distance 2624-3277 feet outdoor and unobstructed

PRO Camera frequency 5 GHz

PRO Video/Photo Resolution 2K (2048x1152p)

PRO Lens FOV 110 degrees

PRO FPV Distance 656-1312 feet outdoor and unobstructed

PRO Formats: Photo JPEG Video AVI

PRO Supports 32 GIG TF Card

PRO Camera Range 90 degrees

PRO Very East to Fly

PRO Has 3 Built In Fail Safe Modes, 1. Low Voltage in Drone Triggers
Fail Safe, Drone Returns To Home. 2. Lose Transmission Signal
Triggers Fail Safe, Drone Returns To Home. 3. Manually Triggered
Switch will cause Drone to Return To Home

PRO Comes with a FULL Operators Manual and a Quick Start Manual

PRO Comes with Extra Set of Spare Props and one Phillips Screwdriver

PRO Camera is Mounted on Shock Absorbers.

CONS It only comes with ONE Battery

CONS Charging easily takes between 5 to 7 hrs. to complete

CONS You can only charge ONE battery at a time even though it has
connections for two batteries connected it charges ONE at a time.

CONS Connecting the battery to the charging connector can be a bit challenging.

CONS The iPhone holder on the Transmitter is also a bit challenging to open and setup the iPhone into it.

CONS Before Every Flight the Drone NEEDS to be CALIBRATED each and every time.

CONS I found it hard to read the small print in the Manuals

Please remember that this review is all based on my own personal opinions. Everybody has their own opinions of their likes and dislikes. Overall for the price I find this Drone a real KEEPER and made EXCEPTIONALLY WELL beyond most standards. Also I do NOT think of this as a toy.
Enjoy Flying and remember to be SAFE.

title: My brother loves it
text:
I bought this as a gift for my brother so we can go on some photography adventures. His words are below, and then I'll add a couple of things I noticed at the end.

My brother's review:

Overall this is a good drone. My situation is probably different from most. From the get go I had issues with the drone connecting to the gps satellites. I contacted the support and they were very helpful on determining the issue. After exhausting all possible leads of the problem they determined the drone was defective and informed me I would receive a replacement drone within 3 to 6 business days and no need to return the drone and to keep it for spare parts. On the 6th day I hadn't received the drone nor a tracking number as I was told. Holy stone asked me to contact Amazon to check the status. After checking with amazon they informed me they had not received an order from holystone. At that point i reached out to holystone and informed them on the situation. At that point they informed me they would send another expedited. I did finally receive the drone after 10 days or so. That was the real issue I had. The replacement drone works very well and they let me keep the defected drone for spare parts. I wouldn't think most people would experience this. I've had other holystone drones that have had no issues. The drone is good quality and very durable. It's easy to fly and when connected to gps it's very steady. For the cost that it is you definitely get your money's worth. This is a great drone for someone starting into the photography side of drones. It takes great photos and is equipped with a 2k camera. I've had no issues with the app and all the functions equipped with it. Holystone stands by their products and I learned this from experience. I would recommend this to family and friends that are beginners and beyond looking into the hobby of drones.
----
My thoughs:

1. The props will show up in photos when the gimbal is looking forward. I think that's important to consider.
2. I do love how the remote has an extended phone spot at the top, so you're not forced to remove your phone case to make it fit.

title: Excellent Features and Quality Mid-Level Drone
text:
After researching drones (quad-copters for the purists) from fun toy-grade styles to high end models I decided to go for the Holy Stone HS720.

Why?
It is compact, foldable and feature rich, especially for the price point
I have been flying toy-grade for years and exploring if I will appreciative a higher grade model
High ratings

Pros
1/3 the cost of a DJI Mavic
Features of models costing 2 - 4 times as much
Quality product - very well made
Remote is good for larger hands (wish it would hold a mini tablet)
App, tech, all features worked as advertised (live video, follow me, orbit, pathing with 2 methods, point 2 point or freehand draw a path)
Return to home has been flawless, lose signal? battery low? No problem, it lands within inches of takeoff
Nearly 30 mins run time, it seems to run forever
Safe - all safety features work well

Cons
Wish it had more range ( you will lose connection long before you lose sight of it)
5 - 7 hour battery charge time vs. 1.5 - 2 hours for DJI Mavic (I bought extra batteries to make up for this)
Not as stable in-flight filming as $1,000 models

Overall, this is a high quality, fun, easy to fly drone with all the features you would want - for around $300 you can't beat this. On top of that, the company is responsive, friendly and helpful. Una is the best! When was the last time you emailed a manufacturer/seller on Amazon and received continual, prompt, helpful responses? I have to give Holy Stone 100% here.

text: I'm fairly new to flying drones other than the little ones you can fly in the home. This drone was a lot of fun just taking it out and learning how to use it. title: First impressions of HS720 Drone
text:
I have had the HS 720 for 3 weeks now and I am truly impressed with both it and HS tech support. I don't claim to be experienced in Drones but I have been flying RC airplanes for many years. So, with that said let me make a few observations about this HS 720 drone.

Pros:

It comes with instruction pamphlets that are written in plain English unlike my other drone's instructions which were obviously written by a 6 year old Chinese lad. Trying to decipher its meaning was/is nearly impossible. These instructions are clear and you can follow them with no trouble.
The drone comes well packed and has a nice carrying case. Wish it was a little bigger to carry things like a spare battery.
The drone is much heavier than my other one and that makes it possible to fly it in stronger winds. I would say that anything up to 10mph winds is doable. Anything over 6mph needs to be done in HI speed.
Controls are good but I wish it had a "slower reaction" setting. When doing a video, the slightest touch of either the left or right controls causes the drone to "pitch". You see that in the video as a jerk. Course it may be me not being easy enough on the levers.
It has a slot for a 32gig max memory card. This is a lifesaver. When a card is present, and you have selected video record, the video goes straight to the card. Not saved on the phone by the app. The other drone I have has a tendency for the App to die and since the video that was being shot is stored on the phone and app, the video is lost. This single factor of having a card slot for saving video/photo's is worth its weight in gold.
The HS app that is used is "Ophelia GPS" and it seems to be rock solid. It has yet to fail and for some reason, it simply feels good to use. Maybe its because my other drone's app failed 3 out of 5 flights. This one has performed flawlessly. The video you see on the phone has a very short lag from what the drone sees and what is displayed on the phone. It's only about a second and thats not bad. I think it increases a tiny bit as the drone is farther away but I'm assuming it's simply transmission time from drone to phone. Thats to be expected.
Getting the 720 up and recording is a breeze. I have tried several of its functions and they have all worked. Return to Home is excellent. I've landed within 2 or 3 feet from where it took off from. Just be aware that it does not have collision avoidance technology so if you need to take care when using RTH. The Point of Interest is fascinating to watch and gives a nice video record of where your flying and the surrounding area. That setting can be increased to give you a wider circle while you are flying. The "Follow Me" function is good but there are hazards to using it. It uses you GPS from your phone to follow you. It does not follow you like its on rails. Example. You start out a position A. Drone is behind you. You go straight ahead 100 feet to point B. Drone is behind you. You make a 90degree turn left and go straight to point C. The drone will NOT proceed directly to point B and make a left turn just like you did to follow you. It will see that you have made a turn and it will cut the corner to catch up with you at point C. So be aware of that quirk and you won't end up with your drone in a tree or worse after you have made a turn. It's a fun feature but it has its drawbacks.
Cons.
It only comes with 1 battery and its supposed to give up to 28 minutes of flight time. The re-charge time for the battery is 5 to 7 hours and it does take that long. A 11 minute flight took 2:45 minutes to re-charge. Now when I got my 720, and flew it for the first time, I did about a 7 minute flight. I put the battery on charge and 8 hours later it still indicated that it was not charged fully. I UN-plugged the charger hub and waited 20 minutes and reconnected the battery and it showed fully charged. NOT GOOD. At what point during that 8 hours did the battery become fully charged? I did several short flights to verify that there was a problem and they all failed . I did not want to overcharge the LiPo but I couldn't tell when it was fully charged. I contacted Holy Stone Support and it took some doing but they did send me a new Charging Hub with cables and it fixed the problem. The Support Team is excellent and easy to contact and they will work with you if you have a problem.
You need to have at least 2 batteries for a good day of shooting videos. These batteries are EXPENSIVE but worse than that, they are not available right now. I hope they get these in stock soon.
I have no other complaints and I really like the HS720. I think that anyone who buys one will be happy with the drone and know that Customer Service is TOPS. I give it Two Thumbs Up...

title: Best drones for skilled users and beginners...
text: [[VIDEOID:523781c2de05a879c065a0bb45f0a253]] I have owned several Holy Stone drones and  love all of them.I have been a Holy Stone customer now for almost 6 years. I have several Holy Stone drones, everything from the micro drone to the mid-range with a 4K camera system. I love the reliability of the products and I know that when I have the time to spend outside I can fly without any headaches. Don't get me wrong, I have had some issues with a few of the units, but every single time I have either called or emailed Customer Service, they have gone over and beyond what was expected and the issue was resolved in a matter of just a few days. One thing with these drones you can't lose them. I have heard stories of drones flying away on there own and such but with most of Holy Stone drones that isn't possible. They have what is called a return to home button on them that if the battery fails or is going bad then the drone knows and will fly back to you and land in the same spot that it took off from. Also, if the connection between the drone and controller breaks then the drone also knows and flies back to you. And if you happen to lose site of HS drones during flight you can just push the RTH (return to home) button and the drone automaticly comes back to you. I also always thought that a drone would be hard to learn to fly but not with these. The instruction manual tells you exactly what and how to get it started and keep it in the air.  These drones have a thing called hovering which means they will hover in place anywhere you want them to. They hook up to satilites b4 flight so they know where they are all the time and know where they took off from. If you let go of the controller while drone is in flight then it will stop where it is until you start guiding again. If they don't have GPS then most of their drones have altitude hold that causes them to hover.  I always thought I had to keep trying to manage the flight of the drone and keep it moving or it would fall from the sky but that isn't true. With the automatic hovering, they will stay in place till you get control of yourself and the drone. I have one of their small ones that I fly in the house when it is raining or too windy to fly outside. My dog loves it. Like I said, I am no professional with flying these and never will be and have crashed into the house, on the road, and got them stuck in trees and most if any damage done to the drone is maybe a scared or broke prop. When this happens then I replace prop or props with the new ones that come in the box with the drone when I purchased it. All the ones I have bought have always had the extra props, the manual, a small screw driver, and charging cords in the box. I have owned and still own some of the drones such as the HS110, HS100, HS112, HS700, HS700D, HS720, HS165, and some smaller toy drones.  All from Holy Stone so I know what I am talking about when I say the these drones are the best ones to buy for beginners or anyone that just likes to get out and fly.  Am planning on buying the new HS600 sometime this summer to see what it is all about.  So in summing up this review, you can't go wrong with the Holy Stone drones weather it be the house drone or the more expensive ones.  They are all reliable and if not then Customer Service will fix what problems you might have with them....Thanks for reading...

title: Superb machine for beginners as well aqs experienced flyers.
text: I was fast approaching the end of my 70s and after watching the youngsters flying domes on the beach where I live I decided it was time to go for it myself. I love photography and could not wait to experience it from a totally new perspective. I have to admit that it was more than a bit intimidating, having never even been near one before, but a bit of research fortunately led me to the Holy Stone HS720, and after reading the manual and watching one video on YouTube I was set to give it a go. It definitely is the drone for beginners, but it did absolutely everything the manual and controls indicted it would and having two speeds to play with on the open beach was neat as well. It did not take long into this first flight for me satisfy myself that I could do it with some confidence and not be concerned about losing it with the built-in return to home as the battery weakens. Even in a bit of wind it easily landed within inches of where it took off from when I pressed the Return to Home button. I snapped my first several photos (my first one is shown here) and was more than satisfied with the results. The two toggles worked great to have the drone smoothly go up, down, forward, backward and to the sides, as well as rotate in place. It is hard to believe what a powerful new experience this was. I said it was for beginners, but I cannot imagine even experienced fliers not enjoying this beautiful machine.  Everything I needed to begin a new dimension of photography for me, just as I had hoped.

text:

title: battery issue ****Updated****
text:
I wanted to update this review and let everyone know that Holystone's customer service is wonderful! I ended up giving this drone another chance with their help and they got me flying right. I've got to admit with the replacement drone this has really changed my opinion of this drone. The issues I experienced before are no longer present. Appears to have been a defect on the last one as the replacement drone is working much better. Part of my issues was related to building interference, which would cause a drifting effect and ultimately messes with the distance you can fly. So make sure you're not near buildings when flying this. Otherwise in an open field or park setting, flight is stable, camera is real good and I get the full 26 min of flight time, which I appreciate the accurate truth when purchasing a product. Other drones will say they give you 30, but that's usually rounded up for marketing. This thing is fast, watch out for that mode, but you can switch this on or off. Holystone has been very responsive to my questions and addressed all my concerns. If you're looking for an affordable drone that offers the same advanced features that you get from more expensive drones, I would seriously recommend the Hs720. You can feel rest assured that if you have any issues you will have a stellar support team who's got your back. Any issues you may experience can usually be sorted out by talking with their team. (Cathy is especially awesome, but the rest of the team has been great too) I'm happy with my purchase. I'm a fan and will recommend this product to anyone who is a drone hobbyist starting out. I'd also recommend getting a second battery so you can enjoy it longer. Thank you Holystone for your help and turning this experience around for me.
___________________________________________________________________________________________________________
Let me start by saying this is a nice looking drone, smaller than what I thought, but a real nice looking drone. I received the drone and thought I would put a charge on it as I assume it was shipped half charged? But I may've had a defective battery, because when I charged it, the charger had a fast blinking light which indicates its charging.. the next morning I looked and it was still blinking. I put the battery in the drone, it showed as full. So i took it out for my first flight and noticed some odd issues right away. First when I flew straight out about 100m I lost connection with the drone, it returned back. I thought that was odd, so I took it out there again at around 90-100m I was no longer able to turn the drone left or right.. I could still move forward and back.. when I brought it back to about 50m I was able to regain full control and could move about normally. This drone is rated to work up 1600m (800m with video recording) the video got choppy at 75-80m and then cut out. This odd flight issue could be with android 10, it sounds like a lot of drone owners are having issues with Note 10+ android 10, probably something to do with the GPS not locking correctly. But the biggest disappointment here was the battery life, I only got 17 minutes of flight time after charging overnight before it started beeping and it returned home. I think the charge time of these batteries is ridiculous at 5-7 hours to recharge and to only get 17 min.. no thanks, it could've been a defective battery possibly, but with that and the other app/ phone (androind 10) / connection issues I don't think this one is for me. I'll be sending this back.

title: Just as good as the DJI Phantom 3 but 4x smaller, quieter, and cheaper
text: I bought this thing to replace my DJI Phantom 3 which has an unrecoverable software issue. I wasn't expecting it to be this good but it really does everything the DJI does. It's also lighter, easier to carry, quieter in flight, less complicated to operate, and costs 4 times less. The battery time seems about comparable at around 20 minutes. The drone itself acts as a wireless access point with the cell phone and control acting as network devices. You record both on the drone and the cell phone. My main purpose is to create panoramas using images stitched together. It's in 4K same as the DJI so my photos are indistinguishable. Well worth the money.

title: Great beginners drone.
text:
Great beginners drone. Flies very good. Image and video quality not that great but it is decent. Battery takes a huge amount of time to charge. Battery does not stay plugged into charger very well and that becomes annoying.

-----

1) The only issue I have at the moment is that when the battery was dying, it did the beeps and it just landed straight down. It was suppose to auto RTH. Good thing I wasn't that far from it. Maybe it was just a fluke. I will test it again.

Tried using a 64GB card to record but didn't work but it did record and takes pictures with a 32GB installed.

Battery takes a huge amount of time to charge. Battery does not stay plugged into charger very well and that becomes annoying.

-----

2) Took the drone out for more practice flight. About 10 - 15 feet in the air and over a few yards. I wanted to test to see if it would come back to the landing pad. Hit the RTH button, it shoots up into the air and looks like it is on the way back. All of a sudden, it just takes off into into a different direction at high speed and finally gets trapped into a tree. I tried to disable the RTH mode but it didn't respond. If it wasn't for the tree, I don't know how far it would have went.

I now have a broken drone. One of the arms snapped. I contacted Holy Stone and exchanged information. Now I have to wait and see what happens with their support. I'm out of a drone for the moment.

-----

3) I had good customer service interaction with Holy Stone. Communications was slow but it was there. They resolved what has happened and I'm a happy customer.

title: Awesome and Easy!
text:
So I've had the basic $20-ish drones before to play with at home, and I decided I wanted one to use outside and do video/photo with. I knew there were some brands better than others, but I saw a few reviews that said the HS720 was at least on-par with some of the DJI Mavic drones in terms of functions, performance, and features. That prompted my purchase and I've been thrilled with it so far.
Setup and operation are simple, only marginally increased from the little $20 I had (just to get its GPS signal).
The camera feature is great, and the ability to swivel the camera lens is great to get different angles.
Battery flight life is right on the approximate timeframe they indicate (~25 mins) and has a return to home feature to make sure your drone doesn't fall out of the sky randomly.
The app for phone is great, doesn't seem to be buggy, and connects to the drone WiFi easily and quickly. I like how you can save the pictures/videos you take to the phone's camera folder to edit and upload to your photo backup site.
Overall my experience so far is excellent. I don't anticipate any kinds of issues. The drone performs great, looks great, and has great features.
Don't forget to register with the FAA!

title: Nice little drone!
text: This is a nice drone for the money. Very responsive and nimble - steady as a rock while maneuvering for camera shots - the camera works great ,and i like how you can move the camera up and down big plus!  it takesGreat pictures  and video not grainy at all -they look pretty clear -first take off had no issues - connected  to the controller and my phone pretty quick ,and set up compass  pretty quickly. Had no trouble getting a good GPS signal . Happy so far!!

title: great bang for buck
text:
My first drone & it is very easy to use. Battery last 20 -25 minutes depending on how you are flying (speed setting, video, aux lights, etc.). I did have an issue with residential wifi interfering with drone controller and I lost complete control of my drone resulting in crash. So avoid flying in areas with areas with a lot of signals. No issues ever in more rural areas.

Pretty fast in high speed, states 24 mph which seems true. May not be as fast as the DJI drones, but it is a fraction of the cost. The return to home feature saved me several times. Video signal gets lost as early as 150 meters, but can work up to 300 meters depending on surroundings. Its a new drone so replacement parts are not yet readily available. Customer service has been very responsive as I've been trying to get replacement parts. I suspect these parts will become more available now that this drone is on the market.

title: Holy Stone HS720: 3 times used then uncontrollable
text:
Received Holystone HS720 drone for my birthday.

First flight was at my house. No issues, flight was stable and smooth. I liked it.

Second flight was on a remote hilltop. No issues. Video and pictures kinda sucked.. Still, was way better than the $100 Costco drone that Holy Stone replaced.

Then the nightmare began.

I next flew it on Halloween, feeling confident enough to use it on a busy night.

About a minute into flight, it seemed like someone else took control. The drone flew in wider and wider circles around me. Return to home function did not work. I felt like I was fighting for control of the drone. I was so scared the the drone would crash into a house or, worse yet, into some trick or treaters. I was able to get drone close enough to my location and it crashed into a neighbor's tire, no damage. I was so shaken, I thought that someone hijacked the drone. I put the drone away and did nothing. For months. My fault.

Fourth flight was in a remote area, on a hilltop.

I decided to fly drone again, since there would no chance of interference or hijacking. As soon as drone took off, it was unresponsive and began to circle around me. As before, return to home function did not work. Drone circled around me a few times, I was able to drop the drone's altitude enough to where it crashed into a tree, about 150-180 feet from me. Was fortunate that it crashed, otherwise it would have been almost impossible to find. My son saw where it crashed and we recovered it.

There was no visible damage. I found that the tab that holds the battery was sheared off so battery will not lock into drone.

To be honest, I am scared to even try to fly it again.

I am out of Amazon's 30 day return period.

If anyone has input on ways to fix the drone, I would greatly appreciate it. Otherwise, It's a $265 lesson learned.

I don't recommend the Holystone HS720 drone, it's better to with something else.

title: Crazy good value.
text:
I should start off by saying the obvious: You can definitely find this drone cheaper elsewhere online, but I chose Amazon for two main reasons: quick delivery and the fact that if I needed to return a defective unit (which is always a risk with clone products like this) I knew that process would be painless. So I paid a bit extra for peace of mind, but I stand by that decision.

Even with the extra money spent, I've gotta say, this little thing is an amazing value. It's battery life is amazing and while a 5 hour charge might seem a bit much, given the ridiculously long flight times - by modern drone standards, anyway - It's more than fair. The included charger allows you to charge up to two batteries simultaneously (note that the kit only comes with one). Also included in the kit are clearly marked A & B rotor assemblies for when you do eventually break them, which (surprisingly) I have not managed yet. And not for lack of trying either!

While I certainly don't advocate that anyone be as reckless as I am, I do all the stuff with drones they tell you not to do. Fly over water, in (moderately) windy conditions, through the woods. Just today I flew it down a river with overhanging branches. Thankfully I didn't crash it (specifically there), but I've already tree'd the thing three times and it's held up like a champ each time. The only 'damage' I've incurred was needing to manually move the camera gimble so it could be remotely operated again. Your mileage may vary, of course, but it's much sturdier than it really has any right to be. I can't even imagine what the flight time would be like if they used lighter/flimsier materials.

Recommendations:
1) Get a good (class 10) microSD card. The recording functionality in the app is 'fine' for proof of concept or simple land surveying, but the video feed from the drone to the app is so bit-crushed for low latency that you will be MUCH happier with the footage off the SD card.
2) The video feed from the app is NOT low latency enough to FPV flight. In addition to the field of view being a bit to narrow, there feels like a solid half second or more of delay between input and response. It's fine for slow movement in a big open area at altitude, but if you're around trees and at anything resembling speed, you may as well be the titanic heading for an iceburg. By the time you're trying to dodge the tree, you're already in it.
3) This little guy is QUIET by most drone standards. And it's also basically the color of shadows on the forest floor. So if you ever think you might risk loosing it, I'd recommend picking up some Day Glow Orange paint (the same high visibility orange hunters have on their vests) and putting a wide pen stripe around the body of the drone. I mention the sound because typically when you crash this thing, the rotors stop, but even if they're going, they might not be audible enough for you to actually find it on sound alone.

title: Excellent Drone, flight is smooth, great GPS features, but beware, NO HEADLESS MODE!
text:
For Christmas, my wife bought me an HS110D drone. I have never flown a drone before, so she thought this would be great to start out with. At times, pairing and syncing the drone with the controller was not very easy. Often times, the drone would take off on its own and it would not respond to controller commands, ultimately ending up with a crash. This might be because of the lack of GPS. However, because I really enjoyed flying it when it worked well, especially in Headless Mode as a beginner, I took a GIANT leap and purchased the HS720. This unit does have GPS. After reading MANY reviews, this drone fit the bill for me. I took my first flight with it yesterday and I must say, it is very smooth and not too loud in my opinion....keeping in mind I am not a professional drone operator. The GPS modes are AWESOME. I especially like the Return To Home mode. It worked great. I have not tried the Follow Me mode or the Orbit mode yet, but I am sure they will be great as well. There is however, one issue that I have with the HS720. Some of the reviews I read about the HS720 said the drone defaults into HEADLESS MODE which means you can control the flight path of the drone with normal controller commands, no matter what direction the drone is facing. This is INCORRECT. I attempted to rotate the drone and fly it away from me, but it flew towards me, and moved the joystick left but the drone went to the right. This tells me it is NOT in headless mode. There is no way to turn headless mode on/off on the controller like the HS110D had. I called Holy Stone to verify this, and sure enough, I was told the HS720 DOES NOT have headless mode. I guess I will just have to learn to fly it traditionally. THIS IS NOT A DEAL BREAKER FOR ME! I really do like most of the other features of this drone. Another thing that could make this drone even better is to mount the camera on an actual gimbal for image stability, instead of a simple shock mount. Charging the battery does take a long time, so try to get a spare battery in order to enjoy flying for longer periods of time. Also there are no obstacle sensors on the front, sides, or rear of the drone which would help avoid crashes. Finally, there are no removable crash bumpers around the rotor blades.
At the end of the day, you are not buying a $1000-$1500 drone with all of these above listed features, but you are getting a GPS capable, collapsible drone that will fly smoothly, has great GPS features, hovers in one place like a champ due to the sensor on the bottom, looks really cool, comes in its own carrying case, and best of all.......costs less than $300. In my opinion, the ONE feature the HS720 should have added to it is the option to fly in Headless Mode, like some of the HS cheaper models have.

title: Great Entry-Level Drone!
text:
This was a bit of an impulse buy after reading other reviews. I would definitely say it delivers!
With the exception of "throw-away" indoor models, I'm a novice to drone flying and wanted something with basic features (decent camera, "follow me", GPS, auto-return, etc.) that didn't break the bank. This has been a fun introduction to the hobby and it is very easy to fly. I've only flown it a few days and am still learning but some initial thoughts/highlights are:

1. Packaging: 5/5, the carrying case is high-quality and everything stores away safely and snugly.

2. Durability: 4/5, feels to be a well-made and durable product. I crashed it only once in mulch (from about 6 feet) and it survived. There are replacement blades if needed. Some cages would be nice (to protect people as much as the blades) but then it wouldn't be as portable/foldable.

3. Control/Pairing: 3/5, I had no issues pairing to my iPhone 8 via onboard wifi or getting the drone and controller paired and oriented. The instructions weren't extensive, but made the process clear. The indicator lights are hard to see in daylight so I ignored that part (I just waited a few seconds longer than I thought I should to allow whatever lights to change) and it worked anyway. My biggest problem with the controller is how small everything is and how close together things are. When trying to get the phone clipped in and push whatever buttons I need, I continuously bump some other button/setting (hence the aforementioned crash). Some of this is me being a beginner, but I'd really like a little bit bigger control and a slightly less "busy" phone screen interface.

4. Flight: 5/5. It feels "zippy" and responsive to this novice. It is small, so mild breezes do affect it significantly and might limit use. Even so, I had no problems at all getting it do to what I want and am only just starting to push it further/faster. Follow-me and return modes worked well enough. It hovers and lands within a foot or so of its take-off point every time.

5. Camera: No score. It works. I got nice enough photos from it and could view them on the phone and in the app without problems. There is a bit of lag where the video is concerned in that you need to hover a bit for the picture to come in and stabilize but this is an entry-level drone and I had no expectations that it would perform like $1-10k products. The pan up/down adjuster on the control is a little tricky to dial in to get the view you want.

In summary: it has provided a great introduction to the hobby and provides surprising quality and functionality at this price point.

title: Great Drone for the MONEY
text: The HS720  is a great drone.  It packs small so you can take it anywhere you travel.  It is good drone for photographer hobbyist. I have included 2 photos that I took with this drone.  You can see me in one of them.  It has many features that the more expensive drones have.  It will fly for 25 minuets on one battery, and it will even  FOLLOW YOU, and this is  something that I love....It will return to the place where it took off if the battery gets low, or if the transmitter signal is  lost.  It is easy to learn how to fly.  Get it and start having  FUN.  The HS720 is well worth the money.

title: Good so far
text: Still waiting on My extra blades to ship. Then I can give a full review.

title: Great support for a decent product.
text: I think the product support is excellent for the HS270 that I purchased. The Drone itself is very good considering the price. I have no other drone experience so I can't say that spending more will result in a better performing drone. Reading the instructions carefully is highly recommended:-)

title: Great Product!!!
text: This drone does fly nicely and is easy to configure.  I would highly recommend this drone as a beginning drone and if you have any RC experience you will find this product to be superior at this price point.  I do recommend that you also invest in extra batteries even though you get 20 minutes plus per flight on each battery a portion of that time will be spent in setting up your pictures or movie shorts.  The stabilization for the camera is adequate at this price point also the drone handles wind nicely.

title: Great First Drone
text: I like the fact that this baby pretty much soars by itself, with a little help from the human manning the control(s) after a careful reading and rereading the included manual as well as a quick charging of the included battery(s). Yeah, a smart phone is a definite plus and a relatively calm day is icing on this entertaining and fun outing. I learned the calm day part the hard way, but replacing damaged prop is a snap, thanks to the included replacements. Go outside, locate some satellites and prepare for some hot damn flying, including photos and/or videos to prove your piloting expertise, knowing your HS720 does most of the work. It all folds up nicely and neatly stores in the provided carrying case.

title: Great Beginner Drone
text:
So glad I did my research on this drone. The features are really well thought out. The RTH (Return To Home) is one of the best features too! I found the HS720 to meet my expectations for a drone under the $300 range. So far I have over 20 flights and have yet to be disappointed. You will wan to purchase a 32GB memory card, micro-SD (max size for the drone). I'm using an iPhone 6c to control mine and it works fine. If you are looking for an entry level drone, I highly recommend you consider the HS720.

Update 4/7/20
After an issue with my HS720 I contacted Holy Stone customer service and spoke with Daryl. I explained my situation in detail and he determined that a replacement was the only way to resolve my problem. The customer service this company provides is awesome and a rare thing these days! Great job Daryl and Holy Stone.

title: Tough little Drone
text: First drone I've purchased. I've never flown one before. Tried it in my yard, and of course flew it into a tree (my fault) and watched it tumble to the ground. I was a little nervous when I went to get it, but when I picked it up, it didn't even have a scratch !!! Nice to know it can take a little abuse. I will find a larger area to fly, until I get used to the controls though. Directions were straight forward, and flew nice until the tree !!

title: It is a lower cost introduction to drone flying, photography, and videography.
text: It is a good value for the money, but do not expect the smooth video quality of the more expensive gimbal stabilized drones. It is a sturdy little drone; props are the most frequent consequences of crashes. I chose this company because they had a reputation for great customer service, and because I like to root for an underdog, (in terms of market share). It often makes them try harder. They did not disappoint.  Emails were usually answered in 24 hours. The biggest issue I had was its sensitivity to interfering signals.  Turn off auto connect on your wifi settings, and turn on Airplane mode, if possible, AFTER connecting to the drone. Pay very close attention to the details and sequence of the preflight checklist, and you should have a lot of fun.

title: When is the battery of Hs720 is available ?

Thinking if purchasing others for my friends & family.

title: Don‚Äôt grab it the blades will cut you

title: Wow, what a machine!
text: This is my first drone, so I can‚Äôt offer a professional technical review.  However, I am honestly amazed at what this thing can do.  If you‚Äôre a newbie like me, I have two pieces of advice.  DO NOT try starting this in your house.  It is billed as an indoor/outdoor drone, but indoors means maybe a basketball court or stadium, not your living room.  Second, DO NOT grab it in your hands if it‚Äôs about to crash unless you‚Äôre prepared for some cuts.  Don‚Äôt ask me how I came to this wisdom but yes, it was the hard and stupid way.

title: My first drone

I need more practice before I try anything fancy but love it so far!

title: Fantastic Beginner Drone, So Easy to Use
text: Wow, this is my first drone and I am loving it. The instructions are easy to follow and it was fast to get flying. You couldn't ask for a better first time drone, the Ophelia gps app is fantastic and easy to use. The video quality great it could use OIS to smooth it out on transition. The still quality is great also. Thanks to the Holy Stone team for a great experience for a beginner. This rocks and I can't wait to use on the trails to film some of my adventures 4 wheeling.

title: Great customer service
text: My son bought this drone and the arm broke. I contacted customer support and they sent a free replacement arm. Great people to work with.

title: Easy to fly
text: It was exciting getting the drone in. I had already watched a ton of reviews, so the setup was not bad at all. Spence it was my first drone and also I didn‚Äôt have enough charge on the battery. I just did the basic start up and take off. I did a few turns, tested the video recording and snapped a few still pictures. It was cool and exciting to me. I‚Äôm going to take the drone to a park with wide open space to really test it. Yet for now. I‚Äôm satisfied with the drone‚Ä¶‚Ä¶it is a nice drone, but it‚Äôs not stable in a light wind and the camera is ok but is jerky in the wind as well. Yet, it the day is nice and the wind is light. The video is very nice. I enjoy this drone. Thank you.

title: No regrets! A lot of fun flying the HS120D
text: Fun to fly, works great and has decent video.  Really comforted by the GPS and return-to-home functions.  I bought another different smaller drone by a competitor the same day I bought the one from HolyStone.  Unfortunately, the competitor drone didn‚Äôt have GPS and flew off on its own after just 4 minute of flight. Can‚Äôt go wrong buying the HS120D from HolyStone through Amazon!  Great features, easy to use and great customer support.

title: Very pleased with every aspect of Holy Stone!
text:
I can‚Äôt say enough about Holy Stone, they surpassed my expectations in every aspect. Their devices are very easy to fly and the list of features they are equipped with out of the box for the price point are unrivaled. There really is no other drone company out there in their league offering such a great product with such accommodating customer service.

I initially fell in love with my HS700 I received as a gift, after a month of almost daily flying the Return To Home feature started acting buggy. I reached out to Holy Stone and they offered to send me a replacement drone right away! I asked if it would be possible to upgrade to the HS720 and they gracefully obliged (I covered the difference which was only a few dollars) and sent it to me via prime one day shipping.

The customer service is great! Always respond within 24hrs. Detailed answers to all my questions and always very accommodating.

Now I‚Äôve got the latest model drone (HS720) which is an even easier/more fun drone to fly. The added flight time and upgraded, adjustable camera make the flying experience even more enjoyable.

I‚Äôm very grateful to the whole Holy Stone team and highly recommend to anyone looking for a great and very capable drone.

title: Very good Drone
text: I am very impressed with this little drone. ¬†Great carrying case and excellent battery life. ¬†The drone handles extremely well which has allowed me to use it on windy days. ¬†Before this drone, I would have never attempted to fly with winds over 5 mph. ¬†Great unit, it would have been a 5 star, but having problems adding additional memory to SD card holder for photographs.

title: Stand Up Company
text: Holy Stone is an awesome Drone, and a stand up company. The first Drone I received flew awesome. Very easy to learn. This is my first Drone, so that was huge. I was flying my Drone at a church parking lot and about 15 minutes into flight two of the propellers fell off and the Drone fell about 10‚Äô and one of the arms broke. This is a $35 dollar part on Amazon. I called the manufacture and told them what had happened. They agreed to replace the part and I would receive it 4 to 5 days. Cool! Woke up today to a brand new full Drone, Remote, battery etc. They just sent me another Drone. Now thats customer service. Thank you for being a stand up company Holy Stone

title: Best entry level drone!
text:
Awesome drone! Very stable and ready to use. Clear concise instructions. Very long flight time, very stable, and takes awesome pictures! Very highly recommend this drone to anyone looking for a great entry level drone with all the features and quality of a much more expensive model. Comes with with everything needed to start flying right away. I did purchase two additional batteries and new charger with better battery connection. There is room in the case for the additional batteries too. The charger that comes with the drone is very fragile and comes disconnected very easily if bumped while charging.
Other than that i am extremely happy with the Holystone HS720. No troubles with the app for the smart phone and works very well. I have a note 10 and have to take out of case to attach to controller but that's not a problem. Works very well and can fly by video on my phone. Definitely can't go wrong with this drone! Very satisfied customer.

title: good product, suspicious customer service,
text:
I had an issue where customer service was required, after it was all said and done, I WAS ASKED TO BECOME A TESTER FOR HOLYSTONE , AFTER LOOKING INTO IT, I WAS ASKED FOR PERSONAL INFO, LIKE MY PAYPAL CREDENTIALS, WHEN I REFUSED TO DO SO, ALL COMMUNICATIONS CEASED, I EMAILED ANOTHER CUSTOMER SERVICE AND GOT A BOGUS APOLOGY AND WAS ASKED TO "FORGET IT",,,, BANG FOR YOUR BUCK is what you get when you purchase a Holy Stone HS720.... this drone, which some have called an entry level, low budget drone, is NOT an ENTRY LEVEL AND IT IS CERTAINLY NOT A LOW BUDGET DRONE, the hs720 gives you a lot of features the other maskers are offering for one third the price,
The HS720 is beautifully built, very nice to look at, the construction of this drone is worth way more than the asking price, the fold out arms are so smooth and sturdy, the hardware feels tight and solid, the body is sleek, sexy, a 10 on a scale of 1 to 5, Camera is sweet, though it just goes up and down, ( I am sure the new HS720 will have a better one) and then we have the flight time, 26 minutes, not many, if any at all, offer such fly time on a "low budget drone" the like of this. 26 minutes of fly time in a drone is awesome, though the down side is the battery takes 5 to 7 hours to recharge, ( I would highly recommend getting an extra battery if not two), you will want to fly the HS720 and not want to wait for the battery to recharge. the HS720 comes in a really sweet carry case, (nice) as the other competitors are looking to sell you one, everything fits nice and snugly in the case, well done, Instructions are clear and well written, the Drone itself is a powerful piece of technology that costs a hell of a lot more than what it is being sold for, That being said,, YOU WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED WITH THE Holy Stone HS720, BUT YOU WILL BE TOTALLY UPSET IF ASKED TO BE A TESTER FOR HOLYSTONE AND THEN THE GIVEN THE RUNAROUND, THE INFO REQUESTED BY CUSTOMER SERVICE IS NOT NEEDED AND DONT BE A TESTER, YOU WILL JUST GET PISSED OFF,

title: This is your best beginner drone!
text:
The Holystone 700e is simply the most user friendly no license drone you can buy. With very little practice you‚Äôll be flying it around making cool videos!
I received this as a gift after having talked to a friend about how I needed a drone to make videos for my forestry business. I was very concerned and quite honestly frightened after having had trouble flying drones in the past.
The HS700e is easy to operate, intuitive and stable platform to fly. You‚Äôll feel like a pro in no time.
The camera is really fantastic. If I had to be critical I‚Äôd say the follow is a little jerky on video but it does what it says it does- it will follow you and that‚Äôs a cool function.
The gps guided ‚Äúcome home‚Äù feature is one of my favorites- keep an eye on the battery and bring it back right were it took off from with no issues and no effort.
I recommend this drone as a great first step to your drone based videos!

title: Surprisingly Feature - Awesome help desk
text:
This is my first drone, but I have several friends with pricier / more advanced models. For me, it had everything I was looking for, namely it is user friendly, quiet, has a solid 20-25 minute flight time and a decent camera. After reading all of the reviews I wasn't surprised that it flew well and did a nice job of shooting pictures and video. Being that this was my first drone (and apparently I don't do the best job of following instructions) I would up contacting the help desk several times. They are super responsive and helpful. Let me share with you three things I learned after speaking with them:
1.) If your video appears upside down on your phone, just hit the 180 degree icon
2.) The return home button will take the drone up to about 95 feet before returning (in order to avoid obstacles) I had panicked when my drone went up at first
3.) If the drone isn't handling well, you probably didn't calibrate the GPS well (wait until all lights are solid)

Oh and let me tell you my biggest surprise, last night my daughter and I went to fly the drone by the beach at sunset. I hit the video button and couldn't wait to get home to see the results. Well guess what? I forgot to put the SD card back in the drone. To my amazement, the drone had sent the complete video wirelessly to my iPhone. It was all there! So cool!

title: 5 Star Customer Service
text:
[Background] I bought this quad-copter drone to be able to visually inspect hard to reach places like my gutters and the back-side of my chimney. My house‚Äôs height challenges my 35-foot extension ladder in some spots and the trees around here have grown so tall over 20 years that leaves in gutter is a problem.

[Features / Performance] I‚Äôm new to drones and the aerial inspections I want to do require some skill. So, I watched a lot of YouTube videos and realize some drones are very good at making up for inexperience. HS720 appeared to be one of those for a fraction of the cost. I started out practicing in open fields and parks to develop the reflex and hand coordination to make multi-axial maneuvers. When this drone locks on to at least 7 GPS satellites, it is amazing how stable it is even in mild winds (4-10 MPH). The flying modes of Point-to-Point Tap Fly, Follow-me and hover & rotate over Point of Interest, are very impressive. The return to home feature works quite well and is very intelligent as it accounts for remaining battery energy. I found one YouTube video demonstrating a Return-To-Home landing (Holystone HS720 GPS Camera Drone) where the drone literally landed exactly where it took off (see 9:20 minutes into the video). I tried this several times and the closest it came to the mat for me was within 3 feet (so I‚Äôm not complaining at all). But it was a jaw dropping demo when I watched it.

[Customer Service] The best part: I did have one issue with the drone after flying it 9-10 times (erratic behavior). It resulted in some physical problems with the craft. So, I picked up the phone right away and called Holy Stone US. BEST CUSTOMER CARE service ever! The rep. on the phone asked me some basic questions, verified my purchase. This was a non-routine problem and she had to defer to someone else in-house a couple of times while we were on the phone. She asked that I take and email to her photos of the craft and she waited for them to arrive in her email box (while we were on the phone). The ‚Äúexperts‚Äù looked at the photos and gave me an immediate resolution; all in the same 15-minute phone call. This completely satisfied me (wowed my spouse in the process). Who does that anymore?

[NOTE: Before Use] Do be sure to remove all the surface protective plastic ‚Äústickers‚Äù. They are on the hand-held control screen, the frontal camera lens, one on each of the bottom LED lights and a donut shaped one lens on the imaging positioning camera on the bottom. This last one is important because this lens utilizes color contrast beneath the drone to gauge its horizontal stability/position when near the ground (I guess that means less than 2 meters above ground). Lastly, there is a foam pad that goes around the battery which comes inserted in the drone. You must remove this before the battery will insert fully into the drone. I did not find that step anywhere in the manual. If you manage to get the battery to connect with the foam insert in place. It will slip out (killing power if in flight).

[Performance Against Purpose] I did get videos of my roof and gutters (See attached photo taken from video). I inserted a SanDisk 32GB HC I SD card. I doubt this is a Class 10 SD card which is what Holy Stone recommends. I don‚Äôt know what ‚Äúclass‚Äù my memory card is, but looking at the video and video freeze frames, I was able to determine where along my gutters I do need to place the ladder to remove leaves. The drone took very clear video images from maybe 10-20 feet above the gutter line. A Class 10 SD card might be even better quality. However, this made me very happy. No attempt to inspect the back-side of chimney as I will have to fly ‚Äúblind‚Äù and rely on the altimeter and camera only. I suspect I will need to prove myself in a lot more flight tests before ready to try that.

[Battery Life / Recharging] can drone on and on (pun) about how nice this craft is, but I am really not qualified enough to give a good technical critique yet. I will leave that to the YouTube demonstrators. I will say that what they claim about this vehicle has been true in my limited 5 days (about 9 flights) of use. I know the biggest complaint is the 5-7 hrs of charge time on the battery. Yup, its true. It is about 5-7 Hrs. I don‚Äôt know about actual maximum flight time as I‚Äôve not pushed it. As I‚Äôm learning, I generally develop a flight plan consisting of a 4-6 maneuvers (wind stability, elevation stability when flying over objects, targeted video capture, etc) and then call it quits. I‚Äôve flown this up to about 15 minutes. Those recharges required about 3-4 Hrs to complete.

[Instruction Manual] These are more important that many people know. This one is written is clear English and there is a downloadable .pdf one available too. Read the manual several times. There are some nice fail-safe features, some behaviors that I would not have anticipated (like cruise altitudes for Return-To-Home), and cautions that make reading the manual valuable. Example: the drone will not avoid obstacles in its path when in Return-to-Home mode. I do highly recommend watching others on YouTube use this drone before flying it if you are new to drones. You have to be smart when flying and think ahead.

title: Easy To Learn
text: [[VIDEOID:3d51b17ffd2f5cb9ad696cde9aad4fe4]] Took my first flight with the Holy Stone HS720 on our private shooting range in South Jersey.  I am not an experienced drone operator however I was pleasantly surprised by the maneuverability of the drone.  As long as one keeps proper perspective of the forward facing position of the drone, it is relatively easy to fly.  In the video attached you will see that I am flying in heavy tree cover.  I have not tried many of the features such as return to home or follow me because I was concerned that if the drone malfunctioned I would destroy it by crashing into a tree or lose it in the heavy woodland.  My only disappoint at this time is the video stabilization or lack there of as these lower cost drones do not have a gimble type floating camera system.  You will see as the drone maneuvers, there is very little stabilization of the video.  Another concern is the video quality but again for a lower priced drone I suppose it is good enough.  I purchased this for $225. with promotional discount and so far for the money it's worth it.  I flew the drone for about 15 minutes and the battery remained at a good level.

title: Does not work properly with Android 10
text:
The flygo app will not bind my Pixel 2 XL with Android 10, and the drone. I tried this both in the Wi-Fi and the airplane mode. I finally got it to connect using the GPS app in airplane mode, which has limitations compared to the flygo app.

If I use a micro SD card in the drone it records the video to the drone but I have to take the card out, put it in my computer, to view it. I would like to be able to retrieve my video directly to my phone and it doesn't work that way. I am able to record it directly to my phone but you have a reduced video quality doing that it that way.

title: Nearly perfect

It is also not headless so it takes a little effort to make certain that you know where the nose of the drone is located..  Maybe a firmware upgrade will cure the 2 issues..

title: First time drone owner
text:
Ok just got the drone today and charged it up, read the directions and took it out for a flight. Wow, it is amazing for the newbie. First things first.
1. Shipping was fast and received a new drone well packaged on time per shipping notification.
2. I have emailed Holy Stone customer service twice before I received the drone and they are very quick to reply. Thank you!
- General impressions
Seems very well made for the price.
Easy to fly and simple controller operation.
Very quiet, I was expecting something much louder. At 50 feet you can barley hear it.
Battery charger could use some work, it is sensitive to movement and comes unplugged easily. Not a big deal once you know.
Now the App takes some getting used too but that is expected. Not difficult but will need some practice.
To me the picture quality is good to great IMO, for the price what do you want.
As with most of the comments, I agree battery charge time can be long. As it arrived my battery only required two hours charge to get a steady green light(full charge). The option to buy a kit with 2 batteries would have been a plus. Currently no batteries to be found on Amazon but customer service said they should be back in stock in a few weeks. Today is 10/04/2019 as I am writing this.
In conclusion I think this a great beginner drone or more. I bought this to learn and one day by a top of the line for cinematic production. For now it‚Äôs primary use for me is training and property security. Thanks Holy Stone.

title: Astounding Customer Service
text: Drone decided to commit suicide while I had it up hovering over the boat and took a steep and quick dive. Holy Stone support honored the warranty however as I truly believe it was a malfunction. AWESOME SUPPORT!

title: Can‚Äôt decide to buy???
text:
If you are debating wether or not to order this drone and if it is or isn‚Äôt worth the money, let me just tell you that it IS worth every penny.

Pros:
-The battery life on the drone keeps me flying longer than any other drone I‚Äôve had.
-The stability of the drone amazed me, can hover in spot even on a semi windy day.
-The camera has great quality for what you are paying for.
-Customer support has been great in responding to my emails and helping me with getting a part I need. Even sent me a link to a video on how to fix it.
I don‚Äôt have may of these, but.

Cons:
- had the controller wack out on me one time which caused my drone to do a flip in the air and crash. (Don‚Äôt know if it was the controller or my neighbor linking to one of his wifi controllers that caused this)
-doesn‚Äôt fly as far as I wanted with video, BUT!!!
(You can buy a WiFi REPEATER, and connect it to your drone, and your phone to the repeater to get better range. Usually and extra 150-200 yds straight line sight.)

All in all, I highly recommend this drone, especially for people who don‚Äôt want to spend a bunch of money. You will not be disappointed in the functionality of the drone. Great buy and I‚Äôd definitely do it again. Hope this helps anyone with their decision making.

title: Fun drone. Great company to do business with

Only had a couple chances to use this so far but it‚Äôs user friendly and has good video. Best part I like about this model is the adjustable camera angle so I can snap pictures and videos below the drone. Great battery life and Holy Stone has been very responsive to answer my questions via email. Highly recommend!

title: Excellent value for the cost - Great customer service
text:
Controls were intuitive, synching it to my iPhone via wifi was very easy. Battery has ample capacity.

Very solid quality and build, especially given the cost.

After 2.5 months of operation, the camera failed, and rather than ship the drone off for repairs, HolyStone sent a replacement. Probably the best service after the sale anyone could ask for.

Would purchase again!

title: Excellent features and great performance
text: I would definitely buy this again.  We were able to fly this very well but it does take some learning.  Their customer service is excellent.  This drone has almost everything we needed including a great warranty.

title: Fantastic first drone
text:
So far, the HS-720 is meeting all of the high expectations I had prior to purchasing it. It is very easy to fly, holds a stable hover, even in some wind. The build quality is high, especially at this price point. My only wish is for an increased ability maintaining FPV connectivity. Granted, it is performing as advertised, however, I would like a range that more closely matches the range of the 2.4 GHz of the controller. Since the 5GHz does NOT use the controller antennas, you are limited by your phone and the 5GHz radio. With the 5GHz spectrum being easily degraded by trees, for example. I am looking to add a better antenna to the 720 to see if it helps at all. While the camera is not on a 3-axis gimbal, I believe it does provide high enough quality for some photography and, with decent editing, some video as well.
I recommend this drone to anyone who is looking to get a good taste of FPV or a good all-round drone that provides a good bang for your buck.

title: Bad ass
text: Handled 55 mph winds

title: Just read it.
text:
Updating review from 2 stars to 4 stars. I'd honestly give it 3.5 if I could.

I received the HS720 on 4/26/2020. It was packaged very nicely. The battery was charged. I took it out. Calibrated it. 17 satellites displayed on the Drone. App was easy to connect. Video came through fine. Controls were great.

I charged it for about 5 hours and flew again. This time the Drone wouldn't hover it would just drift off or go all the way to the ground. It wasn't very windy. The worst issue was that it would only fly backwards. Whenever I would try to fly it forwards it was very unresponsive. When I flew backwards it was very responsive and took off. The only way to bring the drone back to me was to hit the return to home button or fly it backwards to me.

I charged it over night and tried again the next morning, same problem. I called Holy Stone and they wanted me to record a video of the Drone not flying forward. Like an idiot I tried, but that was impossible to do while holding the transmitter and trying to record the drone. So to avoid fighting with Holy Stone over a drone I had only owned for 2 days I sent it back to Amazon for a replacement. Amazon deserves most of the credit here for its great customer service. They gave me a return label and shipped me a new drone. The new drone works well so far.

After I posted my original 2 star review a HS employee (June) emailed me and asked about the review. I explained and told her I had already sent it back to Amazon. She offered to make it right by sending me a free replacement battery which she did. So she made up for what the original guy screwed up when it comes to service.

Now to the drone. It flies great. It's very small so when it's windy is doesn't fly as good. The orbit, return to home, and point map features all works great. The follow me feature works but not so good. I can outrun the drone and it won't keep up.

The video quality is just OK. Definitely not crystal clear but good for beginners.

The batteries take about 5 hours minimum to fully charge. When I received the second spare battery I ordered I could smell the lithium so I wouldn't charge them over night or when I'm not home.

Once you learn the routine of calibrating every time you turn it on it becomes easy. You have to calibrate for satellites every time you turn it on or put in a new battery.

Lots of features in the app as well including flight logs and gyro calibrations.

I would recommend the drone. The initial interaction with HS customer service left a bad taste in my mouth but the second employee (June) came in and saved the day for their reputation with me.

title: My first camera drone and its awesome !!
text:
Just decided to try and fly a drone.
Looked online at different options and the HS72 came clearly ahead.
As a beginner, I am more than impressed with this drone. it is easy to fly (just make sure you read the manual) and it takes decent pictures and videos. the lack of gimbal is made up by the rubber damper on the camera. It is very very adequate and the images are pretty stable.
Again, it's a beginner's drone, there are better but pricier drones out there. But to get a taste of it (to make sure you like it) and with a reasonable price, the HS 720 is the way to go !
I recommend buying an extra battery.

I actually bought another HS720 a few days later. so that I dont have to share with my son !!! he is 9 and he can fly it very easily.

title: UPDATE: Amazing Drone for beginners and intermediate users alike. THANKS HOLYSTONE CUSTOMER SERVICE
text:
UPDATE (LONG):
I have been recommending this particular Holystone drone to everyone that sees me flying it, and I can do it in all honesty. We have had some very windy weather lately, so I have been hesitant to fly it in such conditions (I have flown it in gusts of up to 25 mph). We finally got some a beautiful, calm weather, so I took it to a different place with some beautiful scenery. When I got it ready to fly, finished the calibration and had 10 satellites locked in (I usually fly with 13-14). When it took off, I could not control it at all, with the controller or with my 5G iPhone. It was if it were not connected. I tried to shut it down completely, but it was flying toward some bushes and starting to get higher. It finally hit the bushes and that stopped it. It was time for me to go home, so I packed it up and returned home. Later that afternoon, I went to fly it again, and it would not connect to my iPhone. I seemed that the built-in WIFI was not working. I tried everything that I knew how to do, tried 3 other phones, including an Android phone, but the HolystoneFPV_***** network never showed on any of the phones.
I contacted Holystone via email, and explained the problem. The next day I received a very nice email from Fiona who asked me to send some screenshots. Let me make this shorter as it is a long story. I sent the first email on March 26th. and had this continued over the course of a week. Fiona was very polite and it was obvious that she wanted to help. I just was not understanding what she wanted as I had tried to explain it as succinctly as possible. It made me wish that I had gotten my degree in Chinese Linguistics rather than German. Finally I told her that I thought there was a problem with a language barrier. The next day I got a very nice email from Vivian, who had an excellent command of English, and again I sent her screenshots and videos. This went on for a few more days, until I received an email from Nicole, who basically asked me the same questions and wanted the same screenshots and videos. Finally I received further communication from Vivian, saying that she was applying for a replacement drone for me.
Several days when by without any further communication, until I got a message on April 6th, that the replacement would arrive on April 10th. I have read almost all of these reviews stating how great Holystone Customer Service is and I can confirm it today. If you have a problem, they will take care of it, it may seem that you are caught in an endless loop, but they will come through for you. THANK YOU HOLYSTONE and to all of the customer relations agents that I corresponded with. YOU ARE GREAT!
ORIGINAL REVIEW:
With a few notable exceptions, this drone is able to be used by beginner or intermediate user. When I first received it the battery was only partially charged, so I put it on charge and since it was late (the battery takes 5 to 7 hrs to charge Fully) I left it overnight and went to bed. The next day a norther blew in and though the battery was fully charged, I being a beginner spent the afternoon reading the manual. It was 2 days later when the weather was good enough to chance a flight. Then I realized that due to its weight I would have to get an FAA license. This was easy enough going through the FAA website. Cost was only $5.00. I looked at every video on YouTube an between some confusion in the instruction manual and some confusion in the videos about the Lock button, I could not get it to fly. So another day passes and I finally figured out the lock button and I got it to fly! Got a full 30 minute flight out of the battery. The default setting is beginner mode. With this I am geofenced at 49 feet height, 49 feet distance and 49 feet radius around a point of interest. This is great for me as a beginner. As I improve I can turn off the beginner mode and set the height, distance and circling radius.
Some of the reviews stated that they could not get the follow me to work. I however did not have a problem. I was able to use the map to set waypoints on the screen which the drone then followed. You must remember to zoom in on the map. If you want 4K pictures and video you must use a TFT (miniSD card, NO LARGER THAN 32 gigs). Otherwise, it will save a lower resolution to your phone. You can fly the drone without your phone., using only the controller. If you take it out of the beginner mode and set the height to a great distance, the connection with the phone may be lost but you will still have the drone connected to the transmitter. This is a great feature as you can still press return to home and get your drone back. The more GPS satellites that you can connect to the better you will be able to get your drone to return to you. Since I was not sending it out very far or sending it very high I had no problem with the return to home. I don't know how it will be when I take it out of beginner mode and start flying it higher.
I will be having weekly updates to this review as I fly it more and learn more about it. Holystone has very good customer service, and if you purchase one of these do not hesitate to leave them an email or give them a call.
UPDATE:
it has been very windy here in San Antonio, Texas. Decided to go out with a 12 mile per hour wind gusting to 18 and went to high speed flying and spent 20 minutes dealing with the geofencing. Finally I got bold and I turned off beginners mode. Left the height at 49 feet but change my distance so that I could go further out. In the beginner mode you are geofenced in height, distance and POI. I'm not ready to go much higher, however, I would like to go out as far as I can see. After I turned off and adjusted the distance it was much more enjoyable Before it was like the drone ran into a brick wall and just stopped. I couldn't turn it around, but could bank it left and right and go backward that was it. I could press return to home and it would go back home but that distance limitation was annoying. So this at least will let me use follow me easier now. Just remember that when you turn off beginner mode you can adjust each one of your parameters to define what is right for you.

title: Ok
text: Easy to control. Great fun to use. You will be disappointed with the camera quality and image stability.

title: More fun the second time around
text:
Ok, so this is my second review of this drone. My first HS720 was given as a gift to my nephew. He's had it for about 10 days and absolutely loves it. He's done stuff with it that I didn't get a chance to do, however, I will post some updated photos once I get more time. Now.. on to the review.

The Holy Stone HS720 is my first purchase of a drone/quadracopter over $100 and I am pleasantly surprised of all the options that are available. It is definitely a step up over the "toy" drones I've had in the past. The build is a lot more solid and the stability in even strong winds really impressed me. I like the compactness of the drone and the way it stores easily. The folding is easy and has clear instructions on how to fold it.

As mentioned before, prior to purchasing the first HS720 I had not heard of HolyStone or any of its drone models, however, when I started looking and comparing, the price seemed a lot better than the competitors. It had everything I was looking for and more: long-range communication, better-than-HD video, long battery life, and Return To Home option. The remote/radio controller fits my phone (Samsung S8+) very well. I like the remote because it is not too cluttered and I fly with little effort.

As soon as I received the second model, I unboxed it and started flying it around. This time I was able to kill the battery after 15 minutes. The recharge time was still pretty long (6.25 hours) from dead to completely full charge. The second day I was able to flight it around on breezy day at some heights over 60 ft. I could see where the self-stabalization would engage whenever the wind would pick up. In less than a second, the drone was stable and steady. I have to work on my landings, however, the drone has held up like a champ.

One of the other options is the "follow me" mode and "point of interest" mode. Both worked well once I played with some of the settings. I'm sure they'll come in handy once I start using this for commercial photos and videos.

Overall, great product, great build, great materials. Easy to use and easy to learn. One of the biggest features that i wish this drone had is object avoidance like other manufacturers. This way I could fly with less apprehensiveness. Would definitely recommend as a personal gift or a gift to others. This is a perfect drone for a beginner or the next level up.

Also, their customer service is very helpful with questions and other requests I've had for them. They are well-informed and very friendly.

title: turn GPS off if few satellites located. If not, drone may veer in a different direction on takeoff

title: Great little drone!
text:
So, honest review... my first flight, I was really excited and got it into the air very easily with the launch/land button. I flew it around a bit, then flew it too high, got a wind gust and got it stuck in a tree!!! First 5 minutes.... Well a tennis ball knocked it out. A few days later I took it to a park (no trees) and had an absolute blast! I flew it high and far, to the point that I was afraid of maintaining connection and returned it using the RTH button. From several hundred yards away, it landed on point! Impressive! I've been thoroughly enjoying the drone.
One thing that I have learned is that if it crashes, turn it off, reset the compass and gyro and start over. Otherwise, the next launch it will not respond appropriately and may end up on the roof of your house....
The video and photos are excellent quality.
I am enjoying my HolyStone HS720 . Would definitely recommend to a friend!
