title: Good Drone/Just die in mid air and fell out of the sky and crashed.
text:
Above I've attached photos of the aftermath of my drone after falling out of the sky from about 200 ft.-for no apparent reason. Below is the email that I wrote to Holy Stone. No reply as of the writing of this review. Great quadcopter. I would buy another one if I could know it won't just die in mid-air

Holy Stone,
First let me say how much I enjoy my quadcopter. But unfortunately I have a major problem.
I was flying my HS720-4K drone on a clear sunny windless day. Suddenly and without warning at about 200 feet the drone went completely dead and crashed from that height. Due to know fault of my own. I've attached photos of the complete wreckage of the quadcopter.
At this time I am asking you to replace this faulty drone for a new identical make and model at no charge to me.
Before I purchased this product I read in the reviews very high ratings for your customer support. I was impressed. So now I hope you will do the right thing now and replace this it.

PS- You might want to find out why this drone malfunctioned like it did. Thank you.
O. Boston

title: great amazing drone
text:
i just got this one took out of the box. did calibration and was fine. took off flew 5 feet. wanted to see the return home and land. so i hit return home it then proceeded to fly up into a tree... then fell to the ground snapping one of the arms... out of the box no more then 5 min. if i would have know the return home makes it fly up...

edit: they shipped me out a new drone and its amazing. should put a caution on the thinner manual. say CAUTION Home button will cause drone to fly straight up make sure its clear of all obstacle.

title: First Drone had a mind of its own. Replacement is great
text:
I will preface this review with the information that I‚Äôm a retired military and commercial airline pilot rated in both jet aircraft and helicopters. With that said I will explain my one star rating. On my third flight after a photo session, I was at a three foot stabilized hover, ready to land, when the drone started a vertical climb. All attempts to stop it failed. At approximately 50 feet AGL, The drone leveled off and started a lateral movement to my left. Again, I had no control. It continued on that course until it hit a tree branch and became stuck. The engines continued to run as I was not able to shut it down. After about 45 seconds, the engines stopped. At that point it dislodged from the tree and fell to the ground. Upon inspection, I discovered the left rear engine and pod had separated from its arm.
I tried calling a Holy Stone several times, always getting a recording. I then decided to try email. After 24 hours I got a reply back saying they would send me the repair parts and I could install them. They then emailed me a link to a video on how to replace the arm. It requires tools that I did not have. I have emailed them two more times telling them I needed to return the drone for repair. No reply. I have called four more times today leaving messages and no return call. I have contacted amazon with this information and I‚Äôm waiting for their reply. I love the drone. What it did scares me about future mishaps if I ever get it repaired.
I hope to upgrade my one star rating at a later date. Time will tell.

As I said previously, I hope to update this. As usual, Amazon came through with their great support. They authorized me to return the drone for a full refund. I was finally contacted by a Holy Stone. It‚Äôs important to note here that I was informed they do not repair their drones. You either have to repair it yourself after they send you the parts, or you can return it to them for a credit. Exactly what type of credit I‚Äôm not sure. After al, this, I have ordered a different manufactures drone. I am waiting for delivery and will evaluate after I have put it through it‚Äôs paces. Whatever happens, I know Amazon will back it up.

The saga continues. In a further update, Holy Stone has replaced the drone even after I returned it for a refund from Amazon. They have been very good since the HS 720 project manager got involved. The new drone arrived today. I‚Äôm charging the battery now and will fly it our first nice day. More to follow.

The new drone performs as advertised. I‚Äôm very satisfied with it and their great customer service. They have been very responsive to all my needs.

title: I LOVE my HolyStone HS720
text:
A friend of mine spent over $500 for a Mavic Mini. We raced them, saw which one went higher and further, which pictures were better and my HS720 won by a LOT in all categories. The HS720 flew 3x higher and at least 3x further than the more expensive Mavic Mini. It's easy to control (it's my first drone so I'm no expert), has great GPS that prevents the wind from making it fly away and it always comes back to me regardless of how far away I fly it or even if I don't see where it went. It's really incredible. The best bang for your buck for a drone, easily.

I will also add that my first drone had a defective issue and stopped flying after a month. I emailed HolyStone and they replaced it with a brand new drone at NO charge. I was amazed. Thank you HOLYSTONE!!

title: Good Beginner Drone
text:
Great beginner drone made of durable materials. I had my first crash today where I accidentally flew the drone into some branches and landed in a foot of snow. After brushing off the snow, the drone took off on the next run.

Keep in mind, the camera is 2K quality. If you are looking for 4K quality pictures and video then I would recommend spending the extra money.

For this being my first drone I would say this is a fantastic product for the price point.

title: Into the night without a trace.....
text:
After purchasing this drone twice and before I really had adequate time to fully immerse myself in getting to know the drone on my first purchase an accident of my own fault left the drone inoperable. Second go around was not a good experience, my hs720 seemed very glitchy and lacked consistent operation from the get go. A normal flight consisted of the drone not always coming on and staying on, or connecting with the actual included remote itself. When I would get the drone in the air, it would hover in a large circle and during flight it was never stable enough to take photos that weren't lopsided, and video was so shaky watching playback was enough to make anyone feel queasy with all the movement back and forth or side to side. Finally, while visiting a nearby recreational off roading area, my suv became stuck in a sandy area leaving me stranded in the middle of nowhere practically forcing me to walk a few miles to get help to pull my vehicle out of the sandtrap I had inadvertently got stuck in. Before walking to get help from friends, I thought hey I can use my hs720 on follow me mode to help me get back to the other off roaders to be seen or see where I'm going, because to make matters more interesting this all happened right after sundown. Got my drone all calibrated, and ready to go, connected, 14gps signals, and off to sky, landing lights were bright and really helped light up the now pitch black night giving me a very confident sense of safety...and then my hs720 took off the opposite way I was heading at lightning speed, I tried everything on the remote to stop it ,but it continued high speed until gone! Last time I ever saw the drone I was really beginning to like, however the flashlight I had in my hand now ranked on a much higher satisfaction scale than my, well what use to be my hs720 drone.
Interestingly enough, I was contacted by HS asking me to please take down my negative review of the drone with an offering of a refund or replacement drone, my choice. I opted to try out another drone, I thought this to be too good to be true and was super excited! After several emails with a very helpful and courteous CSR, I was all set to receive my replacement HS720! My package arrived quickly within 3days, I couldn't open the box fast enough to try this drone out with hopefully a much better experience...and then, THERE IT WASN'T! Instead of the HS720, shipping had screwed up my replacement order and shipped out the HS270 2.7k, brushed motor quadcopter, even the order slip inside the box had a full description of the HS720 model information as being what was shipped. I uploaded photo's to CS, and was asked to pay for return shipping to send this hs270 back, and once received then the correct drone will be sent out.
After all of this, then getting built up to receive a replacement then receiving a different drone completely, I was done and decided it was just not meant to be for me to have or own an hs720 : ( I told the CSR if it were ok I'll would just keep the hs270 and leave it at that (being I live in a very small town with the closest UPS store 67 miles away) if this would be acceptable. That was completely fine with HS, and they also issued me a partial refund of $70 which was considerate. My first purchase was short lived due to accidental damage, and the second gone with the wind, and the third....completely wrong drone. Maybe a new hobby would be something to look into....

title: Easy to learn and use Drone.
text: I luv the feel it's really responsive and easy to pick up after about 5 min you feel like a pro and the vids and pics are very clear I use it for my kids baseball games and it works perfectly for what I need keep it up HolyStone your Drones are very awesome..üëçüëç

title: WORTH... wait for.... IT!!!!
text:
Honestly, I was initially concerned after reading some of the reviews and what occurred to them when I first ordered this device. However, I opted to give it a shot. After having it out for three days and 15 flights for total of over 3 hours of enjoyment, I am happy to provide the following:

As a former PARROT 2.0 and other micro Drone owner, not only has the technology advanced by leaps and bounds on drones (micro or otherwise), the cost was almost 'too good to be true'. Upon receipt of the prompt delivery, it was obvious the packaging was solid, in-spite of being clearly handled roughly in transit. (i.e. exterior of packaging was torn/damaged as was original box, but the contents remained unharmed from external damage, due to the foam padded Carrying Case included.)

After reviewing the manual (a couple of times...), charging the battery and taking it out for a few flights, by day THREE of using drone, it was easy to handle and manage for a distance of about 300ft. (only because I haven't FULLY learned how to properly extend the limits on this yet) The video tutorials provided from the in app "HELP" are enlightening and extremely helpful to review prior to first FLIGHT. The "HOME" return button is a LIFE SAVER! Still working w/settings and how to establish better flight patterns and use of 'follow-me' feature(s). The tilt feature on the camera is amazing, as is the quality of the imagery and video produced (contingent upon connectivity too). Easy to learn and use controls (w/iPhone adaptable controller).

While the controller fits well in 'Medium' sized hands, since it has to link to iPhone/Android device, iPads are not feasibly used (by single individual w/o prior proper planning and programming flight paths). If you want or need something larger to view LIVE FLIGHT on WHILE in use, be advised this controller barely accommodates the iPhoneXR (w/o its protective case).

The flight time is quite extensive (especially compared to outdated Parrot 2.0 Drone, by technological default) so it makes getting the video/images desired easier and not so rushed. While some vibration may be seen in the video when increasing/decreasing altitude (as well as w/any fast movement)... Still shots are AMAZING!

As the fourth kind of "Drone" acquired, this has been my best experience thus far. HIGHLY ENCOURAGED for those who wish to see things from a different perspective (w/o 'breaking the bank'). Despite AMAZON's suggestion to upload images, their system isn't currently accepting anything from Apple/ iPhone (HEIC) .jpg, or .jpeg. lest they reveal their 'limitations' for uploads. I have both, but neither is acceptable upload for AMAZON... YET!

Like all birds, though, you must understand flight rules. While this is good for beginners, they must be responsible beginners or have a coach nearby to keep them from annoying the FAA. :)

title: Drone Batteries
text:
Not a review, but more of a discussion about drone batteries.

It looks like a really nice drone. Nice features and looks.
However, this drone like many others have
proprietary battery packs that are insanely expensive.
Also, with charge times of upwards of 5 hours, that's pretty long.

For me, this puts a serious damper on me buying these
types of drones. Now if they had a empty battery case that could be fitted with your own LiPo/Li-ion batteries
that would be great. Also, to have the ability to charge with hobby grade battery chargers would be great.
Even better would be an over the counter regular hobby battery pack with an ec2 connector and a balance charge connector.

In summary, the Holy Stone HS720 may be a great drone, but my Husban H501SS Professional uses regular hobby batteries with ec2 and balance charge connector for around 10 - 15 dollars. Also it has a very nice FPV LCD built into the controller.
All for under $200.

Don't let me dissuade your buying decisions. I just personally dislike being overcharged for proprietary battery packs.

title: I have had a lot of quadcopters
text:
I am in no way new to flying quads... And my hs720 must have a defective GPS unit or something. Or maybe a bad gyro.

When I push forward on the pitch stick and let off in GPS mode, it just keeps going forward. When I try to correct the pitch, it refuses until it crashes. GPS is supposed to provide for position and altitude hold, my HS720 does neither.

I would have returned it except I didn't get it through amazon, I just wanted to share my experience. What you get is what you pay for, except I have had other sub $300 even sub $200 quads with GPS that work just fine. This one did not.

title: Perfect 1st Drone
text: Bought this as a gift for my husband. He loves it. We took it to Colombia with us so we could do aerial shots of the coffee farm. Awesome little drone!

title: Great drone, tons of features and great price!
text:
When I received my first HS720 and was a little disappointed when I opened the Amazon box. The HS720 package was damaged. I removed it from the Amazon box and found the box was opened. I was getting more upset the further into the unboxing I went. Sure enough, the drone had damage as well. And it looked as if it had been flown and wrecked. I boxed it back up and requested a replacement from Amazon.

My replacement arrived yesterday. Unboxing went well. No damage at all. It was in perfect condition.

I charged up the battery and started reading. Once the battery was full I went outside and followed the pairing and initialization process. It was very quick and straight forward.

Struggled a bit to use my phone with the remote. The holder would not grip my phone with the case on it. I ended up putting an older phone with no case in the holder and that worked. Since that phone isn't active I was not able to use the GPS functions. Once you connect to the drone you cannot use your home wifi... I think I'll get a Tracfone SIM to be able to use data while I fly.

Operating the drone was straight up easy. I need to get more familiar with all the new controls. I had the drone up and over the yard and house. The flight was very stable and I got my first in-flight video. The picture quality was ok. I found an old memory card and put it in. I'll use that to capture video and photos. I think having to transmit and record to the phone impacts quality.

flew for about 20 minutes and got the first low battery notice. I pressed the Return to Home button and it flew to the spot I took off from.

The photos I included were from the first drone and it‚Äôs unboxing. The last one with my EarPods is the new one.

Overall I am very pleased with the HS720! Now I need a spare battery!

Update 1/15/2020
Picked up a Tracfone SIM and activated my old phone ... I am having some difficulties with the APP and the drone. It appears there are some known bugs with Samsung Android phones. I will try moving the SIM card from the Samsung to an old iPhone 5 and see if that works better.

I was having a heck of a time trying to get a video to save to the memory card. Apparently there is memory card size limitation of 32GB. No videos would save to my 128GB Samsung SD card. I ordered a 32GB card. Will try that to capture videos. I could store photos and download them with no issue.

Flight time yesterday was around 20 minutes. It was a little breezy and i noticed the flight was not as steady as it had been on earlier flights on calmer days. I was still able to fly around the yard and maneuver easily. I was a little hesitant to go up over the house without the APP working correctly on my Samsung.

title: Great drone for beginners
text: I like the Holy Stone drone if you are new to drones because you fly with care and slow movement of the new drone. This makes learning to fly a drone sweet. But as you advance your skills the drone doesn‚Äôt respond the way you need it to respond. This will confuse you because you feel like the drone is not working right as your skills develop. Once I tried a higher end drone that responded to my command I found that it‚Äôs not my drone it‚Äôs me and my skills have developed so once I bought a higher end drone I was happy but not for the cost. I still have my Holy Stone and I still fly it but when I fly it I fly it slow and get some great pictures from it. One other thing expect to crash! So fly it in the biggest open space you can. Once you have learned how to control it then fly it around your house or other places that have obstruction. You will be so happy you leaned to fly before you lose it in someone backyard.

title: This little guy is a great way to start the drone life style
text:
I have been wanting to get a drone for a long time. they looked really fun and the idea of the aerial view that could be recorded has been an" I can't wait "aspect to my wish. This little drone is easy to set up and the learning curve is really steep. Please find a wide open flat spot to start your practice sessions. also try to start on windless days. I seemed to have an occasional problem with the drone self drifting on its own. This included one episode where it went under my truck.
I left the controls set up as they came. the left toggle act as a collective- up and down, and the right a cyclic-forward back left right like a helicopter.
The video is good. The biggest problem I had was the phone kept switching back to my house wifi, so move far enough away.
i haven't try the orbit or follow functions yet. I am doing this in little bits, trying to develop some muscle memory.
Give yourself enough room and pick nice days to get started. I live in alaska and had to wait 3 months for the weather to improve before I went out. It does seem to to handle wind well but I was hesitant to test that ability initially.
This starter drone seems to be just what I wanted. I have not even gotten close to running down the battery.

Lastly, there is an app that lets you know if you're in a restricted air space so if you take it on the road it keeps you forgetting in a bind.

title: Great service, good price.
text: At first I received this and the better at wouldn‚Äôt charge fully. One email later and the next day I had a new battery waiting for me! I plugged it in, powered it up and this thing is awesome for the price. The service makes it that much better! Lots of extras are good too! So far it flies well and connects easily after a small learning curve

title: Save for the ‚Äúname brand‚Äù until HS uses a real gimbal
text:
Wife got it for my birthday overall is fine for a beginner drone. You will crash it mine broke on first flight when the return to home function tried to keep up with a constantly moving gps signal it ignored all my commands from 80 ft away with the controller and did what it wanted while coming down..customer service is very good and kind and sent a replacement arm for free which is appreciated. I fly freestyle quads so im not a newbie didnt like that i didnt have full control even with the remote..device needs a kill switch holding the arm switch down for 3 seconds is supposed to turn off the motors but 3 seconds is a long time when the drone randomly does what it wants.. biggest complaint is the gimbal system it doesnt exist its only a vibration dampener which does absorb motor vibration but you will still get motion sickness watching a video it is not a smooth sailer. The camera is actually pretty good for the price my pics are from the images it saved to my phone not from the onboard sd card which are cleaner images forgot to load it for this flight. The battery is also very good and i have yet to even finish a battery before i get bored and nervous that the thing might take off into restricted airspace.HolyStone put on a real gimbal and a kill switch and beef up the video antennas and it will a very real competitor to those other guys..but in the end i really want a stable image on a ‚Äúcinematic‚Äù drone so i gotta dump more money on the competition. HS Keep going and most definitely keep up the good customer service i hear the other guy is terrible in that department..!

After follow up check ups by Holystone im increasing their stars to 4 based on the friendly and genuine customer service.

title: They care about the customer!
text: I love this drone! Easy to use and customer support is awesome! There are no crash sensors so you have to pay attention to what you‚Äôre doing. But, for the price you can‚Äôt get a better drone. Max, in customer service was great also. I needed help with something and he was right on it. Thank you Max and Holy Stone.

title: HS720D great drone for beginners

title: Lost forever (Update!)
text:
I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this drone. My husband actually loved it though. 2nd time he flew it, it randomly lost connection and didn‚Äôt come home it just fell from the sky and it‚Äôs nowhere to be found. 300$ just flew away not even a week after we got it. Very disappointed

Update********

I contacted amazon because I kept just saying 300$ down the drain. Omg. Well Amazon got me in contact with the seller and they are ABSOLUTELY amazing!!!!! I called on a Saturday and on Tuesday I had a replacement drone. I‚Äôm pretty sure something was mechanically wrong with it for it to just fall outta the sky and not come home like it should have. Either way they earned a forever customer. I do have to replace the micro sd card but I don‚Äôt care. They just hands down have been the best with communication and all.

title: Great Product
text: Great product.  I found this drone has a lot of capabilities to offer that are found in other drone a lot more expensive.  You need to practice and practice and there are many tutorials on YouTube to help.  Video was very good and the home feature helps keep you out of trouble.  One recommendation is to purchase some reflective orange tape and add to the front of the drone to help see which direction the drone is facing when it is  further away.  It is hard, at least for my old eyes to see if it is facing towards you or away and knowing that will help in knowing which way the controls need to be pushed.  Battery gives you plenty of time to enjoy flight time

I have bought Holy Stone products in the past and I am truly impressed with the quality of their latest drone.

title: Holy Stone HS720.
text:
[[VIDEOID:7896d0bcc87283ed940aef2917d55b5]] This is my second drone from holy stone. The first one I bought was the new HS270. Although it's the newest model it's not better than the HS720. With that said I am not impressed with this drone. The very first time I flew this drone and hit the take off button it hovered at about 4' for a few seconds and then made a hard turn right in to my BBQ that was 6' away.

The second time I flew it it hovered ok but had a hard time staying in one spot. After ascending the drone and flying around a bit the inputs were very delayed. During a turn either by yaw or axis, when I let go of the sticks the drone would continue to move for a several feet before stopping and then returning to the point where I stopped giving input. There was times the drone started to fly away and lower in altitude without any input.

I ascended a couple hundred feet all within the line of sight and completely lost connection with my phone. The controller still worked, but if I hadn't had a line of sight I could have lost orientation of the drone.

Camera; now I realize this is not a 3 axis gimbal, but this camera is awful (video attached using point of interest mode). It's very unstable with terrible quality.

This is a good drone maybe GPS positioning is bad; I don't know.

Update: After flying this for a 3rd time. It crashed into a tree and broke the arm. Sadly I was told there are no replacement parts to purchase in order to repair. Holystone said to send a photo and reason for the crash. As of now I am still waiting on a reply from HS.

Update: Holystone's customer service is spot on. After telling them about the crash they followed up with some additional questions. I actually thought they were covering their warranty only to tell sorry they're was nothing more to do but low and behold I was sent an email stating they were sending me another drone, wow mind blown. On top of that they told me to keep the broken drone for parts. I was very impressed. This was all taken care within a 24 hour period.

I hope they continue with their progress and come out with a 3 axis gimbal camera drone.

title: The definition of a Sexy drone
text: [[VIDEOID:ff92973674daa68316438fb03c5c7e76]] This thing is Sexy! I fell in love with it when I first laid eyes on it. I have not had a chance to put this beauty in the air yet but when I do I'm sure I'll need at least four batteries for the amount of time I want to spend with her. I love the construction of it. Made with scratch proof material but I'm sure I will put my marks on her. I'm sure I will buy another one just to have as a display model. For the love of Holy Stone Drones!

title: Fairly easy to fly.
text: Fairly easy to fly. Picture quality is 4 star. The app take some time get use to. It fly's far and fast and can get out of site fairly fast. But if that happens there is a "return home button". *NOTE* They don't tell you that you "legally' have to register this drone with the FAA and have to get a Drone Pilot license. The registration cost $5 and is good for 3 years. The class and test for the license is free online (uavcoach.com). There is a lot of good responsible info in the class and easy to pass the test. You have to mark your drone with it's FAA reg # and have to carry the Drone Pilot license with you when flying. Fly responsibly.

title: A very feature-rich drone for all flyers at a great price!
text: This is really an amazing drone for it's price. It is absolutely suitable for beginners and experts alike. This is my first drone and so far, I've had no problems getting used to it. I had to make sure I took it out at least twice before writing my review so I could give you an honest opinion. This unit will take off and land itself, includes optical flow sensor, follow me mode, orbit, headless flight and if you get stuck you can just release the controls and it'll stabilize itself. I was very impressed at how it handled windy conditions, even in low-speed mode. Extra windy conditions will cause higher battery drain but its rated flight time is pretty darn close to the rated 26 minutes but I was afraid to take it too low and ended flight at around 18 minutes. I had a blast with this drone but be aware it's weight means it'll need to be registered with the FAA which is easy enough! HolyStone drones are really neat maybe my next one will be a gimbaled model but even this one, without EIS or gimbal takes pretty decent images and videos!

title: Very good price for the features; OUTSTANDING customer service
text: There's a lot I like about this sUAS. It's very easy to connect and fly. The controls are thoughtful and the phone mount is really good. Having said that, the battery life on my drone is awful! I initially charged both batteries overnight, but when installed in the aircraft each battery showed only 3 out of 4 status lights. Once the flying started I got about 7-8 minutes before the "low battery" warning began to flash on my screen. I've only cycled them through about 3 times (full use/recharge) but I'm very disappointed. Not sure if I'm going to replace this with a different brand, or possibly purchase new batteries.  UPDATE: I reached out to Holy Stone Saturday afternoon. I heard back within a few hours. They thoughtfully walked me through troubleshooting, documented the issue, and are now sending out a new battery. Great customer service!

title: Lots of fun, with a few flaws
text:
This is my first drone, so take this review with a grain of salt. It was ordered for me by my wife on her account, so this review may not indicate "verified purchase", or whatever.
I picked this drone for its good reviews and reasonable price, and I am mostly not disappointed. It was easy to learn, is fun to fly, and takes nice pictures and video. Each battery is rated at 26 minutes flight time and I think this is accurate. That said, a battery takes 5+ hours to charge, so having two is a must, I think.
The charging system is the weakest part of the package, I think. The batteries plug in awkwardly and loosely into a bar with metal prongs. The physical connection is not secure and the battery easily falls away if jostled. On my unit, the green light does not stop flashing and turn solid as it should to indicate a full charge. I am not sure if the fault is in the battery or the charger. I will call Holy Stone customer support to get more information.
Also, Holy Stone does not include the brick to plug into the wall outlet; you have to provide that separately. I realize a lot of companies have taken this route but we have so many of these at home already, BUT, Holy Stone makes a point (in the manual) that it should be 5V 2A. Many charging bricks are 5V 1A and would presumably charge even more slowly. Others have a higher amp rating. Can they be used safely without causing problems, eg overheating or damaging the battery? Holy Stone doesn't say. If it is important, Holy Stone should have provided a brick. As it is, check to see what you have when you order this drone.
The range of the controller to the drone is about 3000 feet. Plenty far enough for me. However, the range for the FPV (first person view) using the camera is much less than that. For this one has to connect one's phone to a WiFi hotspot generated from the drone in phone settings, then open an app called Ophelia GO. This app displays what the camera sees. The range for the WiFi signal is not nearly as far. So, while one is flying the controller beeps and the image disappears from the app. Reconnecting to WiFi is a kludge. Holy Stone says nothing about this in the documentation.
The app has a few problems. One can change a few settings, eg from metric (default) to imperial, and some flight parameters can also be changes as well. And distance must be changed or else one can only fly 50' away. But these changes don't "stick." Closing and then reopening the app returns them to the defaults.
So, even with these complaints, am I having fun? Am I glad of our purchase? Yes to both.

title: Awesome

title: Excellent drone for the money!
text: This drone has exceeded my expectations.  I was originally looking at the Mavic Mini and then ran across this model by Holy Stone.  After further research and actually contacting Holy Stone I gave the HS720 a try.  Sure glad I did.  I spent less on the HS720 and got features the Mavic Mini did not have.  I highly recommend this model as it has a no risk trial period and is packed with nice features for the price point.  The battery charge time may be a bit longer than some desire, however it is at a price point where you can afford additional batteries and get some nice features that a Mavic Mini does not have.  BTW, the Mavic mini does not have a 4K camera and the HS720 takes awesome video and photos.

title: First time drone user, no problems with this great drone
text: This is an excellent drone for the money. I am a first time drone pilot and did a copious amount of research before purchasing this product. First, when it arrived, I could tell it was not a "toy". It is heavily and strongly built, and I find the carrying case it comes with to be very convenient. Though initially I had a problem linking with it from my Samsung phone, it turned out I was just a little too far away from it, and after that, it was no problem at all to get  it linked and flying. Again, I am a novice, but it was no problem getting it into the air and learning the controls.  Thanks HolyStone for making such a great drone!

title: Customer Service üíØ!
text:
Was in the market to buy a drone, went thru reviews on what seemed to be a rabbit hole of a multitude of diff types and manufacturers... all sold a fairly similar setup for each price range with each manufacturer having their own tweak to each drone product so as a 1st time user I wanted to keep it around $300 for trial and error purposes and reports of drones just going awol and missing, never know. I went with this HS720 because of the raves about customer service. Let's face it, nobody wants to ever need to call CS but in times when you need to, you want them to...well, provide the customer good service!

Truth be told, I did have intermittent issues with the one I received. Had fresh batteries, open area, 12-16 satellites, successful calibration, the whole 9yds. It seemed that every other time I put the drone off the ground it wanted to fly itself with no regard to the transmitter or controller. I would engage the button for auto take off, every time it would lift and sit about 6ft off the ground and hover perfect...for about 10 seconds. with no fingers on the controls it would start pulling one direction or another then you could hear the motors ramp up to speeds exceeding what it uses when flying and then go until it hit something with no way to bring it back or land it safely. Now that was about every other time. The other times it flew gracefully and in full control, I'm not sure what the disconnect was because every time I went thru the same steps successfully to get it up (Fresh Batteries, Good GPS, Calibration).

After a full day of hit and miss flights, it finally took damage and I say finally because I swore after each collision on its rogue adventures that it was done but this thing honestly just kept getting back up, it was quite impressive to be honest. It hit a pine tree at 50ft, smacked several branches on the way to the ground on one of its rogue flights and had suffered no damage! Like, the thing is damn tough, for real lol. The last crash was its easiest landing and that is the one that somehow broke it. It gave me a day of fun and intermittent frustrations but when it did fly under control it flew well.

I contacted customer service about a week after coming back to town and emailed them what had been happening with it, I let them know that I was willing to pay for any damage that I caused as an error in my flying abilities but I wasn't okay with it if it was because of the drones inability to take commands from the transmitter. I knew I would have to invest money into something such as a drone for long term use and still willing to do so because this thing is awesome! After a few emails, they asked for me to send the unit back to them and they are sending me out a new one. Lemons happen people, no matter what it is in life that you buy or invest in but having people that stand by their products really means something.

In shortüòÑ, if you're looking for a drone, get one from Holystone, whichever model fits your needs or level of expertise. The one factor that had me lean towards them to begin with is the one that is saving me now CUSTOMER SERVICE!

title: A+ drone, A+++ customer service
text:
So this is my second drone, the first one also being a Holy Stone, slightly upgraded to this one. The controls are easy to use and understand, The control of the HS 720 is very good, even with a good wind, the GPS kept it within a foot of its original position at all times. The remote is very responsive and allows for the most delicate fine tune flying. The main use for my purchase is to examine house roofs so being able to fly slow and close without hitting anything is a definite plus, just don‚Äôt do it on windy days since wind currents are stronger closer towards building surfaces. The high resolution 4K camera takes really good pictures, and with the ability to remotely angle the camera lens 90 degrees up and down makes taking pictures in different angles a breeze. The only issue I had was with the RTH ‚Äúreturn to home‚Äù automated feature when the battery is low. There are two safety low-voltage RTHs. The first making sure that the drone is within your range and if not, goes within a specific range with the maximum height of 98 feet. The second low-voltage RTH automatically will land your drone and take it back to its original point of origin (where it took off) based on a GPS location. The only issue is that it‚Äôs not 100% accurate and in my situation, did some damage. Right before landing the drone the second low-voltage RTH took control of the drone and readjusted its location to land where it thought was the original location but instead went right into the side of a house causing it to fall. When the second low voltage RTH takes control, as far as I know, you can‚Äôt regain control of the drone because it‚Äôs basically in an emergency landing procedure. Word of advice, when the first low battery warning initiates, land your drone immediately if you‚Äôre surrounded by obstacles like houses or trees. On the positive side, Holy stone customer service was beyond excellent. I found the email in the instruction booklet, sent a detailed message of what had happened and received a reply first thing the next morning completely dedicated to rectifying the situation and making sure that I was happy. Communication was fast and responsive and in the end, they sent me the parts required to fix the drone and a handy YouTube repair video.
With the Included features and the ease of flying, plus the excellent customer service, I would highly recommend the HS720 drone to anyone looking to purchase a higher end drone without the higher end price.

title: If my 5 drones, I give the Holy Stone 720 my highest ratings
text:

Not allowed to provide names except for the product I felt had the best qualifies; hence, my recommendation of the Holy Stone 720.
This drone is super quiet, fast, and knows it‚Äôs way back home. I tested at 3077 feet, with ends sometimes gusting, and this drone kept its position with remarkable precision. No issues with this drone, just pure fun flying it!

title: Longevity Review
text:
Just wanted to post a review after I had tested the drone.

Ive now had the HS720 over a year. I purchased it in November of 2019. So Ive had it close to a year and a half.

Ive used it approx 30 times in that year and a half and I have to say its held up exceptionally well. I did have to purchase some additional props for it. But other than that, the drone and the controller are in great shape.

Alot of that comes from the nice storage case that is included with the drone.

There are only two things id like to see improved upon. The battery to charger connection could be a little more secure. But not a deal breaker. I just have to be careful once plugged in that I move it, or the connection might come undone.

And of course the most common complaint of charging time. 5-7 hours.

But again for the price savings you get from buying this drone. And by savings I'm talking a couple hundred dollars. I can live with the charging time. Especially since I picked up a spare battery and the charger allows for the hook up of two batteries at one time.

Final rating = A

title: Pretty easy
text: This is my first drone, and I'm still learning. It can be really hard to control in the wind, but all things considered, I'm really enjoying this!

title: A little tricky setup, but flies well
text:
We got this for one of our kids for Christmas, and we finally got to take it out to a field to fly. The initial pairing setup was a little tricky, but we got it working. Make sure to join the Wi-Fi network that the drone creates so the phone app can talk to it, and approve any local network prompts.

In the air, this thing is incredibly stable and can go shockingly high! We had it at several hundred feet, and we didn't go higher for fear of losing it on the first run. It could probably have gone even higher. Performance wise, I feel like the mass of the thing makes turning and changing direction a little sluggish. Also, going up was considerably faster than coming down for some reason. We're fairly new to drones, especially $100+ ones, so it very well could just be lack of experience here.

The angle-adjustable camera picture is OK, but can be a little overexposed at times. The videos it produces have a noticeable rolling shutter, but it's not terrible. But, we're mostly more in it for the flying anyway.

This drone is fun to fly for kids and adults, is very stable, and the battery lasts a good long while. I want one of my own now!

title: My first drone - very exciting
text: This is my first drone and I received it as a Christmas gift.  A lot to figure out on operating and flying this thing.  I am a pilot, and have been in aviation for over 40 years, so I am familiar with FAA regulations, and those pertaining to drones.  I am surprised that the instructions only briefly mention the FAA requirement on page 43.  It states that you "may" be required to register the drone.  In reality, you are required to register it, and it must be registered before you operate it.  The FAA web site is easy to navigate and it only costs 5.00.  This should be at the very front of the instructions and should be the first thing that you do.  Another item I learned is that the unit compass has to be calibrated every time it is turned on and used.  Couldn't figure out why it wouldn't fly, finally found a statement on page 20 that states "every time the drone is powered on the compass calibration should be performed"  Well you can take out the word "should" and replace it with "must."  The unit is fun to operate and works good.  The camera is good, and is adjustable in flight, only wish it had zoom capability.  One thing I have not established is if you always have to have a wifi connection to fly it.  You have to download an app to your phone, and use a wifi connection, which then connects you to the wifi connection created by the drone, which runs off the phone app.  I will need to see if this will fly without a wifi connection, if it wont, then taking it out on hiking adventures wont work.

title: Could not be happier
text: This is my third drone.  I wasn't going to buy any more because the features and quality I wanted was going to cost me too much.  Then, this drone comes out the day I was just browsing around for fun.  I didn't believe it could actually be this loaded with features and meet my price range.  I knew it was going to be extremely popular, and probably sell out soon.  I ordered mine right away.  It is AWESOME.  FPV, return to home, 2K video, long battery life...ALL WORK GREAT!  Easiest drone I have ever flown as well.  GPS is great!  Watching you and your drone live on google maps is cool.  Camera control, telemetry, battery life, etc all viewable through the app.  The app works great as well.  Overall, I am very pleased.  I even crashed it hard into some power lines and not a scratch.  I thought for sure I would have at least broken a prop.  I have shown three people and all three are going to buy one.  You just can NOT beat it at this price.

title: Received a Used Item as a Replacement That Works Worse Than the Original!
text:
I originally purchased this item on July 20, 2020, when I received it, the box had a sticker on it from Amazon saying that the serial number was not in their system, no big deal since the drone looked sealed and unused. I opened it and after charging the battery for 5 hours started to use it. The drone flies nicely, although the GPS hold is shaky, in several instances, instead of holding position, the drone would circle the position. I tried out some of the features that sold me on the drone, when I tried the TapFly feature, it failed to send the waypoints to the drone. I got a failure every single time regardless of how far the drone was from me at the time. This is the main reason that I decided to exchange it for a new one.

Amazon processed the exchange and I immediately noticed that I was being sent a used item, the item I was replacing was less than 2 weeks old, why wouldn't they replace it with a new item? I could understand if it was a warranty issue, after the return period expired, then receiving a refurb would be acceptable. Not on an item that I just purchased that didn't work. When I received the item last night, sure enough, it was used. The box wasn't sealed and when I opened it, things were just thrown around everywhere, including the owners manual that was from a Potensic D88 drone, not the Holy Stone HS720 that I purchased. To make matters worse, the replacement drone must have been returned for a technical issue because the controls stuck at least 3 times in the 10 minute test flight that I took. I would hold the stick forward, the drone would go forward, but when I released the stick, it should immediately stop, however, it continued forward for about 5 feet after I released it. This is a safety issue and this drone should've never been cleared by Amazon to go back out.

I guess since I cannot receive a new item to replace the new item I purchased, I have no choice but to return the drone for a refund. I can't even return it and rebuy it because I got it on sale and it is $50 more expensive then I paid. Amazon service is really going down hill!

title: nice beginner drone package
text: [[VIDEOID:bb1a608211180623494a34aeb60c5002]] I was very impressed with the drone package I received from Holy Stone. The packaging was top notch, the carrying case was of great quality. The controller is very nice, the highest quality controller I've seen from Holy Stone. The battery meter and signal meter are awesome to have for a beginner, especially with a drone with this high range and battery life. The drone holds its position fairly well, as you would expect from a gps drone.  I would definitely recommend this drone for a beginner, though I would recommend a wide open space without trees or power lines as with any drone. I like to do most of my outdoor flying at above 100 feet, which this drone ascends to with ease. The camera, while not stabilized, is goood for home videos, pictures of scenery, youtube video, and learning drone photography. This is the first outdoor gps drone I've purchased from Holy Stone, and it is a great outdoor beginner package, it comes with everything you need other than the 2 AA batteries for the controller. But once you charge the battery and get it out, it's surprisingly quiet. Once I get above the tree line, its a fun one to fly around the neighborhood, fairly responsive. The video added to my review is a bit jerky as it was a little windy that day, but  it shows you the sharpness of the camera, and even with the movement has little to no "jello". The still shots have great definition, but work best when taking from a downward angle to avoid the propellers in the way.

title: Amazing customer support, providing fast response when needed
text: The HS720 drone is easily the most affordable and has the best capabilities for the price, if you need customer support they are one of the best, by far.  Response time was quick, turn around time was days not weeks getting me back up and running.  My HS720 drone takes amazing pictures and does an awesome job hovering to allow even better views.  I would highly recommend Holy Stone over the higher priced competitors.  I would give 6 stars if I could.  I worked with a representative by the name of Echo who was understanding of the situation, set me at ease that he was taking care of that situation, and took care of the situation in a very timely manner and fashion with speedy updates.

title: Good for its price range
text: The drone tends to drift its vision positioning is very particular it doesn't like carpet or short grass but if there is a very distinct pattern below it, it is very good at holding its position. the video stabilization feature where the camera is loose to prevent vibrations causes heavy camera shake when it is moving. the blades are surprisingly sturdy with their hinged design the first set has survived over 5 crashes as I have been learning the system. I have not had a chance to test the GPS features that require outdoor use due to snow did do a quick lap in the snow and it behaved about the same as inside. it is really compact a nice size for easy traveling the drone almost folds down to the same size as the controller. It is great for beginners. Battery charge time is a little long at 5-7 hrs.

title: Probably the best drone I have flown for the money
text:
[[VIDEOID:97de0255ffb157704afbd5c41484dd68]] 1-6-2020 Update - after about 8 more hours of flying time with this drone I am giving back the one star I deducted for phone holder placement as it just isn't enough to detract from how solid a flyer this drone is.

I purchased the HS720 drone during the pre-Christmas sales on Amazon as it looked like a great deal for a Mavic-esq style foldable GPS drone. It had all the basic features I expect in a GPS drone such as one button Return To Home (RTH), lost signal RTH, and low battery RTH. I have about 30 flights under this drone for about 12 hrs of total flight time day and night and I can tell you this thing does not miss a beat. Low wind, medium wind (8-10 mph gusts) and it holds position pretty rock steady. I am definitely impressed. One thing I can tell you is this drone is definitely the N00B friendliest drone I have ever flown, wish it was available when I first started.

Breakdown of my thoughts on this drone:

Packaging and ease of assembly - excellent packaging in the included case, and literally NO ASSEMBLY it's basically ready to fly out of the box with the following steps:

1) Open the box - It comes with Drone, Case, Dual USB-C charger (note it charges one battery at a time), screw driver, spare propellers, USB-C cable.

2) Charge the battery and insert 2 AA batteries into the controller

3) Download the Ophelia GPS app

4) Obtain your FAA recreational drone license (at this time it is $5.00 for a 3 year license) and mark your drone with your FAA number in permanent ink or by permanent sticker.

Once the battery is done charging you are ready to launch!

Flight and battery time - From experience READ THE MANUAL and always follow the pre-flight steps below BEFORE EVERY flight!

1) Pair the drone and controller

2) Perform compass calibration

3) Perform gyro calibration (both sticks down and left at the same time, see troubleshooting in the manual)

4) Get 10+ satellites locked in before launch (takes about 1 min)

Launching is simple after following the above steps, hit the unlock button and either left stick up or use one button take off and your flying. I have had this drone up to the factory ceiling of 116m (380 ft) every flight with zero issues except for the FPV. This is believe is 100% due to the placement of the phone holder being above the antenna which in my estimation is the drones ONLY drawback as it seems to interfere with the FPV or the controller. Note that this is not a huge issue since as recreational flyers you fly Line Of Sight unless you have a spotter BUT this is the reason for the drop from 5 to 4 stars. Holy Stone you need to employ a similar setup as other controllers you have with the phone at the bottom.

In the Ophelia app you can employ the orbit point of interest function, fly a preset path, or follow me. All work well for a drone at this price point. One button RTH puts the drone either right on my drone pad or with a foot or two of the edge. A word of caution: when the drone hits the first battery warning (slow red flashing of the rear lights) bring her into a location with no obstructions as when the drone hits the second low battery warning you have NO CONTROL and it will hit any obstacles there may be in the way of it's path home. This one is common sense so don't push it.

As for flight time I have gotten 23-26 minutes every flight from the 1st to the 30th with no change in flight time, I would however get a second battery now that they are available, plus with the battery you get a nice bag to utilize with them.

Camera - the camera works as expected for a drone at this price point, it has nice video/still resolution and full motion up and down.

Bottom line this is a great beginner drone that would be hard to lose short of human error and works better than expected at the price!

title: Exactly as awesome as advertised!
text:
Holy Stone did a fantastic job at explaining exactly what to expect when flying the hs720. I am a 1st time drone flier and I flew for the first time successfully without any major problems. It is definitely important to not only read the instructions included, but register and follow FAA guidelines. I Registered as a hobbyist flier.

The GPS keeps the drone very stable in flight, but controls are sensitive. It takes practice. The auto pilot does exactly what the manual says, so theres no need for me to reiterate that.

The only issue i had was losing signal with the drone within 5 meter orbit range, but that was really more of my phone and Orphelia. I say that because the transmitter still controlled altitude while i reconnected Orphelia and my phone's wifi connection.

All in all, as a beginner I do feel challenged, but Holy Stone gives you all necessary tools and auto pilots to have a great time.

I was not able to use much of the camera YET because I was focused on just flying, not photography. Also, i did not buy the drone for areal videos. I bought it to practice aircraft control for the US Navy's application test, the ASTB-E.

Good luck and happy flying!! I do highly recommend this drone for first timers. Just read the instructions.

title: Poor quality video & photos
text:
[[VIDEOID:d64817af6b21cc33206cf79bcd3bf4dd]] Don't buy this drone if you want decent photos and videos. Despite all the positive reviews on this drone I was disappointed with the image quality. It is an inexpensive drone, but the camera is advertised as: "The optimized full HD Camera built with Shock Absorption holder ensures shooting 2048 x 1152P high resolution images and videos without camera vibration." Unfortunately the videos show a lot of vibration and are VERY grainy (see example video).

Other issue is a very slow decent even in fast mode (less than .5 m/s).

The drone flies smoothly and is easy to operate, but I opted for the DJI Mini for about $100 more, which has almost professional level photos and videos.

So, if you like taking quality videos, spend the extra money.  Like I said in my headline, this drone is good for beginners.

title: Not worth the money. Invest a bit more for better quality.
text:
I didn't use this for quite some time after purchasing, which is why this is delayed. This drone is garbage. It might be OK for a toy for a teenager or a beginner who doesn't care about quality, but the fact is, it's garbage.

The propellers are visible in the field of view. Why would one think that's acceptable?

It was nearly impossible for the drone to stay connected via the onboard wifi. It made for a potentially dangerous situation when it stopped transmitting and wouldn't reconnect.

A good drone for filmmaking (As I learned today) would cost around $1000. If you intend to use a drone for films, pay more and get better quality. This thig isn't worth it and is essentially useless for my purposes.

title: Great for a beginner !

title: Great drone
text: Great drone. Very easy to operate Great camera. Excellent customer support.

title: A refined flying experience!
text:
I bought my HS720 (2K version) directly from Holy Stone but I thought I'd write a review here because I am so excited about this drone!

I own an HS110G and a HS120D. These have been good drones and have been fun to fly. They are on the cheaper side and, though sturdy, are a bit "plasticy". When I found an amazing deal on the old 720, I decided to make the jump to see what it was all about.

Holding this drone in your hand it feels solid. It's a bit heavy. It feels like something that's been finely crafted. The brushless motors sound quite nice as they spin up, the sound of precision. It is super steady when you bring it up off the ground. Amazing.

Flight time is great at well over 20 minutes. The remote and WiFi FPV have good range. So far I have ventured out at 70m up and 200m out with solid connection all around (using an old Samsung Galaxy S5 android phone). Low battery return to home worked great. I've been using this drone to get comfortable with flying far out where I can barely see the drone. So far it's been a great experience! I like that key telemetry parameters like height, distance, battery levels, are all displayed on the remote! You don't have to look at the tiny display of these on the FPV app.

The drone has 2 speeds and the fast speed is FAST! You need some wide open space to open it up on the high speed.

It is such a pleasant flying experience flying this drone. I compare flying this drone to driving a Cadillac as compared to my other drones which is more like driving a VW Bug. Both are really fun, but the 720 is really refined.

My only cons are:
- With the old 2K version, you have to use the old Ophellia app (Ophellia GPS) as opposed to the Ophellia GO app. The GO app is a bit more polished and will let you do things like change the units to Imperial rather than metric. The GPS app does work well.
- The gimbal to aim the camera moves WAY too fast and you can't set its position with any precision.
- Compared to the latest 720E, the video quality is a bit jumpy. There isn't any jello, but there is no stability. The video is more than good enough for FPV which is what I'm really using it for. If video quality is important to you, consider the 720E. On the positive side, working to get smooth video with the 720 you will refine your flying technique.

Beginners will want to take it a bit slow with this drone at first. As solid and sturdy as this drone is, I wouldn't want to crash it. The weight of it will probably break one of the arms. I crashed my cheaper drones numerous times and they are light so they can take the abuse. Some of the crashes I had during my first few weeks probably would have broken an arm on this drone.

title: Great drone package
text: Drone w/2K camera that pivots 90 degrees, quiet brushless motors, battery and charger, and an easy to use controller. What else could you want? Oh, maybe a well designed carrying case that stores all of the above perfectly, along with a zippered compartment to store extra batteries, instruction manuals and spare parts. Speaking of spare parts, Holy Stone includes 6 additional prop blades. Outstanding package for the price.

title: Absolutely great customer service  I am sure that is why HS is successful
text: THe drone is so much fun.  The customer service has been great.  I will continue to buy

title: On Going Review Of The HS720
text:
UPDATE 3 - I forgot to revisit this review to mention support totally handled the issue. Turns out the behavior is normal for certain runs of this unit. I'm not longer concerned and she continues to fly well!

UPDATE 2 - I received my 3rd unit. Same setup steps. I go to unlock the props and the unit revs up 3 times quickly... Very strange... The first 2 units did not do this. I decided to see if it would hover. Which is did for a few moments then it trimmed violently right in my fence. It wasnt high enough to cause any damage but I am questioning support once again what might be happening here. I might just be cursed here. Depending on the outcome, this guy, sorry to save, may be heading back to the warehouse.

UPDATE - I am now going through some frustrating times. The first couple of flights were terrific. Super stable. GPS lock clearly working. Terribly easy to fly. 3rd session, not even a few moments into the flight, the thing trims by itself into a tree. I couldnt understand it. I decided to have it replaced via Amazon (Amazon always rocks) and received the new unit today. Set it all up, calibrated precisely per instruction once again, and right out of the gate... its all over the place. There is no wind and the unit is drifting around. Altitude is fluctuating too. Something seems terribly off with this unit too. Currently trying to contact Holy Stone for some ideas. Hopefully we can figure something out because I know the capability is there...

This was my first drone purchase and after the first flight I am absolutely hooked into this world. The instructions are crystal clear. Wifi connected with ease, controller too. Before ya know it, she is in the air! I was amazed how stable the unit is. My first flight was in the cramped confines of my backyard but I felt plenty safe despite all the trees. Camera quality is about what I expected which is good but not great like my s10 or actual high end cameras.
The included case is a fantastic touch along with the extra accessories.

My only complaints are the advertised 5 hour charge times. This might not be the worst if another battery was included. Actually I don't see that extra batteries are in stock which is a bummer.

At any rate. Absolutley thrilled! Looking forward to tomorrow's flight!

text:

So I bought this one at Amazon and it has lived up to all my expectations for this product.
First off it easy to fly in no time at all. I have taken up to 400 ft, in my backyard, in at least a 10 mph wind and brought straight down and it will land in a radius of about 3 ft of where it took off. The GPS works great in holding the drone in place.
I haven't tried all the great features on my drone yet, but judging from the YouTube videos that I have watched I am sur I will be extremely happy with them.
So highly recommend this drone for anybody who has always wanted to buy a one, but haven't because of the price. You won't regret your purchase.

title: Dangerous Drone, malfunctions and nose dives out of control. PLEASE DON'T BUY THIS PRODUCT!!!!
text:
What can I say, this product was a big disappointment. The first few flights were fine, then for no reason at all, drone took off out of control and crashed. This happened twice and the drone was fully calibrated and had a fully charged battery. The first event resulted with the drone crashing into a large cluster of dense bush so I was able to retrieve it, change out the blades and try again. First flight was fine but the second flight was a disaster as you can see by the posted photos. After liftoff and climbing to about 60 feet, getting stable and just sitting there, the drone went uncontrollable and violently plunged into the ground at full speed. Thank god it didn't hit anyone as there were only a couple of people in the park. If it had there would be serious injury and potentially fatal.
I contacted Holy Stone and they basically said "so sorry, so sad, bye bye"

***** December 31, 2020 UPDATE *****
I have raised the rating based on the customer support I've received after this post. Holy Stone Customer Support Agent Cari negotiated with her employer on my behalf and convinced them to send me a replacement drone. The one I received is the 720E. Cari has also followed up on this with me several times. Although quite some time has passed since the original post, this is not due to the support, it's simply due to my location and the time for a shipment to arrive. I have not tested the 720E yet but I will soon and will follow-up with a review of it. I have to emphasize that the increase rating from a 1 to a 4 is based on the customer support I've received, NOT the HS470-4K and it's performance. I stand firm on my initial review of that product.

title: Not for first time drone buyers
text:
I am new to drones only having flown cheap remote controlled toys w my kids. My experience level is novice. Please consider my comments as an on experienced person
If this is your first drone you may want to reconsider. I would say this would be for amid level experience person to operate not a beginner or first time person. Certainly not a child‚Äôs toy.
The drone itself is well built, quiet, and will do what you want once you figure it out. Light wind is no issue just wind gust can be a problem but can be for any type drone or craft of this nature.
The part we struggled with greatly was getting it to fly. There is a start up procedure that requires you to go through a start up process to calibrate. Took us 8 times before we could get it to function and then it was unexpected when we set it down in my living room. Not sure who loves quicker my wife or the dogs.
After several frustrating days and several people we figured out Hover Mode and was able to get some really good video and pics
I put it away then when I took it out for a project I could not get it to fly again. I assume you must calibrate each time which is really frustrating.
I have attempted to use it on 3 projects and twice I could not get it to even come on.
With that said I don‚Äôt think it is a drone issue.
You must download an app and sinc it with the drone and controller. Very difficult to do.
If you have a large phone the holder on the controller will not accommodate it. This itself makes proper operation very difficult.
Getting it to fly in manual control has not been something we have figured out.
But... when we have lucked up and got everything to work it‚Äôs not too bad and takes great pics.
Again I am new I am sure it‚Äôs my lack of experience but we shall see as I have asked someone who flew military scout drones to give me a hand.

text: It's easy enough to fly. Very good battery life. It's a smaller size so if it's windy it's going to be noticeable. I just want to say that take your time before lifting off. Make sure you calibrate it and wait to see that the satellites show up on your phone screen. title: A Fantastic Business Tool
text:
I spent a great deal of time researching drones with integrated cameras for my wife who is a businesswoman and not a hobbyist. Aerial photographs are useful in her marketing work, but because she didn't want to invest a lot of time in learning to operate a drone or invest a great deal of money, she's been contracting that work out to others. Unfortunately, the results are not always what she's looking for.

After reading the reviews of the Holy Stone HS720, I felt it was inexpensive enough to take a gamble. I'm really glad I did. My wife was reluctant to fly it because her only experience with drones was with the simple toy units. The first step was to read the instructions and cautions carefully, which were few and easy to understand. Next we watched a couple of 15 minute videos. We were both surprised that she was able to operate the drone as easily as the videos portrayed. By the time she exhausted the battery (over 20 minutes), she seemed like a pro to me and after looking at the pictures she produced, she felt like it too.

The only thing missing was a couple of extra batteries. One of the main reasons I chose the HS720 was the comparatively long life of the battery versus other units in this price range. I believe they advertised 26 minutes of flying time and I know we got very close to that. That's probably enough when you have your project planned out and have more experience under your belt, but while you're learning both flying and taking pictures, it would be nice to have an extra battery or two. When I ordered the unit, extra batteries were not yet available, so I hope they'll be shipping soon.

While I'm sure there are a lot of fun and recreational uses for this drone, I know there are many business people that would benefit greatly from it. We'll be talking this up to friends and associates all through the Christmas season.
