title: Amazing camera drone
text:
This is absolutely the best drone I‚Äôve flown so far. From the build quality to the features such as return home/follow/etc, there likely isn‚Äôt a better drone on the market for the price.

I got about 25 minutes of flight on my first charge which is in line with what is advertised. Would have been awesome to have an extra battery included but you‚Äôre already getting a fully featured drone with 4K camera at a great price.

If you‚Äôre new to the hobby or are just looking for a great utility camera drone, this is the way to go. Almost flawless flight stability leads to being beginner friendly and perfectly capable of recording for survey or leisure.

title: Great Drone for the budget friendly Beginners
text: For the amount of money you spend, you get a great product.  I wanted to get some neat aerial photos and videos of things, including family stuff and this drone makes that possible. I was able to get the drone out of the box and in the air within 10 minutes. Easy to follow instructions. If you need any extra tips there are plenty of YouTubers with product review videos available too.  Video is 2k quality and not bad for the money being spent. Of you want crisp video you better be willing to spend more $$$ because this is as good as it gets with this budget line (and it is pretty awesome quality at 2k).  The app is easy to find and download, but will take some flight time to get accustomed with. Overall happy with this purchase.

title: Fair price on a great entry-level drone.
text: I realize there are plenty of better drones out there, but for the price, this one is fantastic.  Extremely portable, and easy to use.  There are a few features I'm excited about but have not learned to use yet, but I was able unbox it, go for a couple of successful flights while taking photos and video on the first day.  This is a great entry-level drone that seems to have some features of more advanced systems.  Your image quality will obviously be better if you purchase a drone for thousands of dollars, but if you only want a drone for fun and using in some small projects, this is a great purchase.

title: Great all around drone
text: This drone gives all the big names a run for the money. In my opinion, Holy stone is the best simply from customer service. Any issue I've had has been resolved within days. Nothing of the drones fault but me breaking parts and getting replacements. Very helpful staff. Will always buy Holy stone Drones

title: Worst product bought on Amazon
text: It had clear directions to set up. I followed them thoroughly and as I hit on button, it got out our control giving me many deep cuts and damaging my property. When reported, the vendor just said- we are sorry! Waiting for refund.

title: photo and Video quality is not the best !
text: great device, easy to use, poor photo/video quality for the price paid

title: Great Beginner Drone!
text: This drone was absolutely amazing. I originally bought the Holy Stone HS160 to try out and this product is so much better and definitely worth the investment. I really enjoyed the HS160 so I upgraded to the HS720 in about a week. It's much stronger and more responsive to steering and I was really impressed on how far it could fly, both horizontally and vertically. I really liked the two functions on the app, the Follow Me and the Return Home. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who wants to try out drones.

title: Flying high
text: A very  well constructed intuitive drone. This is my favorite drone as it was very easy to learn to control and fly. I was able to fly in Windy conditions with confidence. All the features work very well as advertised except for the follow me feature, it would follow then deactivate, it could have been because I was near some power lines. I would also like to add that the customer service for Holy Stone is second to none, they are fantastic and I will be buying my next drone from Holy Stone.

title: GPS Connection
text: Very easy to fly as long as GPS is synced up before takeoff each time.

title: WORTH EVERY PENNY!
text:
[[VIDEOID:d5e5dee74f59edb4612d6e97da576a0f]] This drone is AWESOME!!
My wife had bought me a drone years ago which I never got off of the ground. It was too light and had no balance whatsoever. Not only did I get the Holy Stone HS720 off of the ground my first try, I flew it for a good 20 minutes and took a video while doing so! I‚Äôm not going to lie, it was scary at times but so Much FUN!!! I had never flown a drone before but it was easy and exciting at the same time. I bought one extra battery and flew until I had drained all 3 batteries. Read The Directions!!! This is not something a beginner can just put on the ground and take off with, but after reading the directions twice it was an awesome day! I never crashed, used the auto landing button and learned a LOT about flying a drone my very first day. WORTH EVERY PENNY!

title: Works great
text: Works great, I am still learning so it helps that it's easy to use but they should put sensors in the wings so it knows not to hit things. Great product for the cost, I'm assuming I sold a few of these to my friends.

title: Fantastic Customer service!
text: Holy Stone customer care is fantastic! I wrote them to inquire of spare parts, had questions about the product and they are very responsive and super helpful.  They offer a great line of different drones for all types of fliers and budgets.  I am glad to have done business with them and look forward to many happy flights.

title: Holy Stone 720, drone. Love at the first look!!!
text:
[[VIDEOID:78009ae3fca915e0c4aa2aa13d35c361]] Greetings, I am a beginner drone pilot and well, I am more than happy with the Holy Stone 720 or as it is also known, HS720. It is a magnificent drone which you can fly (with the necessary precautions), without needing to be an expert. Its battery meets the 26 minutes of flight and in fact the drone meets all the specifications they offer. It's great!
Another very important fact is not expensive!
One observation very important: The video here is not the same quality of my drone. This one has low resolution in compare of the real video. The resolution of my HS720 is great. HD 1080.

title: Has no landing gear, camera gimble jerky
text:
For the price this is a great drone, the GPS holds the drone in position so you can focus on photo's.
Quality built. Quality packaging and is in a very nice case, that holds everything. You need to download an app to use most of the functions.
The camera gimble moves in jerky steps so not good for panning up and down, buy it does move from straight forward to straight down in small increment's.
The drone has no landing gear, lands on it's belly, so you need a smooth surface to take off and land, not in the grass.

title: Fun and easy to Fly.
text: First drone had electronic failure 3rd flight crashed hard. Had no control. Was replaced and have flown new drone 6x plus. Fun and easy to Fly. First time drone owner and was looking for something cheap but good quality for photos and Video. This drone is the only way to go. Would buy again . Only bad part is if crashes and need to replace arms there tough to solder in. Recommend to company that go to plug and play type change out in newer models.

title: The simplicity to learn how to fly the HS720 provides that for a beginner
text: It‚Äôs easy to manage for a beginner. Was not to crazy about the set up but I made it

title: Great drone
text: Easy to assemble and fly.  Their customer service is also amazing.  Bought this for my son and he loves it.  Highly recommend the drone and the company.

title: Boyfriend loves this
text: Christmas present and they loved it

title: WOW! Very impressive. Customer service is 6 starts if it could go that high!
text:
amazing drone. very easy to fly, especially for e beginner. i picked this up because I wanted to learn how to fly a drone, this drone was perfect. it has pretty long battery life, and for an inexpensive one it is the best I have seen.
the follow me, and tap flight features work great. i look forward to hours of enjoyment with this drone.
I highly recommend it!

UPDATE!!!
I did all the pre-flight initialization, connected to the controller, connected to the built-in wi-fi, synchronized with the app, oriented so it would find GPS (which it found 18 locations almost immediately), The lights flashed the appropriate colors according to the instructions, and the "snowflake" icon went away saying the drone was ready to fly. It was my second time out for the fourth flight (using second battery). I fly in a giant field with a fence about 20 yards behind me, I pushed the hover button, watched the drone go up, and then it took off to the left and slammed into a fence and broke 2 of the arms off. I recovered the pieces of my broken drone and went home. So now I have a broken drone and a broken heart.

Update 2: After contacting Holy Stone customer service and explaining what happened, they are sending me a replacement drone. I am very impressed with Holy Stone and their willingness to work with customers and ensure customer satisfaction. They now have a very satisfied AND loyal customer.

The customer service alone is 5 star, but for the short time I had the drone (and the replacement that is on its way, I am still very happy with my purchase!

title: New Drone user
text:
As a first-time drone purchaser, I was looking for something simple enough for an adult beginner, yet one that had enough features to enjoy and grow into. I have friends who recommended starter models from other brands, but I found that the prices were more than I was willing to spend, and even more complicated.
I chose to purchase the Holy Stone HS720 drone because it has an excellent price point, great benefits and features, and easy enough to learn and use. Although I have only had the drone for just over a week, I have found it to be what I had expected, and as the product came as advertised.
Being new to drones, I had a few clarifying questions after reading the QuickStart Guide instruction booklet. Because of this, I reached out to a Customer Service representative by phone. I found the person to be extremely helpful and patient with my basic questions.
Since that initial call, I have been able to fly my drone multiple times with confidence. It is easy to start and fly even for a beginner. The quality and features of this new model make this a great drone to use for many years to come.

title: Does all its advertised to do.
text: Tough and does stay up as long as Holy Stone says it will. very happy.

title: Hands down the best drone for the price!
text: [[VIDEOID:1ff829b1a2745b6a5738713d5acc7e46]] One of the better drones I have purchased, not only is it durable, but the customer support is fantastic. They get back to you in a timely manner and do everything in their power to make things right should anything go wrong with the drone. It‚Äôs also a very easy drone to learn with. Most fun I‚Äôve had flying in a while!

title: Awesome Drone, Loaded with Features at a Reasonable Price.
text: I never touched a drone before and took it out to the yard for the first flight after reading the Quick Start Guide and fully charging the battery. I live in a wooded, rural area with very little open space in my yard. I can‚Äôt believe how well this thing flies and how easy to control! I made a full flight over and around my property and the sharp, detailed image on my phone screen would‚Äôve made an awesome video had I remembered to press the ‚ÄúRECORD‚Äù button! It automatically returned when the battery ran low. Great drone, lots of really good features to customize flight plans and to keep you from losing it.

title: Husband loves and great customer service!
text: I bought this for my husband for his birthday. He has been wanting one forever. I did a lot of research and found this one on a sale and I‚Äôm so so glad! He loves it! The camera stopped moving and he couldn‚Äôt get it to work so we wrote to customer service and they responded so quick (and at all hours of the night!) and were kind enough to send us a replacement. Love love love!

Its stable in the wind, the follow me is great, smooth operations when flying. Video and pics are clear and super easy to use.  I have friends using this drone and their response is WOW "this is great".  The YouTube reviews help a lot, and website is also great resource to make a decision.

Love it

title: Fun for Beginners and Pros!!! Your Search for a drone stops HERE!!!
text:
I am newer to the drone world. My brother in law is the reason I ended up buying a Holy Stone 720. He broke his out one night in Oklahoma when we were there for a visit. He actually flew it over a Rodeo while they were competing it was hilarious the announcers actually made several comments about it. But mainly he uses his for farming when a sprinkler gets stuck in the field he can fly this bad boy out to the issue to see what he‚Äôs dealing with instead of trekking through 1/2 mile of 6-8 stalks of corn.

It took me only a few times of flying to get the hang of it. And the features on this bad boy are endless. Read the instructions it will help you enjoy the drone instead of getting frustrated. Buy one you won‚Äôt be disappointed!!!

title: Easy to fly, great features, camera is awesome!
text: I got this drone so that my daughter and I could have a fun hobby to do together outdoors.  This drone is worth so much more than what I paid for it.  The controls are easy, GPS is spot-on, and the quality of photos is outstanding.  Neither of us had flown a drone before and we were both comfortable with the controls within about 10-15 minutes of practice.  Get this drone, you will not be disappointed.

title: Love the Holy Stone HS720!!
text: This is our first drone, and it was so easy to get started. The instructions were very clear, and within 15 min. of unboxing, we were flying! The video quality is great, and so easy to fly. We read reviews on over a dozen different drones before we settled on the Holy Stone HS720, and I'm so glad we did. it's WELL worth the money, and we would recommend this to anyone!

title: Do Not Buy

title: The Best Tec support.üëçüèº

title: First Drone - Still Learning
text:
I received this drone as a gift. Am hoping to use it to video my outdoor activities: hiking, kayaking, ATVing. Out of the box I noticed the battery charger was damaged with bent pins and a missing guide. I brought this to the attention of Holy Stone and they promptly replaced it with a new charge in perfect condition.
I have tried to practice flying in a no-wind area (my garage). The drone does not seem to be able to hover in place. It drifts up and away, so I constantly have to adjust it's location. Not sure why this is happening and hoping it has something to do with the camera not being able to lock a position on the garage floor.
Looking forward to trying it outside when weather gets better so I can improve my flying skills and test the range.
The size is great. Buy an extra battery and props especially if you are a beginner.

title: Great Product
text: First time drone owner and it was very easy to use. It had a lot more features than what I expected and was very precise. The only thing I wish was a little clearer, would be the setup instructions. I had to look online for how to videos. Still, once I got it going it was great!

title: HS720 Has made my day. Excellent Quadcopter and the Pictures are really Great too !!!
text:
I have fallen in Love with this HS720 Quadcopter. It is amazing to say the least. I am more of a beginner even though I have been flying a different drone that did not have the GPS. What a difference that has made. I had to fight to get a picture with it. The Hs720 is such a Joy to fly and do photos with. I took it up to 134.5 ft and let go of the controls and it was like I had sit it on a shelf to take pictures. I searched and did my homework to find something that did not break my bank and I am not disappointed at all. I highly recommend this to anyone that is looking for something to get into. I recieved it in the mail a day before it was supposed to arrive. On Aug 27, 2020 and since it is my new best friend. I reccomend the app B4UFLY to help keep you out of no fly zones and it was very simple to register with the FAA due to the weight. 5 bucks and 2 mins and well I was ready to go. I am Thankful for the amount of info that is available on this Quadcopter. I did learn a lot from it an I am looking forward for the time I get to Enjoy taking Pictures and exploring places I just can not walk to.
Kelly Tillis
Cross Lanes, WV 25313

title: Be careful, have fun!
text:
[[VIDEOID:a03c1c2e13606a30a2fb8c110d815b1a]] This is a fun drone to fly and I think the only thing you have to really worry about is take offs and landings. The blades are not guarded so if you get close enough those blades can cut you so be careful!
The compact design on the body and the ability to fold the arms make it perfect for fitting into a backpack or even a handbag. Because the case and everything that goes with it is about the size of a book you can really take it anywhere.
In order for the camera to shoot in higher resolution you must have a class 10 memory card. You can still shoot and save to your phone in lower resolution, but might as well pick up a memory card to unlock it for potential.
Make sure to download the app to unlock all of the drone features otherwise you can still fly the drone but will not have access to the camera. Downloading the app lets you open up the camera features and you can see everything through your iPhone which makes flying it really cool!
Make sure you give yourself plenty of takeoff and landing space because you don‚Äôt want anybody near when doing either. The return home feature for the drone is amazing. This lets you bring the drone back to where it took off with the push of a button. The stabilizing feature for this camera feels like springs or shock absorbers. My next Drone will definitely have a gimbal on it but this is a great drone to learn on, and it‚Äôs still has some really good features.
Honestly, I‚Äôve crashed this one a couple of times because of wind gusts, so try to and fly on a calm day. As soon as you get it above your head and out and away from you and others, it‚Äôs a lot easier to navigate but definitely make sure the wind gusts dies down before you land it, be careful and have fun!

title: Outstanding drone for beginners
text: I have never flown a drone before I‚Äôm 60 years old and this thing is so easy to operate I bought this because all the  reviews and I can tell you they are true customer service was outstanding. I emailed customer service with a question regarding the batteries they got back to me within two hours amazing

title: Great Drone, great customer service
text: I am a beginner at flying drones so this may have been a little much for me - but I enjoyed it anyway. I needed a replacement part and their customer service was right on top of it and very responsive.  Lots of flying time and good pics/nice features for the price. Would buy again!

title: Very stable, very easy to fly
text: The package arrived in excellent condition, I really like the case for this. The drone seems to be very nice quality. the remote control has a nice ergonomic shape and feels good to hold. My 2 complaints is the phone holder will not hold my iphone 10xr, with the case it is just a little to big. without the case the phone just pops out with the slightest movement.  I would heavily consider fixing this issue. the 2nd is the time it take to charge the battery. 5-7 hours is super long time.  I still have a lot to learn about flying, but this was quite easy. the camera took pictures and video very well. I would overall recommend this drone for the price and the quality you receive.

title: Good for beginners
text: Easy to learn. YouTube videos are your friend. Watch videos before first flight. Good first Drone for great price

title: This thing is so awesome.  Got it for my son and he absolutely loves it
text: Easy to use. Good quality. It‚Äôs a great drone.

title: Perfect Drone for Newbies!
text: Love the platform.  I especially like the return to home feature. I bought this drone after my friend spent a lot of money on his first drone. A DJI and he dumped it in the ocean.  Everything is easy to understand, provided you read the manual in advance.

title: Fell off the sky!
text: [[VIDEOID:bce366f076507def894d7d96851cb776]] I have had this drone for around 10 months and have used it like eight times tops. Last week I took it out and it would not calibrate on the first try. After a few minutes I tried to do it again in a different location and it calibrated well and the remote showed 17 satellites connected. As soon as I launched it it took off like a wild bat and would not respond to the remote and drifted away like 50 or so yards away from me and crashed in the bay! Now I know why they only want to give a warranty for like 90 days! Not worth it for the price if it is only going to last for a few flights! Camera would be much better if they had a real 12MP camera on there.

title: Easy beginner drone with good camera
text: This drone is easy to fly and has provided new viewing points of the world. The return to home feature is very useful to in bringing the drone back to the launch location.

title: Great for the price
text: Still learning how to operate... one thing I think it should have is, when it follows me it should be able to recognize when there‚Äôs a tree or something coming it‚Äôs way it should go around it... but overall good quality and fun and easy to use.

title: This product never functioned properly.  Would take off and can't control it.

title: Nice beginners drone.
text:
So far, so good. Only had it out for a few tries, but I'm impressed. My son-in-law has a Mavic Pro, which is 3 times the price, and this is a fairly decent knock-off.
The Mavic has a much more solid feel, a higher resolution camera, and also has object avoidance sensors that the HS720 doesn't have. The HS720 does have 2 speeds, return to home, follow me, & point of interest modes. You can also plot a flight plan, and send it on its way (just remember, no obstacle avoidance sensors). I haven't used all these features yet, but the ones I did worked fine. The return to home feature will bring it within a meter to where it took off.

title: Quality drone
text:
For less than $250, I did not expect much. I was very happily surprised that I purchased a drone that is stable, and also has great picture quality.
When I am ready to purchase again, I will be looking to see what Holy Stone is offering.

title: Maiden Voyage
text:
This Drone was a present form my daughter for my 71st birthday. I found it easy to fly. It helped having my daughter reading direction, and my wife taking pictures with the cell phone. We had a great time battery life seemed last longer that the 20+ minutes. However we were just getting into it when we had to land, having a second battery will be a great.
I have also purchased a 32gb micro card to save videos. This is a quality drone and great for those new to flying.

title: Frequent issues with the connection. Avoid.
text: The price was attractive and that's why I did buy. The negative: constantly disconnects with the app. Not as stable even in smallest wing situations. Not easy to control. The holder for the phone on the controller already broke. the quality of pictures is poor. I would not buy this drone again. I don't recommend it. Avoid this product.

title: Great features and price.
text: This drone is easy to fly and comes with everything needed to get going.

title: Great drone for a first timer
text: This was my first drone purchase, so I have nothing to compare it to.  Did a bit of research, looking for something in the $300 range, and this one appeared to be fairly new on the market, within my preferred price range, and seemed to have excellent reviews.  In fact, Holy Stone drones seem to be very well liked among more experienced drone owners.  For a beginner, the instructions are somewhat vague about some of the functions, and there are so many to remember.  However, after one trip to the local Best Buy to purchase a TF Memory card, I then managed to figure out how the battery charger worked, and after a lengthy start-up procedure, was able to get this thing off the ground.  I especially like the auto take-off and land feature, and if you get confused, just take your hands off of the controls and it hovers in place while you get it together.  Like I said before, I have nothing to compare this drone to, but I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for one.  I would not recommend this as a toy for young children though.

title: Disappointing‚Ä¶
text:
I had been practicing at a local park nearby cars, houses, and buildings, and everything was fine. I went to our farm which is completely open sky, and went to take my skills to flight and literally this drone fell hard for at least 200 feet high. Thank God it wasn‚Äôt above my car, house, barn, or anything else, I was being careful and was above grass. It landed in about 3 feet of grass which certainly cushion its fall but still every single blade broke off of the drone. I had 15 satellite points, good reception on my phone of the flight, and I can‚Äôt tell you anything more than it just fell out of the sky unannounced. Everything was going great and then all the sudden I heard a weird noise which I believe was the propeller stopping, and it just free fell from such a great height. I hoped it would be salvageable as I just bought it two weeks ago, but it was total. I really hope holy stone well be receptive of this product failure as I was having a great time with the drone before this catastrophic failure. But as of right now I am a completely dissatisfied customer.

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

11/7/22 UPDATE:

I have been sent replacement drone and it would seem that the replacement is operating more controlled than the first. I am weary of flying over houses and vehicles etc, but in open spaces so far so good with replacement. Will update in a few weeks.
‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî-

NOV 22 UPDATE: after testing the 3rd replacement drone in an open field for days, I took it out to a real estate property of mine to do what I ordered it for- take pictures and video of the properties for advertising purposes. I calibrated it directly before flight. Took off, had good signal, and at about 150 feet I lost total control. Very low wind. It flew behind me in an uncontrolled manner until it lost signal. No idea where it is. Worst is I am in a residential area so I don‚Äôt know if it landed on someone‚Äôs car or house‚Ä¶

After 3 drones lost I am done with Holy Stone. I guess there‚Äôs a reason DJI is so much more expensive‚Ä¶ very let down and disappointed.

***customer service has BEEN GREAT, unfortunately they‚Äôre working for a (in my case) 3x defunct product***

title: Excellent drone/camera for the money and easy to learn.
text: I tried a less expensive drone initially but was not satisfied with the short flight time.  After further research, I purchased the Holy Stone HS720.  WOW.  Great flight time.  Easy to learn and maneuver.  After sitting down with the drone outside, and going through the sync, calibrate, and start-up procedure several times, I was up and running, taking pictures of our horses, the house and ponds, and other items.  I lost communication with the drone on the second flight (I may have exceeded the connection distance), and the drone returned as advertised.  I'm looking forward to more flight time and becoming a better pilot.

title: As good as others twice as expensive
text:
Drone flies easy, quick to learn, VG APP, Camera is good quality. Good features, love the orbit feature. I am building a new house and use the drone to capture the process. Put it in orbit mode and get a nice 360 of the build site and progress record.
Had an issue with the micro SD slot. It was positioned slightly high in the hole and the first time I put the card in it went below the correct location. I had to dig it out with tweezers. Have to be careful with that.
I had a DJI mini at work for roof inspections. This is just as good at less than half the cost. Comes with two batteries. No plug in connection for charger which is a pain, need a good quality 110V transformer charger to provide power to the charging station.

title: Easy to use
text: Wow, this thing is easy to use for a newbie, takes great still photos and great videos. Awesome drone.

title: Outstanding customer service
text: I got this drone as a gift from my brother. Learning to fly it was quick and easy after watching a video. After about 10 flights I had some sort of malfunction causing the drone to lose signal/lights over wetland. We were unable to locate the device. I contacted Holy Stone with details about what happened and they immediately got back to me. After verifying a couple of things to make sure the failure wasn‚Äôt pilot error, they decided to ship me a new one. You truly do not see this type of customer service any more!!! They stand behind their products! I will definitely recommend this drone to friends

title: Garbage
text: This thing is complete garage.  First flight it went up with a mind of its own, circled around, and crashed into the house busting  motor off.

title: Great for beginners with lots of features
text: I had tried flying drones before and they were challenging, to say the least. Getting a drone to simply hover, let alone move where you wanted and landing, were tough. This machine takes care of all of that for you. All you need to do is find a place to fly it and take great pictures.

title: Make sure to download the right app and you‚Äôre good to go!
text: After reading through the controls and user manual I felt ready to fly! Unfortunately my phone was not working with the Ophelia gps app. After searching for fixes online I called customer service who assisted me after a short 1-2 minute wait time. They advised me to use the Ophelia Go app which fixed my problems it has been smooth sailing from there! Later I noticed that Ophelia GO is the recommended app in the manual provided but I had looked up an outdated online format rather than use the one in the case. I would suggest getting a 32gb tf sd card the video quality obtained on a card is much higher quality if you are looking to shoot photos or video. I would also suggest buying an extra battery or two. The flight time is as listed but you‚Äôll want to fly this longer than 26 min.

title: Great customer support and this drone is fun!
text: I'm having fun flying this drone and everything seems to be great quality. My only complaint is that it lacks Remote ID, and come September 2023 this drone will require Remote ID to operate in the USA. After talking with customer support I found that they are working on a Remote ID and should have it ready by September. The lack of Remote ID is my only reason for giving it less than five stars, so if they follow through on their promise I'll raise my score and provide an updated review.

title: Does not hover in place, but can certainly take a beating. Perfect for Beginners
text: I bought this product based on other reviews and videos. The features seemed to be excellent for a drone at this price point. The main problem I had was with the hover in place feature. The drone supposedly has a camera lens on the under-side to assist with the hover in place ability, but even after proper gyro calibration the drone still drifted in one direction. I'm a beginner drone "pilot", so I've crashed this thing multiple times. Each time I do, I'm surprised how resilient this drone is. At one point I had left it up on my roof for a week through rain and snow, but everything still works fine.

title: Very good drone at a reasonable price
text:
[[VIDEOID:c307a9762b501588fa71ed4569050db2]] The other drone that I considered instead of this one was a Mavic Mini. The main deciding point for me was price, and the fact that I was just learning how to use a drone. That said, this HS720 is a very good drone. As you can see from the pictures, the camera is very high quality, especially for still pictures. Two of the three pictures were taken from more than 300 feet up, and the quality is very high. The HS720 has a very good battery life, a little more than 20 minutes with heavy camera use, maybe 25 is you are just flying around for fun. It is very easy to fly right away, and the remote control is very informative and easy to use. The app is very intuitive, and works well.
(Make sure you download Ophelia GO, not Ophelia GPS. the GPS will not work with this drone.) It is well-built, and has already survived two direct-hit crashes into trees, one of them at fairly high speed. (This also points out the other feature I wish it had: collision avoidance. But for the price, you won't get that anywhere.) All I had to do was dust it off, and it was ready to go again. The video, if you watch it, shows you several things about the drone. First, the positives: It has good color balance and resolution (the resolution is actually much better than what is shown here, it was downgraded drastically to email it), and the auto-takeoff and auto-landing at about the midpoint of the video work great. It also shows the only real drawback of this drone vs. the Mavic Mini: the camera has no gimbal stabilization, so the video can be very shaky at times. This was my very first flight, and I have since learned to reduce the shaking with a more gentle and gradual change of speed and direction, but some of that shakiness will always be there. This is the one clear advantage the Mini has. If a rock-steady video is not essential, this drone if a good choice.

Pros:
-Good price
-Great still pictures
-High resolution (4K) video
-Great battery life
-Good performance
-Full-featured and informative remote
-Includes a nice carrying case

Cons:
-Shaky video at times
-No collision avoidance (but to get this, you will have to spend quite a bit more money)

title: First Drone-Lot Of Research
text:
I spend a relatively absurd amount of time researching product specs, reviews & expectations prior to purchase. I'd been considering the purchase of a drone for, roughly, 2 years. I did not want to spend a fortune (DJI) or purchase a "toy."

The HS720, based on reviews, range, camera features, portability, company (Holy Stone well regarded in the drone hobbyist community) & value fit the bill.

Although I've never flown a drone before, this thing could not be easier to fly. I did watch a couple of YouTube videos prior to taking flight. I was blown away by the drone's ability to hover, without any change in direction, indefinitely. It's worth mentioning, the drone was able to accomplish this in 15 mile per hour winds. The drone's responsiveness to transmitter commands is instantaneous & precise. Anyone could fly this thing, without worry of destroying it or losing it, right out of the box. It took no more than two minutes before I felt 100% comfortable with the drone's handling. I had it at 120 meters in altitude & out 200 meters within five minutes, in a heavily wooded area (Very tall oak trees), and felt perfectly confident that the drone was coming home safely.

Although easy to fly, the drone's responsiveness & agility makes it incredibly exciting to fly!

On my second flight, I took some high altitude photo & video. If this is your first drone & you don't need "professional photography" quality image, the HS720 won't disappoint. Anyone making mention of "poor image quality" isn't using an SD card & is relying upon wifi beaming images back to their mobile device. The drone has a built in SD card slot. That's what it's for. Use it. Absolutely no reason to complain if you're not taking advantage of this built in and, frankly, necessary feature. The image quality is phenomenal. Period. Not fair to compare it to an exponentially more expensive drone or high end standalone camera. The camera is great. It will not disappoint.

The live first person view was far better than expected. Image quality, even while streaming at over 200 meters out, is wonderful. No signal issues. Crystal clear. I would have been absolutely comfortable flying, without ever looking at the drone itself (Line of sight), while relying entirely on my phone's first person view.

I LOVE the portability. The case everything comes in is GREAT. Most reviews don't mention this. I could not believe how compact it is. EVERYTHING fits in the hard case perfectly & the case takes up, maybe, 1/4 the space of an average sized backpack. Couldn't be easier to take the HS720 with you anywhere.

If this is your first drone, look no further. The HS720 will blow you away. It is an absolute thrill to fly & will leave you craving more after every flight. I cannot wait to get behind the controls of this thing every. Single. Day. Couldn't be happier.

title: Great flying drone
text:
[[VIDEOID:29eb4f408ca957f5f276585c016c27c2]] This is one sharp looking drone. Well presented and feels substantial. Comes with nice case. I got a flight time of over 24 minutes which is great. GPS and optical sensors make this drone a very stable flyer that holds its position well. All of the extra functions, like follow me, preset path flight, orbit, return home work well. It is a very quick and responsive flier. Especially in 2nd speed it really moves! Video is crisp and clear and photo are very sharp. The ability to adjust camera up or down from remote is nice. The video is reasonably smooth for a non-stabilized camera. That is my biggest issue with this drone is that the only stabilization is the "shock absorption" dampering system built in. There is no gimbal or EIS. The battery setup is also a bit of a pain but still ok.
Overall, this is a very great flying drone and a pretty decent photo drone. Video is clear but not as smooth as I'd like, but maybe I'm being too picky.

title: User friendly, responsive, and a great camera.
text: As a first time recreational drone user I initially bought the HS160 Pro 1080 Foldable quad. After learning to fly it, I upgraded to the HS720 4K Foldable quadcopter. The transition was pretty seamless due to the similarity in controls. I took the HS720 to the beach to get some good aerial video and photos, but was a little apprehensive due to the weather. The wind finally died down, the rain cleared, and after practicing indoors a little more on the HS160, I launched the HS720. What a great experience! It was surprisingly quick and responsive. After a little experimentation I began flying it over the beach to take video. I returned home the next day and flew it over the nearby golf course, taking more video and still photos. So far, I‚Äôve used the auto homing and orbiting features, but haven‚Äôt yet tried the follow-me or map routing options. I‚Äôm really enjoying the HS720 4K Foldable. So far I‚Äôve only had one scare. Although it was still in sight, video connection to the drone disconnected and I couldn‚Äôt see where it was going on the display. After a few minutes I maneuvered it back within range and was able to use the auto home feature to bring it back to me. I‚Äôm looking forward to flying this UAS a lot more, and to take more videos and photos. I inserted a mini 32GB SD card and had no problems downloading the images directly to my computer.

title: Fantastic Drone Great Value
text:
This drone is extremely well made and well documented. The company supports this product extremely well. I completely recommend this product! It has features that make flight and landings very easy to manage, and the camera images are fabulous. Here are a few additional thoughts:

* Charge the batteries overnight before anything else. Remove the foam collar from the batteries prior to use in the drone (they won't fit otherwise).
* Carefully pair the drone to the controller.
* You may want to fly the drone first, prior to setting up the APP. This will give you a feel for its flying features. Don't overdue your first flights.
* Load the APP on your cell phone -- and be SURE to use the CR code that is printed in the Quick Start guide. I used the wrong CR code at first (from the internet user manual) and got the wrong APP.
* Carefully set up the connection between your cell phone and the drone. This involves establishing a WiFi connection from the drone to your cell phone -- and be patient as the two devices find each other.
* Go through the "beginner stuff" that is displayed by the APP.
* Carefully test the drone in a safe location using the controller while looking at the APP (see the next step below before proceeding), getting used to the up/down, rotate, left/right, back/forward, fast/slow and takeoff/landing features monitored via the video. The features are great, but use them a lot early on before doing any substantial wandering with the drone.
* Change the default settings in the parameters when using the APP. The default settings keep the drone very close nearby, and until you figure this out you may think the drone is not working right.
* If you are going to explore a larger location, I recommend if possible standing in the middle of the location to be explored. Managing a drone 300 feet away is difficult, not because of the drone but because your depth perception does not work well at that distance. Managing a drone solely by the video feed can be done, but much practice is needed before proficiency is achieved.
* Enjoy! This is a well-made product, sturdy and durable, well-designed, and lots of fun!

text:

Fortunately those times it hit tress/bushes and only needed a few propeller replacements. Does HOLY STONE have a recycle credit LOL.... I want to buy it again but not for $300.00 and risk it "exploding" on me again.

Great bang for your buck. I have had a few issues connecting but after some resilience I was able to make it happen. This drone takes great photos/videos especially for the price. Durable, I flew it into a few trees OOOPS lol, no issue after. Used it on the beach and out by my house , in the country. 10 MPH winds it was very stable. I can‚Äôt say enough but it. You will not be disappointed.

text:

title: Easy to use...
text:
I bought this drone after returning one of the $99 toy drones. Best decision I ever made!
The Holy Stone HS720 4K provides great value and features while not breaking the bank. They also have a great customer service department that actually answers questions on the chat line.
On the plus side, their batteries last up to 26 minutes and you can charge batteries 2 at a time, on the negative side, it takes 5-7 hours to charge each battery. Also the phone holder could be made bigger to hold a iPhone with a Otterbox case.
Overall impression...Great drone!

title: Solid fun drone but video isn‚Äôt the best
text: I have had my drone for 7 months now and after making minor Newbie calibration mistakes, I enjoy flying it. I have crashed my drone a few times and it held up well. After watching videos an 3axle gimbal cameras, I realize that this drones major downfall is unusable video quality. I have made decent screenshots from the videos I made which works well for me. I wish Holy Stone would improve the drone wifi signal because it loses connection pretty quick. I usually hit record and hopefully get decent shots since I‚Äôm unable to watch in duration. This drone is a good starter to see if this hobby is for you but after flying it, you will definitely be looking for something better. My recommendation is if you only have 300 to invest then get it otherwise save up and buy DJI. I wish I have.

title: Great little drone.
text: Great little drone to learn on. GPS and pairing take a bit of time but the auto return makes it worth it. Have only flown it a couple of times but impressed with the battery life and the ease of use. Can‚Äôt wait to continue using it. Definitely worth the money to have the features and learn how everything works  before investing in a $1000+ drone. Camera works well for the price.

title: Great Capabilities for developing skills, not foolproof though
text: I love the capabilities and features of this drone for how affordable it is. It was my first real drone with decent video and my first GPS capable drone. It has been great for learning and experimenting but has advanced enough features to allow me to do more than just play around with it. The main drawback for me is the time it takes to charge, however the flight time is good. Replacement parts if you need them are easy enough to come back and with a little attention to detail can easily be successfully installed. I do wish the phone holder on the remote for the one I have was a little sturdier, and as you get more advanced there becomes some things to be desired from the drone. The case is excellent and makes taking what I need to fly with me really convenient and protected. I have had this since September of 2020 and continue to fly it, at times my 6 year old flys it, she is a very responsible and fast learning 6 year old but she loves it and despite severe anxiety at first I now tend not to worry if she wants to fly as long as there is not a high wind. In the cases of higher winds aloft you need to be careful because at lower levels it may be fine but as the wind encounters less ground resistance it can lessen the stability of the drone and cause it to struggle with mobility, but it is nice not to have to have perfectly calm conditions to fly, otherwise with the area I live in you would only fly 9 days a year. The things I wasn't prepared for was how susceptible it is to the wind and the fact that large metal objects that produce any kind of magnetic field can affect the calibration leading to the drone "running away".

title: Not bad...good training drone.
text: Love the features on this but sometimes the quadcopter has a mind of it's own (which I later read reviews on social media pages that this is standard for this model).  I think this is a good starter drone though the price doesn't reflect that.  I'll continue to train and get more flight time over the next few months and see if I go for another quadcopter.

title: Amateur taking flight with collision avoidance
text:
To Whom It May Concern,
This is my very first drone. I have read and watched many reviews on many different drones. The holy stone 720 4K landed high on my wish list. the flight is smooth and the camera takes beautiful photos. i haven't had a chance to record any flight's yet. Again, I'm a amateur and the only thing i wish this little well build machine had was the crash avoidance. If this awesome drone had obstacle detection and collision avoidance sensors will be more user friendly for amateur/beginners like myself. I have crashed my drone on two different occasions, without any serious physical damage such as dents. Thanks to Holy Stone for such a great drone. If you have any additional questions regarding my experiences with the Holy Stone 720 4k drone, please do not hesitate to contact me. Thanks again George Cox III

title: You get what you pay for

All the features are there but just not as good as my friends DJI, but that's why mine is $300 and his is $3000. There is no comparison to the 2 but his is 10 times more expensive. Video is OK, handling takes a bit of getting used to, damn thing wants to drift off to the right all the time, hover is not very steady, and the home button will get you 10 -15 feet from actual "home". On a full charge I can get about 14 minutes flight. Wish battery's were available.

title: HS720 vs DJI Mavic mini
text:
1st off I have to say I'm not a pro at drones or leaving reviews. I love to read reviews but don't care to ever leave one... I'm only leaving one because I wish I would have went a different way from the get.

Great drone but for the $$, the dji mini is $400 and is far superior for just 100 bucks more then the 720.
I received the 720 drone for Christmas 2019. I loved it at first but I didnt like a few things about it. After more reviews of other drones I ordered a Mavic mini.
Partial comparison of the 2:
The 720s camera does not correct itself when you fly forward or stop which means when you focus on something moving when your drone is stationary and then press forward, you camera dips down along with the angle of your drone. The dji mavic mini's cam corrects itself for smooth video that doesn't lose the subject. The 720 loses signal to the phone by just going 100yards or so while the dji mini took me almost 2 miles away in town without losing signal to my phone. The 720 camera control is not smooth. It has one speed to adjust up or down. The mavic mini can smoothly adjust up or down at the speed you want. The 720 has follow mode while the mavic min does not. The HS720 has 1080p vid while the mavic mini is 720. The 720 battery takes 7hours to charge with an awesome 26min fly time. The mavic mini battery takes around 2hours to fully charge with a 20min fly time (sport mode).

The HS720 is a $300 drone that feels like a value of around $250-$300.
The mavic min is a $400 drone that feels like your getting a value of $600-$700.
I'm just a Christmas newb so if my review helps you then good, if not then leave it. I've been flying every day and been loving it.

title: The good and bad
text: Just got this about 2 weeks ago. Fun, decent drone as my first. However, it is super sensitive to the controls so I accidentally hit a wall and broke one of the arms. I've not been able to find the replacement arm as their customer support says they supply them through Amazon but Amazon says there's non in stock even though there is... I purchased 2 extra batteries and now don't have a working drone which is upsetting. The video is not stable so not sure if this can be fixed with software after the fact. Moral of the story is decent drone but be aware that it's not the most stable machine and is easy to crash. Don't look for a quick replacement on parts either if you do break it (btw you'll have to work with several tiny wires if you break an arm)

title: Looking to get into flying with a GPS enabled drone?  The HS720 is the one!
text: Normally when someone says something is for beginners I tend to avoid those products as I like the more advanced feature sets.  The HS720 didn't disappoint me - it has all the features of a lot of the drones that cost $1000s of dollars but they've made it available at a really great price.  It was easy to setup and do the initial flight as well with the remote.  The App for the phone can probably be made to be a bit more intuitive but after playing around with it for a bit I was able to figure it out.

title: Kamikaze Drone
text: This drone is great for the price and has some awesome features. The flight control is good and the camera works better than expected. There is a major flaw in the "return home feature" which brings the drone back to the last place it took off from. You can toggle this feature if you choose to BUT the feature will turn on automatically if the battery gets too low. Once the feature turns on due to low battery the drone goes on autopilot and THERE IS NO WAY TO TURN IT OFF. Multiple times the drone has kamikazed straight into a  tree and sometimes the drone does not land from where it took off and it tries to go land in a different part of town. The drone is fun and valuable but may not be worth the frequent risk of heart attack you may experience when watching a $300 toy go full throtle Into a tree 60 ft in the air.

title: Great drone for a great price!
text: The drone is amazing for beginner fliers and even young adults. The camera quality is more than good for any use. The battery also pretty much lasts as advertised, minus maybe 3 minutes. title: Love this Little Drone
text:
This was the second drone I ordered by Holy Stone through Amazon. The first, model 700E, proved to be too bulky and not as portable as this model. It also came with an inoperable camera, which is the reason I returned it for this one instead, model 700, and I'm glad I did. Everything between the 2 models is exactly the same except for 3 aspects; 1) model 700 is foldable, while 700E is not. 2) model 700E has a 2 gimbal axis camera to assist in image stabilization while the 700 model does not. But, I find the sharpness and clarity of the images I've received from the model 700 to be excellent. The only noticeable blur occurs when you make a sudden stop or start while in flight, and that blurring is only slight and lasts a split second. 3). the batteries charge using a dedicated Holy Stone charger on the 700 model, while the 700E only requires a mini USB.
So, overall, for a significantly lower price point, I am very happy with the model 700. It is fun, accurate and truly worth its price. Super easy learning how to operate, too. Plus, I had the opportunity to call Holy Stone's customer service which I must say is an outlier in a good way. Not only did customer service try to help me with the problem I was having with the model 700E's camera, they called me back on 2 occasions after I switched out the 2 drones to see if everything was alright with the new drone. What customer service does that these days?

title: Somewhat troublesome!
text:
Initial battery charge and calibration done successfully. Control & Drone were in sync for first short trial with controls & camera. Trial run was short due to issues with range.
Contacted support and they indicated product needs to constantly be calibrated after each use. Apparently settings are defaulted to beginner mode, ranges are limited to about 30 & 50 ft.
When I switched from Beginner settings and adjusted the range, flew the drone without additional calibration, it rose rapidly to higher ranges but was uncontrollable with controls and flew around in circles until battery low signal brought it back to near starting site. Planning on returning product for a better option if possible.

text: Bought this as a beginner drone as I had not flown one before. Setup was somewhat tricky initially as I wasn‚Äôt able to calibrate but once I got it to work, the flying part was easy. The return to home button works like a charm and the drone itself is quite sturdy and flies pretty good in windy conditions. It comes in a sturdy case. Dislikes are I had to calibrate it every time I turned it on, slightly bigger than I expected, camera resolution wasn‚Äôt that great and also I had to manually adjust the camera angles.

title: Great drone one of the best
text:
HS720 amazing drone have owned many and this is by far one of the best easy to fly and love the return home and gps feature
Camera is amazing and the ability to move from the remote is great

title: Best starter drone in the market.
text:
This is the best drone you can get for under $300. I am a first time drone buyer and I was looking into DJI products, but I realized that there is no need to buy an expensive $1k drone as a first timer, it'd be like buying a Ducati motorcycle when you're just learning to ride.

What I like the most is the drone's battery which is really good as it last around 20 minutes, plus you get two so you can easily swap in a minute and continue flying. The video quality is decent and respectable for the price range. As for the range itself, I haven't tested the limits since I like to keep it within sight. The only thing that I sort of don't like is that set up involves spinning it on its axis to calibrate the compass, so it's not a matter of just turn the button on and off you go.

title: Great bang for buck
text:
So let's start with an accurate review. Please read all. Start with cons then pros.
Dissatisfaction on the fact that your remote will reach a great distance however when using the Ophelia App for the drone you are limited to certain height and distance restrictions. The drone is also only wifi connected on the phone so the FPV lags and or cuts out after you fly so far away. Also noticed the picture or video on phone lags when near other buildings or sometimes when I was flying over the pool or ocean. I believe this to be due to the electromagnetic fields from the ocean at a low altitude and the pool as it has lighting.

Now on to the PROS. Well there's alot.though the photo age in the videos did lag at times I hot amazing photos and videos once high enough or far enough from any electromagnetic fields. Though the phone app goes by wifi the remote signal is quite strong for the drone receiver and you can fly it by line of sight with no issue. For myself as not a beginner and not a pro this is the best drone for the money. 2.7k and 4k video and photos. I was just at our place in the Florida keys and added some pictures. We have 15 to 20 mph winds and to my surprise it fly against the wind. Now I will say for how compact this thing is it packs a punch. It struggled at 20mph and wouldn't recommend as it was difficult to keep a steady video. Anything 15mph and below worked fine for taking smooth shoots and getting great footage. I have already recommended this to 3 of my friends and would do the same for you. Its hard not to have fun. Get a few extra batteries. Though they last 26-32 minutes depending on wind and distance/height, they do take awhile to charge.

title: Very easy to fly.  Battery life is great.  High video quality.
text: I am a novice when it comes to flying drones.  In the past, I have purchased several small drones and have had a lot of difficulty flying them.  I always assumed that if you purchased larger and more expensive drones, they would be more difficult to fly.  My assumption was completely wrong.  In July I purchased a Holy Stone model HS100 drone and was very pleased with the stability and easy of flying of this model.  This drone was much easier to control than any of the drones I had previously purchased.  My only issue with this model was a wifi connectivity problem and this may have been partially due to the older model cell phone I am using.  Because I had such a great experience with the HS100, I recently purchased a Holy Stone HS720.  This drone had several improvements over the HS100 including higher resolution camera, longer flight time, brushless motors, and 5GHz wifi connectivity.  The main feature that I liked about the HS720 was the travel-friendly design.  The HS720 folds into a very small size that makes it much easier to carry.  Although I have not had the HS720 for a long period of time, I am very impressed with the flying ease and stability of this drone.  Flying time on a battery charge is great too.  The higher resolution videos are also a big improvement over those of the HS100.  In addition, I have not had any wifi connectivity issues so far.  I am also very pleased with Holy Stone customer support.  They have been very responsive and helpful in helping me deal with my previous wifi connectivity problems.  In summarizing, I would highly recommend the HS720 to anyone who is interested in flying drones.  I am getting hooked.

title: From $30 toys to $800+ drones, this is the worst drone I've ever "flown"
text:
It's possible I just got a defective unit, but despite multiple calibrations and perfect flying conditions, this thing wouldn't hover within a 5ft radius for more than a few seconds before deciding to take off in one direction or another and then from there, it wouldn't respond to controls in any meaningful way. I could tell it was receiving input, but not enough to counter whatever the flight controller was trying to do. Tried with and without GPS, all the same.

I had one magical 2 minute flight after my 4th calibration that I thought had fixed the issues, but then Nope, off it went. I'm not kidding in the title, I have never had such a terrible experience with a drone and that includes little $30 stalking stuffer drones. This thing crashed more in the 30 minutes I was trying to troubleshoot than all my combined drone crashes in the past 10 years.

I will say this though, the thing held up. Minor dents in a couple propeller after dive bombing a boulder 15ft away from where it should have been hovering in addition to the half dozen trips into some bushes... I've got nothing but horrible things to say about either the sensors or flight controller but the build quality is better than I'd expect at this price point.

text:

title: Many features for a mid-range price
text:
So far I have to rate this product excellent, and a very good value. It packs a lot of nice features, such as 4K photo and video quality, return-to-home, follow me, low-battery sensing and GPS features, usually found in higher priced drones, into an affordable, mid-range price level. The instructions are clear and logical. I had a slight mishap (my own doing, it seems) on my maiden flight, and the customer service agent, Kim, was extremely helpful. He got me flying again in no time.

The battery powers a flight time of 26 minutes which is adequate, and it comes with a spare battery, which is even better. Some good thinking went into the charger as well. It automatically charges two batteries (one after the other) on one session, eliminating the need for me to interrupt whatever I'm doing (or sleeping) to switch batteries in the charger. I'm ready for almost a full hour of flying time on my next session.

Pay attention to the GPS signal if you fly on low battery or a long distance from the control module. Don't count on the drone to return to home with a weak GPS signal. That's about the only thing to be extra careful about. Otherwise, it practically flies itself.

title: Poor hovering, cheap remote, need to register with FAA
text:
3-2-22 update: Holy Stone reached out to me and asked if they could offer a replacement for me to test and update my review. Very nice gesture, except they sent me a drone that had been destroyed and returned. 3 of the prop legs were completely broken, and it there was dried mud on the drone. It looks like it was run over by a lawn mower. See the photos. Epic fail HS.

This drone is much heavier than I expected for its size and didn't realize it required FAA registration for this reason. I immediately noticed upon takeoff that it had difficulty hovering in place, as it swayed back and forth and was difficult to stabilize. Once flying it was not very responsive and there was a noticeable delay between the transmitter and the drone. I returned this drone and went with a DJI Mavic Mini for about $100 more on Prime Day. I do not regret my decision. Also, Holy Stone contacts anyone who rates their product less than 4 stars with an attempt to make it right, which is great, but they also try to get you to change your score no matter what. So the average reviews you read are inflated. Take notice of this when making your decision.

title: impressed for the $, good first drone for me
text:
Had this drone for two days. Very easy to get setup and use. Had some trouble with vertical part of calibration, even after reading manual and watching a couple of online videos. Called support on a Sunday, waited about 3 mins, answered my question immediately and was able to finalize the calibration.

Very easy to fly. Pictures and video very good, and good enough for my needs. Agree with comme to on battery. Long time to charge. I ordered another battery.

I have not tried all of the features yet, as I need to take this to a large, open area to test vs. Around my neighborhood. My main reason to buy this was to inspect my new Solar installation on my roof from time to time vs going up on a ladder.

I have not owned a drone before and was impressed at how easy it was to fly.

title: Great until it disappeared. -- Updated, Great Seller
text:
Went flying with it out in the park last night, which started out great. The 1 button lift off worked as expected, the drone itself handles very well and pretty much hovered in place completely even with some light breeze. Follow me mode worked pretty well, a bit sluggish but it did follow me as I circled the park. and the POI also works as advertised. As I got more confident with it I flew a bit higher and further away from me to test out the return home function. which didn't do it's job at all, pushing the button saw the drone flying up which I thought was normal since videos I saw on youtube mentioned it suppose to get to a certain height before coming back. Unfortunately it didn't really come back down to where I initially homed it. as it reached the designated height, it shot to the right into the treelines. I frantically tried get control of it to bring it back but was not able to. the last I saw of it was it going into the trees. I tried to recover it last night and this morning, but was unable to... I suspect it got stuck on one of the tree somewhere ... such a disappointment... what ever you do, do not use the recall button ... they should label it as fly away button.

Update - To my surprise, the seller after learning my situation, sent me an replacement. Cant beat this kind of customer service.
