title: Holy stone stands behind its product! Great Drone
text:
Easy drone to learn and train on.

Pros

GPS tech allows the drone to stay stationary even in high winds.
Something often over looked is a high quality instruction manual in color and with easy to understand pictures.
The gimble is quick and responsive.
The battery life is exceptional for the class of drone.
The drone comes with a nice carrying case and charger that can charge two batteries simultaneously.
The color saturation of the camera is very impressive.
The best part is world class customer service. I ran my drone into a tree in Colorado and broke two of the swing arms off. Holy stone responded immediately to my emails and promptly sent replacements.
I can say with experience the drone is very easy to disassemble and repair if that ever happens to you.
The drone is very quite and is very smooth in its movements.
I like that it is will lit and has a light that can be turned on and off by the operator. Very handy for night flights

Cons
The range of the camera using a phones WiFi is much more limited Than the remote. A big improvement would be for the camera to communicate through the remote and the phone directly attaches to the remote. Max distance for the phone unobstructed is about 600 feet. (iPhone 11 pro) That was tested in a suburban area near hundreds of WiFi sources. Still that is a range that significantly effects the use of the drone.

The other issue is the stabilization of the camera gimble. It doesn‚Äôt track a target and doesn‚Äôt stabilize the camera when the drone is moving which makes for choppy videos. While the drone is changing its motion and losing your subject while flying

I really wish you didn‚Äôt have to recalibrate the compass and GPS every time you changed a battery.

I own about 25 drones. I have experience with many GPS drones including the DJI line up. If you are on budget and really enjoy photography this drone is for you. The details, quality of materials, and customer service will make owning this drone very enjoyable.

title: GPS return home
text:
I did fallow all the instructions
everything looked good, It went up and held its altitude. Used the follow me feature and it followed me down the road but once I selected orbit it took off down the road, I had no control of it. I selected home feature and it didn‚Äôt respond. It crashed on a neighbors house, had to climb their roof to get it. Broke both back arms. Tried getting replacement part but their out of stock.

Updating my review.
After talking with customer server with a fast response on replacement I‚Äôm back to flying my drone. Learned calibrating the drone before take off really helps controlling the drone. It fly's perfect with out any issues.
Thank you Holy Stone and your customer service to getting back in the air!!

title: Arrived on time and works as advertised.
text:
Being not very tech savvy I was looking for a drone that I could operate and learn quickly that wouldn't break my bank. After doing my research on decided on the Holy Stone HS720. I am pleasantly surprised and thrilled that I made the right choice. (not a given in my case). The product arrived and worked perfectly.

I gave the battery a full charge upon arrival and found that it easily flew for 25 minutes in varied modes while I
learned how to fly. I am seriously considering to buy another so that I have one to share!

Thanks for delivery a great product!

title: Needs improvement
text: This drone fly and control nicely, but the camera doesn't work well on the two I  Purchased and this is a problem.

title: Awesome drone for beginners!!
text: [[VIDEOID:ebb681e77414a4e479c11abbc4f5466]] Wifee and I love this drone.. . Super easy to use.. . Took it on our anniversary to Cancun.. ..  Wonderful!! ! .. .  Would have been much better if I had an extra battery.. .

title: This drone deserve 10 Stars
text: [[VIDEOID:3d54cf9b3ab835dea73c2bb1f92ea32f]] Honestly, I was a little sceptical about HolyStone drones, but when I see the one my neighbor had, it totally changed my mind. So, I decided to purchased this drone as a gift to myself. Wow, what can I say, the drone is SPECTACULAR, SUPERB, FORMIDABLE. I love this drone. It arrived 2 days early, had all the parts, and most importantly, it performed to standards. First flight was so easy. You have to follow the instructions before attempting to fly that drone. My max height was 320 feet, and I flew it about 150 feet distance out from my original point. It performed really well. This drone deserve 10 STARS...a must have!

title: Customer service is fantastic and the drones are very stable in flight
text:
Up to the time my boys and I have only flown toy-grade drones. I decided to order two HS720 drones for my boys for Christmas. We had to wait a few days to fly because because in Washington we get a lot of rain and fog during the winter.

My first boy fired up his drone, performed the GPS calibration, add hit the button to level up to about 5 feet of the ground. He then proceeded to fly the drone over the backyard, above the house and over the greenspace behind our house. My son hit the return to home button and the drone rose up in the air about 50 feet, flew back over our heads and proceeded to land about three feet away from where it took off. I also took the drone for a quick spin and everything flew perfectly. We were super impressed with how great the drone flew.

After that it was my other son's turn. Again he calibrated the GPS and hit the hover button. The drone hovered about five feet in the air and he took the drone for it's maiden flight. After flying the drone over the green space my son hit the return to home button and the drone started flying around in circles and flew into the side of a hill on the other side of our house.

My son was crushed but Holy Stone customer service was fantastic. I was afraid that they would say that their warranty does not cover crashes but they were very polite, asked a lot of questions, and then informed us that they would send us a new drone and we could keep the old one for parts.

We were of course super excited and can't wait to get the new drone. We are also thinking about dabbling in FPV, so if anyone knows of goggles that work well with the HS720, please let us know.

One thing to note. With the exception of the return to home issue with the second drone, both drones flew extremely well and were very stable in the air. When you let go of the controls they simply hover and let you think about what you want to do next in terms of flight control. This is perfect for beginners. I would recommend this drone to any beginner because they are easy to fly and because the Holy Stone customer service is fantastic and stands behind their product. I expect many other companies might try to hide and say it was the customer's fault, but Holy Stone is a stand-up company that you can rely on.

title: Great First GPS Drone
text:
Wow, way better than I expected! Holy Stone is a great company with high quality products.
This is my first jump into a Big Boy toy, I have flown small drones for 5 years and was ready to step it up.
I did a lot of research and decided on the HS720. I was not disappointed.
Very stable drone, easy to fly and looks awesome! It handles wind well and the GPS is very accurate.
I can't believe I waited this long to upgrade.
It comes with its own case that is very nice and will protect in storage and transport.
I love the "Follow Me" function and the "Return to home", this is great for new flyers and provides some security if you get disoriented during flight.
Overall, this is a great drone, I would highly recommend it for someone looking to step up their flying to the next level.
The price is very good for what you get (quality and features).

title: Instructions not easy to follow
text: Have not been able to link program to drone. Could not get it to calibrate.  Still working on it.  Hopefully I will get it to fly

title: Easy to set up and fly
text:
This drone is one of the easiest I had to set up and get flying. Was able to set up in less than 10 minutes. Had if flying right away as one of the batteries that came with it was already charged. After testing it out, it appears to be a great drone.
In my opinion it's very affordable and does pretty much the same as the more expensive drones. If you're just looking for something as a hobby, this is a great start.

title: Very well made drone, customer service is awesome!
text:
I have owned several Drones in the less than $500 range and this is the best, hands down. It feels solid, the controller is user friendly and if you have questions, their customer service is "Johnny-on-the-spot".
Beginner or not, this is fun and you'll love it!

title: Very nice drone.
text: This is an amazing drone for the price. It's packed with very cool features but it's not a grab it and go. You really need to read the instructions manual closely. Not for a beginner. Please read the entire book before getting started.

title: Great customer service
text: Amazing customer service fantastic product. I would recommend this to anybody looking for a foldable portable drone

title: I continue to be impressed...
text:
After a friend introduced me to a professional drone several years ago while capturing video of my vineyard, I thought I would need to spend over 1k for something that would come close to the quality of video that he was able to produce. After about three months of research and watching a variety of YouTube videos on drones, and seeing the "loss leader" drones advertised on Facebook, I was fascinated by what potentially could be purchased for a reasonable price. I also realized that I wouldn't be happy if I spent under $100 - so what to do... I took a chance and bought this drone for under $300... WOW - still impressed and I'm glad I did!

After buying this drone last year, I've have not had a lot of hours of flight time yet, but WOW, my expectations for the quality of this drone for the price has FAR exceeded my expectations. This review is from someone who has never owned a drone before and never flown one either... I have flown RC aircraft and I do consider myself a hobbyist with other products - so take this review for what it's worth... also, I logged on today to buy a couple of extra batteries and some propeller props - for the time when I need to replace...

Ease of first use - The software for my android phone installed without any problem and the instructions were very clear on how to initialize the drone and get it into the air. Total thumbs up!

Quality of product - The quality of construction, compact size, case, packaging etc. exceeded my expectations and reflects a high quality product. For the price, you would be surprised... and from all appearances, it seems less flimsy than other models out there for sale.

Quality of video - WOW - the camera works great, the high definition and quality of the video is professional quality including the built in gimble that offers stability during flight.

Quality of motors - WOW - I'm amazed at how quiet this is in flight. The brushless motors are extremely quiet and efficient.

Battery time in flight - WOW - I've been up for more than 20 minutes and it still wants to keep on flying. I have yet to exceed my range from the ground and the responsiveness in a light breeze is still amazingly good.

At the end of the day, if you're looking for a good intro drone that delivers on all of the expert features for an intro price, you WON'T be disappointed with this product!

One final update - sadly I just crashed it into a hard object - WALL of my house. Yea - not happy with myself, but it was definitely pilot error and I've already ordered a replacement arm. LOL

title: Broke on third flight
text: For context... please note that I have over a dozen drones and have been flying these things for over a decade. I've had great luck with a wide range of brands. There are some good things to say about this product. It flies smoothly and hovers in a small space (when working properly). As for the cons, it constantly resets and required us to recalibrate even during a single use. It loses range on the app for me on a brand new iPhone 11 after reaching about 20 feet. But what really took the cake is that on the third flight while hovering (with no wind gusts or controller adjustments) it shifted about two feet to the right in mid air into an absolutely tiny limb (less than the circumference of a pencil). I "killed the engine" and it fell about 8 feet to the ground where the arm snapped in half. This was a $300 gift from my dad 2 days ago. He died last night unexpectedly and well now I am just going to have to tell my kid sorry... sorry. We are out of luck. I have no way to contract Amazon as he ordered from his account account and they won't talk to me. As a loyal Amazon customer, I am very disappointed in Amazon as much as I am this product. Lesson learned.

title: Total Fail
text:
First drone was replaced by Amazon due to my complete inability to control it.
Second drone has the same story. It doesn‚Äôt stay in one position and tends to have a mind if it‚Äôs own.
The time I‚Äôve spent trying to get this drone to perform has cost me more than it‚Äôs worth.

title: Excelent toy
text:
Excelent product, I got a lot of funny hours, I like the drone, was easy to use, I saw many videos in internet and I learn how use it, was better for me.

Buy it, nice product

title: Love it
text: Love it

title: Fun
text: Easy to fly fun drone

title: Camera adjustment
text: Como es que se le ajusta el lente ?? Porq e tratado con las ruedas arriba del control y nada. Como se hace ????

title: Great drone! Especially for the price!
text: Fantastic for the price!! I previously owned one of the original Parrot drones. It was fun, but limited flight time and only a basic camera. This drone is very easy to fly, great flight time and great features. I have gotten about 25 minutes flight time and the pictures/video are great. One of the best features is the return to home button. One press and the drone returns from where it was launched. (Within a foot so far) It is stable in a moderate breeze. The attached pictures were taken when I launched it, let it climb to approximately 200 ft straight up. It held it's position in a 2mph breeze directly above me. I took both pictures and video, then hit the return to home. Simple and safe. I highly recommend this drone if you want more than just a toy without breaking the bank.

title: Great for beginners and novices.
text: This was a 2nd drone for my son who learned on a very expensive typhoon 4k. Much faster and more responive. Less video stability and quality.

title: Camera works great
text: Easy to fly for beginners

title: Happy with purchase, but camera rotation could be better
text: The drone works as expected and is fun to fly. This was our first drone so I do not have any other drones to compare with but we are definitely happy with our purchase. I have not tried using some advanced techniques yet such as having the drone over around me while hiking. The only aspect I would like improved is the camera rotation. The movement is jerky meaning the camera does not transition smoothly from one angle to another. That said, I am still happy with my purchase and believe this is one of the best drones under $300.

title: Cool drone, but customer service is great.
text: We purchased this drone to be used as a to for our business.  In learning how to use it, a first time drone driver, it came easy.  However, I ignored weather conditions and lost control as it flew into a tree.  To make things worse I shut down the engines not knowing it had an auto recovery on the giro.  Oops.  It tumbled to the ground resulting in a broken arm.  I contacted the vendor and told them what happened.  I was certain I would have to purchase a whole other unit.  Nope.  They sent me a knew one after making sure I could make the repair myself.  All fixed and being used.  This is a great little drone and if I can give the vendor my business down the road I will.  Hopefully for a bigger unit and not a replacement. :-)  Thank you again for taking good care of us!

title: Great purchase. Highly recommend
text: Controls were easy to learn. App was very helpful for starting out.

title: Good drone
text: Great drone! Just dont operate in in your house. Its like a flying weed eater.

title: First drone
text: This is our first drone and it has been a pleasure to own. It is simple to learn to fly and takes great photos. It has some nice features like the take off and landing button and the follow me option. Customer service has been great as well! They respond quickly and have answered any questions I have had.

title: Well built and great camera stability
text: [[VIDEOID:a11adee6e1394ebb000d09714b8325ad]] It‚Äôs a great drone. Very well built. It is definitely not drifting like the original one. And the company was so great when I spoke to them about the issues I had. They had no problems helping me out. And overall this was a good choice. This drone is great to fly with an awesome camera and the stability in the camera, and the customer service is great. Keep up the good work guys!!

title: Great toy, but not recommended for photo or video taking
text: Bought this toy so I can take aerial pictures and videos for my real estate listing. It was very easy to learn. However, the quality of the pictures and videos are not that great. My iphone 13 pro is 10x better. So if you want just a toy to fly, go for it, but if you are looking for high quality, high resolution, good color pics or videos, I would think twice.

title: Easy to fly in minutes for the beginner with some video game skills even if it was a long time ago.
text: This is my first drone.  I'm 49 years old and haven't played video games for probably 20 years.  I work in the tech industry, so apps and technology is not scary to me, but I'm definitely not the 16 old boy that could pick this up and fly it flawlessly the first time.  In fact, my first flight ended in a crash....not the drone's fault.  My fault and panic for sure.  It's like riding a motorcycle.  Don't focus on what you don't want to hit.  Well, my panic ensued as the drone headed for a fence line and instead of remaining calm and using the easy remote, I panicked and the drone went into the wire fence.  Amazingly, it came away unscathed except for a few nicks in the propellers.  Since then, I've flown it about 5 times, each time getting better and better.  Pros - very well made and easy to use immediately.  Set up takes just minutes and the novice can be off and flying without too much effort.  Cons - can't figure out yet how to get the propeller out of the video or pictures.  Can't find spare battery or propellers online to purchase as a backup.  Would like to see more info on the app features.

title: 1 hood time
text: First time I flew it it went great. Landed it once in a yard. Went to use auto take off, it went side was 30 ft into the air and dive bombed a car almost hit and then bounced and almost hit another car. I replaced blades and tried again and it would never fly straight again.

title: Might be more trouble than it's worth.
text:
I tried my best with this. I bought one and had a lot of control issues, station keeping was fine but when I wanted to move it around it was a wild ride. It almost always ended in a crash or at best a forced landing. One of the rotor arms ended up breaking off. I'll wrote that off as learning.

So I bought another one, I have not gotten a single controlled flight out of it. Most of the time it'll go to take off level and just spiral down out of control and hit the ground. It won't even take off to station keep for more than a few seconds before it becomes out of control. I've stopped using it because it'll just break.

The hand controller is not great. It is what it is I guess. But the phone holder function is terrible. It's not really usable so I end up having t choose between the app and the hand controller. Makes doing videos nearly impossible unless you just turn the video on before take off.

The App seems fine when you can use it between dealing with a barely in control drone and the hand controller.

Disappointing purchase.

title: Awesome!
text: I recieved a Holy Stone HS720 for Christmas. I immediately saw this was a quality, well built drone. It came in a strong compact case which will neatly hold the drone, controller and extra battery. There is also a pocket in the lid, where I keep the (included) extra blades, double battery charger and extra 32gb micro sd memory cards. Being that I have never flown before, I took a friend out with me to show me the ropes to safely fly it. I was flying by myself in no time. The drone flew beautifully, was easy to control and it was a blast! This drone has about a 26 min fly time on a single battery charge which is the best I have seen. I would however recommend getting a second battery to extend the fun time. The HS720 also has so many features found in drones costing more than 3x more. Lastly, the Holy Stone customer service is outstanding. I would highly recommend this drone. At this price point, it would be VERY hard to beat.

title: Holy stone  drone hs720
text: So easy to learn to fly. The best at having fun with. I would recommend this drone to anyone looking to get into the field

title: Very nice for the money.
text: Very nice drone for the money. Has all the functions that most people will ever need. Their customer service is guick and responsive. Thanks.

title: Nice drone, but acting up a bit now.
text: This drone is great when new. First 5 or 6 flights everything worked great, however I'm starting to have issues with instability and the gps hover start to do circles like it's going down a drain. I've tried to reset the gps several times but continue to have the problem most times.

title: Great value, great beginner drone.
text: My first drone, I found it easy to learn and the low speed feature allowed me to tune my flying ability. The return to home feature is great and the drone typically lands within a few feet of the take off spot. Video quality is good, maybe a more expensive drone would be better but I have no complaints and I understand that when loaded to an SDcard the quality improves, I have just purchased a card but as yet I haven‚Äôt tried it. I have had a couple of flying issues but when I contacted Holy Stone they told me the problem was with the Ophelia Go app and suggested flying the drone without the app to see if the problem corrected itself and that did appear to be the case, apparently an update to the app will be available which corrects the issue. As this is my first drone I have nothing to compare it to but I haven‚Äôt been disappointed and I can definitely recommend. One top tip, when your wife tells you not to fly it in the house listen to her.

title: Great full featured entry level drone. Very happy and you will be too.
text:
This is the drone to buy! One of the longest flight times for it's size, at 26 minutes, keeps you flying for longer videos and fun. There are cheaper and more expensive drones out there but why pay $99 for junk or $1000 for a drone that's not as good as the Holy Stone? All the features you need and the video is great quality. I purchased this as a Christmas gift for my son in Hawaii. This will be his first drone. Can't wait!
I took it out for a test fly and it is very user friendly, even for my first time with a quadcopter. The video it takes is outstanding! The return to base features are important because if your video feed is lost on your cell phone or if the battery runs low it will come right back to you.
I have not found anything that could be improved upon. For my first drone flight this unit, HS720 is top notch.
Stop reading reviews, they are all positive and order this NOW!

title: Worked well for this beginner!
text: So let me say, this is the only drone I have flown so I don't have anything to compare it to. Because the pandemic canceled our travel plans, we decided to get a drone. I did a lot of research and this was the best one for the amount I was willing to invest.  Overall, the experience has been really positive. I do wish the instruction manual was not tucked away in a pocket, it tooks a bit to find it. But after charging the battery and with the help of my 17 year old gamer, were flying in less than 10 minutes of trying. It is super fun. We are looking forward to figuring out the follow me and point of interest featutes.

title: Malfunctioning and they replaced
text: First Drone gave us trouble but they thankfully sent us a replacement. So far it works fine.

title: I am so excited to fly my first drone
text: The drone instructions are easy to understand, the operation from what I have seen in videos and reviews seems perfect for an adult beginner.  The customer service was excellent and very responsive to my questions.  All mad me feel I did the right decision making my purchase.

title: Video quality is strong but the frame rate is like a nokia
Flies of its own accord
text: I don't know why this is considered a "for beginners" drone. It flies on its own, no hands on the control, no other modes activated. The camera wobbles during flight, making these other modes useless. It's very sturdy, so when it takes off on its own, flies into a tree and gets thrown back to the ground, minimal damage is done. That said? Don't waste your money.

title: Excellent Value
text: I have had a couple of drones before. All crashed within the first few flights and destroyed. This new drone has incredible functionality in the computer program and makes it super easy to fly. One of the very best features is the ‚Äúreturn to home button.‚Äù In a panic situation, just push the returned home and the drone will find itself and bring itself home without incident. A lot of fun to fly! Excellent picture resolution as well.

title: Holystone HS7200 great compact pic/video drone
text:
Very happy with my purchase. Would buy again.
Pros: easy to learn to fly. Camera video is decent. Ability to fly in a low wind conditions. Decent size drone for line of sight flying and fpv flying with app. The App is simple and is easy to learn to use. Flight times are good so far at 20-24 minutes taking it fairly easy and also flying in windy conditions. The case that comes with it great so far. Room for everything needed plus 2 extra batteries that I bought. Everything fits nicely and case feels quality built also. The drone folds up and is very compact. Has a decent weight to it. Feels solid and strong. Micro SD card slot available.

Cons.. battery charge times of 5-7 hours.
So you will need to buy extra batteries and have charged and ready for extended flying time.
The app used to fly it is really simple. Sometimes freezes for a second or so. Not much you can adjust in it. No special photo or video affects using app Or editing using app.

But all in all it is a great drone and I would definitely recommend buying it especially for beginners wanting to learn to fly and take pictures and videos. My main buying point was flying fpv with my phone and learning. It works great.

title: Great drone for beginners‚Ä¶.
text: Must have for new users. Customer service is on point as well. Great buy. I have bought two. Enjoy

title: You need this drone
text: Wow, great product. Works well, flys amazing. It also Takes amazing ariel photos and seems to stay put, even with the wind blowing. LOVE IT. customer service also fantastic. ********** 10 stars!

title: Fun, great product.  Amazing customer service and support

title: My first drone

Loved until I didn‚Äôt. Over 40 short flights. Was really getting a good feel. Then it decided on a first launch to just take off. Several attempts to fly. Support told me to swap out the propellers. Fly without the app
Crashed again and now it broke an arm.
Holy stone has no support. You are buying a 90 day toy

title: HS720 is easy to use and good camera system
text: This is a very easy to use drone. Is works good. The signal could use some work. We have had a lot of fun flying it around the neighborhood looking forward to taking it into the mtns and see what we can find.

title: Great customer service
text: I had an issue with getting the device configured and called customer service.  It was outside of hours, but they called me back!  They were very helpful and took care of me in one call.

title: Awesome Drone!
text:
Amazing, this drone lives up to its billing!
Couldn't be happier with it. First run was great. If you get one of these I have a couple of recommendations, watch as many videos as you can and read your manual carefully! Enjoy!

title: After reviewing all the available drones this one is everything I could ask for.
text: I like the compactness and how easy it is to operate. The camera gives excellent photos and videos.

title: Great starter drone
text:
The instructions were not the easiest to follow, but once I was able to get the remote and done to communicate with my phone everything was great.
Good picture quality and fun to fly.

title: Great product for the value
text: Great product for the value, especially if you can get the instant $15 coupon.  Initial flight was in low wind and the drone did well with little drifting, and auto correcting based on GPS.  The camera has some shock stabilizer on it, but not 100% perfect as video can be choppy if you are not smooth on the controls or move abruptly.  The 4k video quality is outstanding, especially compared to the 1080 drone I also own.  Would be nice if the remote had an internal rechargeable battery as you have to supply with 2 AA batteries (not sure how long they are going to last).  Overall...very impressed with the design, compactness, ease of use, and value.  Battery life is also good.  RTH function worked perfectly.  Please note that you will also need to purchase a MICRO SD card as one is not supplied but if you take video via your phone it will save it to your phone (at least it did on my iphone)

title: Fatal error causing loss of Drone twice. Excellent customer on my first incident.
text:
Bought in December 2019...

Few days after Christmas I had a non return home problem with a loss of the drone. So left a bad review. I was contacted by Customer Support and a few emails later they sent me a new drone. Wow! This was something I did not expect at all.

After three flights with my second drone I can say that the drone is good. It does fly well and has a fine camera. Some vibration was captured on videos but I believe it is due to wind. It does come with case and well equipped.

But will do several flights more and post a new review soon.

Update April 2020..... Few flights with my second Drone I had an uncommand flip and shutdown. It dropped upside-down from a hight of 20 meters. As expected it broke into pieces.

The drone looks good, handles all RIGHT, has an ok camera. But this was my second command error with fatal results. Therefore I down grade my review to one star.

title: Does not fly as specs in manual
text: Buy another brand. Stay away from this company.  They are not reputable  lip service from customer service 100 character  limit for bad reviews

title: Definitely worth the buy.
text: I personally do not own one as of roght now but have flown one and fell in love the controls for it were easy would love to own one and tell people where i got ftom to bri g you more business

title: Awesome!
text: Brought my wife this drone for Christmas and she's in love with it! Light weight yet durable. The controls are easy to learn/use. She can't put it down. The battery life is about 30 mins and it goes! She loves it! She crashed it and picked it up and kept flying. Very durable

title: Highly recommend this Drone!
text: I'm not a drone expert...but I'm not a beginner drone pilot either. I love everything about this drone...the only negative I have is the long charge time for the battery. However, pesonally for me that is not an issue...I'm going to get a 2nd battery. I did a lot of research before buying this drone and so far it has lived up to all the good reviews. So I myself must give this a good review as well. I would certainly recommend this model and give it 5 stars!

title: Great starter drone but doesn't last long
text: The HS720 works as it should, simple to use with or without smart phone.  Operating in a breeze takes practice.  The photo quality is good.  I bought this to help survey a densely wooded lot and so far it is serving well.  This is my first drone and i contacted HolyStone with questions, all of which were answered promptly.  UPDATE: 10 mos after purhase the batteries or charger stopped working so the drone is useless.  Holy Stone tells me the warranty is for 3 mos so I'm on my own.  I've only used it a few times and it has been stored inside on a bookshelf.  My next drone will not be from Holy Stone. Caveat Emptor!

title: customer service was exceptional
text:
i had lost my Hd720 into the ocean.
and contacted. holystone. after a few questions they determined to send me a replacement isnt that awesome thank yiu

title: Very well made and exceptional customer service
text: I had an HS700 Holy Stone and was impressed by it and when the new foldable 720 came out I ordered it. I was immediately impressed with the apparently buid quality. I experience a problem with vibration during video, contacted the company and they sent a replacement drone quickly.  Having a nice case and the drone folding makes it very nice for transportation. The drone flies very well, the battery life seems to meet stated times and the camera works well. The video on my 700 might have been a bit more steady than that one the 720, but I think that that may be the case with all folding vs rigid drone models. I find Holy Stone drones to be very good quality for the price.

title: Great quality
text: This drone is built really well. Awesome camera quality.

title: Nice Drone - Excellent Customer Service
text:
Well built hobby grade drone. Comes with a nice case. Easy to get in the air and fly. First flight went very well. About 4 minutes into the second flight the drone lost power and fell to the ground snapping off both the rotor arms on the left side at their pivot points. After making Holystone aware of the situation, I was contacted by Selina with Customer Service and after providing information regarding the circumstances, Selina offered to replace my HS720 2K drone with the recently upgraded HS720 4K drone! I was also allowed to keep the 2K drone for spare parts! Thank you Selina and Holystone!

ETA: The Ophelia app for the 4K drone is different than the Ophelia app for the 2K drone. If you upgrade, ensure you download the Ophelia 4K app!

title: Great Drone for the money
text: This is a really nice drone for the price. It's very well built (have crashed it a couple times). The camera has a very good picture. Really fun to fly.

title: Nice beginner drone
text: It is a nice beginner drone.  It is easy to control and it is very durable.  I should know I crashed a couple times. I would start off in an open area until you get used to it. Other than that once you learn the controls it is pretty easy to control. The photo/video quality is decent.  I am a beginner to this and This is really a good drone start with.

title: Easy to use and fun to fly
text: This is a lot of fun to fly.  I recommend it to others.

title: Easy to use and fun to fly
text: This is a lot of fun to fly.  I recommend it to others.

title: Unbelievable quality, yet affordable and easy to use.
text: The most amazing drone. Easy to learn and fly. So stable. I love flying this drone. I take lots of pictures and videos.

title: Not as good as you think
text: Overall I think the drone has some great features and is a good value for a first time drone user, but an important thing to know is that when taking video or pictures with the camera in a horizontal position you see the propellers in the upper corners of the picture of video.  You can eliminate this by tilting the camera downward, but by doing so you lose quite a few important angles at or near horizontal.  Holy Stones YouTube promotional video is very misleading in that they never (not surprising) show any propellers in the corners of horizontal flight video clips.  I'm sure they know that far fewer potential buyers would buy this drone, despite the good price, if they knew ahead of time that essentially you're not going to want a video or picture with propellers captured in the corner of the shot or clip.  They also offer a "Free Battery" in a promotional piece within the drone case.  This is an important accessory since the battery takes 5 - 7 hours to recharge.  When I called to get my "Free Battery" they said they have no additional batteries.  It's a low priced drone, so I guess the lesson here is that you get what you pay for.

title: Great drone, wonderful customer service.
text:
Was having a good time with this drone, pretty easy to fly, takes good pictures, having alot of fun with it. But 6 flights in, it took off... Was taking pictures of my house, no hands on the sticks, it just went away from me as fast as it could go. Figured I lost it in the lake but it made a big arc and swung back towards shore smashing into a tree. Needless to say it broke one arm. Will have to see if I can get it fixed...
Update: talked with customer service and they are sending a new arm and instructions to replace it. Awesome customer service.

title: First time drone

title: Holy stone is awesome
text: This is my third holy stone drone and it is perfect...I have the 700 which is  a great drone but this is perfect for inside use too...I wish the extra battery came with it because I know I will want another but that does not change my opinion this drone kit is perfect

title: Happy I chose this drone
text: This was my first drone purchase. I did a lot of research. Several YouTubers recommended this drone for beginners. It is reasonably priced and user friendly. So I'm happy with  my purchase.

title: Excellent handling and flight time
text: Video production as well as video of family outings

title: Fantastic drone for the price
text: Excellent drone for the price.  My first 720 had a catastrophic failure within the first 90 days and HS replaced it without any fuss.  Some reviews mention unexpected rogue movements of the drone without control input:  this CAN happen and WHEN it does land immediately and do a full recalibration and DON‚ÄôT forget to calibrate the gyro!  For iPhone the Ophelia GO app is the one to use (IMHO).  Within Ophelia GO you can toggle between metric and imperial units of measure.  Here‚Äôs something I didn‚Äôt find out about until the other day:  by default Ophelia GO will be set to ‚ÄúBeginner Mode‚Äù - TURN BEGINNER MODE OFF!!!

title: Issue with original but Customer Service is GREAT. New drone is perfect!
text:
UPDATED AGAIN 5.26.20

The new drone is AMAZING. Selina with HS was extremely helpful and they sent a new drone which arrived quickly. The battery life is excellent and the new drone handled nearly as perfect as other more expensive drones.
This really is a wonderful drone for beginners and I recommend this product to ANYONE that wants to get into the hobby but wants a drone with advanced features like GPS.

The Return to home feature missed by about 2 feet the first time but nailed it the second. I think this had a lot to do with the location I was flying. it worked well enough and I recommend giving yourself a good wide space to land.

I took it up about 200 feet and flew it around 175 feet away in an open field with no issues.

The carrying case is nice, although it needs straps to hold the props in place inside the case and better storage for extra batteries would be good. still... free case, can't complain!

The only downside I can say so far (and this may be corrected later) is that there aren't really any accessories for this model. You can buy spare batteries and props but that's about it. I would totally purchase landing struts, upgraded cases, maybe a holder extender for a tablet...

Overall, 4 stars for the drone and 5 stars for the service!

Thank you Holy Stone!

UPDATE.

Selina from Holy Stone was very helpful. After going over the issue with her in detail, she is going to issue a replacement drone. I will try it and update my review again as soon as I receive it. If it works as expected, I will give more stars! Either way, I have to say that Customer Service is VERY fast and very willing to help. Thanks Selina and Holy Stone :)

ORIGINAL REVIEW:
When I got the drone it was raining. It has been 3 days and the rain finally stopped so I was excited to finally fly my new drone.

I calibrated it as written in the instructions.
I made sure to have multiple satellites.
The gyro was calibrated.

The drone took off and wouldn‚Äôt hover in place. Instead, it went up, flew sideways and crashed into a wall. It crashed to the ground and the emergency stop wouldn‚Äôt respond and neither would the controller. It just kept tearing itself into the brick and concrete.

I finally had to turn it off by the button on top Which was extremely dangerous.

I tried again and repeated the calibration steps. Same thing only when I took off and it started going crazy, I tried to descend using the joy stick and instead it flew sideways and crashed, flipped over and just kept on destroying itself.

Contacted Customer Service for help. Review updated.

title: Don't be fooled
text: Received this drone not only broken beyond repair, but was lied to. Nowhere on the Amazon item page can I see where it says this drone is refurbished. Saw that it was after receiving the package(see photo). Shrugged it off and then opened it anyway because I was excited to finally have a drone. First thing I notice was the case no zippered all the way & the inside zipper fully opened. I removed the plastic wrapped drone body from the case & saw that one of the propellers was under the body, not wrapped up. Thinking it was a spare I removed the body from the plastic & then realized it was broken off. I suspect that a previous buyer broke it, wrapped it back up & then Amazon took for granted it was a simple unopened returned or.... Amazon employee who supposedly checked it, simply did not. Either way, too many other purchase options to accept this. I will be asking for a refund & will purchase somewhere else.

title: The drone is great. But the customer service is better.
text:
Well I ended up breaking this drone on it's first flight. (Full story below) I was devastated. I reached out to Holy Stone and told them what had happened. I didn't expect much as it was my fault and they were under no obligation to help me. To my surprise they ended up sending me a replacement. I can not express how grateful for this second chance.

Full Story
This is my third drone so I am not a noob at this but this is by far the most expensive one. I wanted my first flight to just learn the ropes so I stayed in my back yard. I wasn't even going to go higher then my house. I got everything ready and took off. And all of a sudden my dog jumped up and grabbed it out of the air. She let go quickly but because of this my done was out of control. In a panic I attempted to regain control and land it but it hit a branch and entered a flat spin to the ground. As a result two arms broke off.

I went ahead and sent an email to the company. I told them that I broke it on my first flight and asked them what my options where. At first they offered to send me a replacement arm. I was ok with that but it did require soldering to replace. A day later they told me that they were going to send out a total replacement and that I could keep the broken one. This company has total world class service and I am very grateful they put their customers first.

title: First Impression: Nice!
text:
This is the third drone I've purchased from Holy Stone (in 3 years). It is by far the best. My first was a 200D (2 years ago): fun to fly but not so simple to fly. The next was a 700 (last year, not the 700D). The HS700 is very capable but quirky. I added the HS700D propeller guards to my HS700 and these made the HS700 a joy to fly (landings became low-stress). I'm happy to say that the optical flow feature of the HS720 takes care of many of the HS700 quirks. The HS720 can fly 1-2 meters over the ground and remain very stable -- the HS700 needs to be kept higher. The 4K camera, with in-flight tilt, is very nice (great quality video and snaps). Is the HS720 a good selection for an absolute beginner? As a second drone, it would be a win. As a first drone, I'd want some help on the first flight. My first impression is that the HS720 is a great flier and easy to setup & use. About the only issue I can envision is that the fold-able arms for the motors might not take a lot of abuse (crashes).

In closing, this is an "arms-length" review. I've had no contact with HS about this HS720. (btw, in the past I have found the HS support to be helpful and they do actually reply.) After one day at the field, my HS720 is look'n good!

title: Controls don't always work
text: Sorely disappointed in this drone. The camera is sub-par and the drone doesn't always recognize input. For example I will attempt to rotate it right or left. Sometimes it works, sometimes it does nothing. How frustrating. Returning this thing immediately.

title: IT'S A BUY AGAIN !!!  Holy Stone #1
text:
Update: I wrote a negative review on the HS720. I actually returned the unit for a refund. Holy Stone offered to send me a New HS720 to Re-Review. As I am a huge fan of Holy Stone products (owned them for years) I jumped on the opportunity..
I've ran the unit about four times now and I must say I believe they have made the necessary changes to make this a fun and safe Drone..It hasn't gone rogue as the last unit did and sinks with my IPhone a lot faster..
I am ounce again recommending this top of the line drone and praising the Holy Stone staff for there commitment in solving issues in there product and there commitment to there customers...Thank You Holy Stone and Cathy...Myra Summers...Summerville SC

title: Remote randomly breaks transmission with drone
text:
Remote randomly breaks link with drone, then lands wherever it wants, full batteries in both drone and remote. Had 3 months, used 5 times, remote lost transmission with drone, I sat and watched it nosedive into the water, as I tried to navigate drone with remote at about 30 feet away, and 40 feet up, within plenty of range.
Just get something more reliable, and don't lose hundreds of dollars as I just did.
Zero stars.

It wouldn't shut off and got scratched up while it landed on the floor can't control it it at all it doesn't hover still you have to fight with it and it's acts like it wants to go full speed all the time so it landed on the floor and got scuffed all up but I want my money back So , I'm returning for a refund not impressed at all especially for what I paid for it.

title: Do some research before purchasing this.
text: Very disappointed with the purchase of this  drone.  My first HS720 drone had a vibration that did not allow it to record fluid videos. Holystone sent me a brand new replacement. On the first flight on the replacement drone the Drone took off on its own and I could not control it with the remote. The return to home button will not work although it was registering 14 satellites on the remote. The thing simply took off at high speed on its own, gone!

title: Holy Stone customer service is the best!
text:
I've have had just a single test flight on the drone, which is powerful, smooth, and in all other ways everything I expected it to be, but my real surprise was the Holy Stone customer service. I had an early issue that resulted in a broken part. Oh no, my new drone. Aside from my new toy being damaged, I was as concerned with what was sure to be a needlessly protracted and costly process to get it repaired. Not so! The Holy Stone customer service folks never flinched. They responded quickly, got to the bottom of things quickly, and in no time had arranged an all new unit to be sent to me. Even suggesting I retain the original for parts! Are you kidding me?! That is the type of old time customer service that you just do not see anymore. These days most companies are quick to dodge any sort of obligation after the sale. They pay the idea lip service, but its more a markeing illusion than actual support. If its not figured into the mark-up on the unit sold, or they can't get you for an additinal charge, they are not interested.
Holy Stone could teach them all a lesson in building brand loyalty. Thanks for doing it right. I know where my next drone is coming from.

title: Great drone for the money
text: This is a very good drone if you are just starting out I have put this drone to the test and everything works just fine

title: Lots of Fun!
text:

Get one. Have loads of fun.

title: Holy Stones Customer Service and Staff
text: I purchased a HS720, and had problems on my maiden flight.  It was a Sunday afternoon and I decided to contact the Customer Service anyway, instead for waiting til Monday morning.  I wrote a short email describing what had happened, that evening I received a response.  After answering a few questions and sending them some pics, I received notification that my issue was moved up to a supervisor for replacement, a "New Drone".  I'm very impressed with the staff, Selina, Gina, Ravin, and Angelina of their Customer Service Staff and Holy Stone.  Their actions and product support are a breathe of fresh air, others need to follow there example.  I can't wait to receive my new drone and my maiden flight.  thanks again

title: Amazing drone, love how it flys, great for beginners
text: wow this drone is great, i regret not getting the 720e instead of just the 720, however, i cannot complain due to how fun and easy it is to fly. There are a few hiccups with it tho such as randomly wanting to do its own thing. I ended up crashing the drone on my third flight and went straight into to a tree out of nowhere and with no wind. Even when I tried to counter act the drift with pushing the stick to the left, it still wanted to go to the right for no reason. Broke the back right arm but thank god for superglue. One other thing i‚Äôm not too much of a fan of is the latency on the fpv, makes it a bit hard to control when just looking at the screen but then again, i‚Äôm not exactly sure how it is on other drones since this is my first fpv drone. That does not stop me from having fun with this drone tho, just pure fun. Another thing for anyone reading this is be carful about when you are calibrating it, make sure it‚Äôs on a true even surface or it will want to lean when you are flying it. Don‚Äôt think that was the issue with my crash, however i‚Äôm still a beginner so...

text: I am not a professional, thus did not want to spend top dollar for something that would only be used occasionally. After researching I came across Holy Stone. I was impressed with the options offered at low price points. I decided to give the HS720 a try as one that could fold up was key for me. title: Great beginner drone!
text: I love the video quality of this drone, it is smooth and clear.  Battery life is moderate, on my controller if it looks between 3/4 to 1/2 full, the drone only has a few minutes left of actual flight time.  Early on using this drone, it would simply stop responding, and drop vertically until it (crash) landed.  It has a difficult time moving against a headwind, sometimes you need to put it into 'High' while flying hard into the wind and rising at the same time in order to make it home.  'Follow me', 'Point of interest' and 'headless' modes work flawlessly.  Unfettered 'Return to home' landings are typically within 4 feet.

title: Great Learning Platform for the Drone Newbie
text:
I've been tinkering with idea of buying a drone for 3 years. Drone owners I know pointed me toward the DJI products but I couldn't see spending what that takes to get onboard there. After seeing reviews on the HS720 I decided to get my feet wet with Holy Stone and after a few weeks getting to know the platform (hardware/software) I'm happy with this decision.

Support has been great so far. Access to support was quick and easy and they patiently took me through my startup issues (RT?M). As I'm learning to fly, keeping the drone out of the trees has been a challenge. It's surprising how resilient the HS720 is. Most of the time, when I hit tree branches the drone keeps flying. The few times when it's crashed it bounced right back and was flying again immediately. This may be some part beginners luck :-).
There's been one practical application so fan and the HS720 delivered nicely. I'm taking bids to put a 65 foot sidewalk between my rear door (north side) and my driveway (south side). Having aerial pictures of my property to email concrete contractors has helped to move my bidding process alone.

There are zero reasons so far for me to second guess buying this drone.

title: The ability to control the drone is easy when there‚Äôs less wind

title: Works great photos look great too.

title: good economy drone..
text: I have had it now for a few weeks and still getting the hang of flying it. It seems to do well if one follows the start up and calibration steps EXACTLY as in instructions EACH time before flight. I noticed not doing this EVERY single time will cause problems. There is also an extra step needed not in the manual. it is the compass calibration. After doing the initial calibration, push both joysticks to the lower left in unison and after the lights stop flashing, it sets the compass calibration. My biggest complaint was getting the W-Fi connection to my android phone. It took a few tries, but I once I figured out what I was doing wrong, it connects fine. I only use the wi-fi right now for the camera feature, as I get better, I will explore the other features.

Also the battery life which states 26 min is I think enough for beginners like me. Also one time i flied it for more than 15 min and drone being SMART figured out it is running out of the juice, thus it returned from where it originally took off. safely Also I must say the photo and video quality is superb as well and I can easily download it to my phone from SD card or directly record to my phone.
One this I must say is that the customer service of Holystone is alsoGREAT and I am very much impressed by their service. title: Customer Service is better than the drone

title: Excellent build quality and performance for price point.
text:
I purchased this drone on 18 September 2019 and have thoroughly run it through some extreme rookie test scenarios.
First, I must say for the price the build quality and performance exceeded my expectations.
The HS720 has 4 brushless motors, 2k camera, and micro SD card slot.
First rookie mistake, I flew the hS720 into a small tree, LOL!, leaves were flying like gnats in a dust storm. The drone stalled and dropped about 10 feet to the ground. I went over to collect it, obviously thinking it was damaged by slicing the tree leaves plus the impact with the ground.
To my surprise there was only a small paint scratch about the size of a needles eye on the motor arm. I had to look very hard to find the scratch. I brought the drone back to my starting point, relaunched and all the motors started with no problem. The drone lifted off and I continued to have fun flying for the day.
I estimate that I actually got 25 minutes from the battery. The drone automatically returned to home around 25 minutes and landed. Although I still had a cell left on the battery the drone refused to go back up into flight. I took it home and recharged the battery, which takes about 5 hours (only downside for me).
I had issues with the Opehiia GPS app, I could not get it to function on my phone. Three weeks later I figured out the problem.
Please note, for the Opehila GPS app to work you must accept all the request for access to your device (example: location, photo, media, files, make and manage phone calls). I only gave permission to the device location, which caused the Opehila GPS app not to work. It does not tell you this in English, it is just non-functional.
I have a spare Samsung Galaxy S6 that I was not using. I pulled it out of the draw installed the Opehila app and answered yes to all the requests and viola, it functioned perfectly, video and pictures.
I am very pleased with this drone, I even flew it out of sight and out of range, thought I had lost it. I was standing in a open field feeling bad for about 8 minutes, started packing what was left of my gear to head to my car. Then, I heard a humming sound, I looked up in the sky but didn‚Äôt see the drone, I pressed the down throttle and about a minute later the hs720 became visible right over the area where I had calibrated the satellite return to home settings, it WORKS! Love this little drone.
On another day, there were constant wind gusts between 15-30 miles per hour. I thought I would test the hs720 performance in strong wind. To my surprise the drone hovered and tried to maintain its original position. I flew it with the wind, and it soared quickly away as expected. I reversed direction and flew it against the wind and it return slowly back to me, took a while but the hs720 made it back. The flying height was 15 feet, I kept it there just in case I had to do an emergency landing.
I give Holy Stone 5 stars; I am sure the hs720 was not meant to endure the abuse I put it through. I highly recommend this drone to others who are considering a purchase, especially for the price point you will appreciate your decision. Customer service is excellent, very professional and available.

title: Easy to use

I lost it in a grassy field and the GPS locator works amazingly well.  This was purchased to expand my real estate photography abilities, very excited to have this on my arsenal.

title: Good design and features (great buy)
text:
Although I have been eager to purchase a drone for several years now, the purchase of the Holy Stone HS720 is my first purchase. The market now has a number of low cost drone options which got me back into researching a possible purchase. As a retired research engineer, I was spent hours reading reviews, watching online videos, and comparing the features and performance of many drones that are now available for what I considered cost effectiveness for my purchase. I did not just want to try to satisfy my desire for a drone with a toy although they are pretty cheap theses days. I wanted a drone with enough features and capability to satisfy me. Looking for something with great basic capabilities, ease of use, good battery performance, and decent photo and video specifications.
So, after extensive research, that brought me to the decision to purchase the Holy Stone HS720, and I am glad I did. This drone has met and exceeded my expectations. I am still new at this drone pilot adventure, with more practice, I look forward to some exciting flights and great videos. As a long time photographer and videographer, with computer editing skills, I plan to make some nice DVDs with the footage from the HS720. I live in the mountains and can use the HS720 drone to help me explore areas for hiking trips. Thanks Holy Stone for making this truly affordable drone available.

title: My HS720 was better than I expected. It's a nice quality flier.
text: It was better than I expected. This HS720's  quality jumps out. It's solid and well built. It's not a flimsy drone. I can tell the tolerances are tight and the composite materials used for the frame are sturdy.  It has a lot of features and it's been flying really well. The provided battery holds up over 20 minutes. I'm not one to test it to the limit, but it's a nice flight time though. I ordered an extra battery because 40 or so minutes of flying is nice. The case is professional and holds most of the drone and it's accessories and it's small. The whole unit is a fine buy for the money. My flying friend has a DJI Mavic Pro and he was having a great time playing with mine. They stacked up pretty well next to each other. For a beginner - intermediate flyer, it's a champ. Only one small thing - I think the cellphone holder on the hand held remote is a tad flimsy. I'd also suggest buying another battery because  flying around for nearly an hour is a treat, which you can do with two batteries. The extra battery is great to have because recharge time can take from 7 to 7 hours. The supplied charger charges two batteries at the time though. IMO 40 plus minutes flight time is a good time in the air. Hope this helped.

text:
Great video, bought it for the 4K video. Excellent height and distance it can fly. Wonderful circling mode or hovering mode.
However, .... 1) cannot fly it near a tree or a house. Only works well in an open parking lot or a soccer field. So very limited pictures. 2) Return home when battery is low works most of the time. In one case it came back and could not land, bounced up and down and then hit the parking lot hard, 3) Camera worked in the beginning but then drone was very shaky about 15 feet and gave shaky video, 4) even after calibration it suddenly took off and crashed into my neighbors tree, I lost complete control, 5) Support is great when you get hold of them, phone line rings, and then gets disconnected, multiple attempts to get support, 6) manual is written by a person not a native English speaker, even the app on the iPhone is similar and has errors. 7) no obstacle avoidance but I knew that before purchase, did not realize you cannot go near a house or a tree and flying restricted to an open field only.
Price - next step up to get what I want is 5x or more.

title: A really "Great" product from Holy Stone.
text:
Starting off, I would like to say that this is the first drone or flying devise I have ever had (not counting the one I returned to Amazon previously) or tried to fly. I really am your basic beginner with this. My reason for purchasing was twofold; 1 - something to do while staying at home during this whole COVID thing, and 2 - we have an RV and camp a lot. I thought it would be handy and fun to take pictures and video of the campgrounds we stay at as well as interesting and scenic things we stop to look at.
Some of the things I will talk about relate to the drone I ordered before this one and returned due to several issues.
From the moment I opened up the box and saw the case, I knew this was a much, much better product than my previously returned (had it for about 2 weeks) drone. The case is small (since this drone is foldable) and sturdy. Has a nice handle on one side and easily fits in my hiking backpack with room to spare. When I took it out of the case it felt solid and was easy to handle. My previous drone I had a terrible time with the compass calibration but this was easy and was completed without incident the very first time. The GPS came up with 5 or 6 satellites almost as soon as I turned it on and then went on to as many as 16 or 17. The one I returned took a minute or two to start to connect. Connecting the drone WIFI with my Iphone X was also no problem, connected very quickly the first time and connected automatically each time after that. Downloading the software was also very simple. I was ready for some setup problems, but there really were none in the whole procedure. Very smooth and simple startup the very first time. I was pretty happy and ready to fly.
The controller is also pretty nice. Much more comfortable than the returned one. It has two handle kind of things that fold out at the bottom making it pretty easy to hold. It takes 2 AA batteries and the phone sits at the top of the controller, easy to see. It fits the holder very nicely. The other one had the holder at the bottom which for me was harder to watch. The controller has an unlock button for the props. Just press it and they wind up for 3 - 4 seconds. No having to move the joysticks a certain way at the same time. Just press the button. The controls are very responsive and easy to use. It has a button for takeoff and landing if you want to use it. The RTH (return to home) button also works really nice. I have had it out probably a 1/4 mile or so and pressed the RTH button. It comes back all on its own and lands within 12 inches or so of where it took off from .You don't have to do anything. When it gets close you can press the button again to disengage it and do the landing yourself. The point of interest feature works great. I haven't tried the follow me feature yet.
Flight time after flying 6 or 7 times seems to be around 25 minutes. I haven't taken any video yet but I have taken several pictures and that doesn't seem to impact flight time much. Maybe taking video will. In the straight ahead location you do get the tips of the props on the edges but you can adjust it down a bit and get rid of them. A couple of times there was a light breeze (5 - 7 mph I guess) and the drone seemed to handle it well. If you let it hover, it would pretty much hold its place without drifting around.
The camera takes really nice pictures in my opinion. They as very clear and sharp with no vibration. It will look straight ahead or straight down or anyplace in between. The adjuster is a bit touchy but you get used to it.
A word about Holy Stone Customer Service. It's great, both email and phone. I had occasion to use both. The email was answered with 24 hours and the phone call completely answered my question. They even called me back a few days later to make sure everything was still ok. Great service.
Overall, I think this is a terrific drone for a beginner like me or an experienced person. If I could change one thing, it would be the battery charge time. It does take 5 - 7 hours for a full charge. A faster charger and/or a second battery would be great. That being said, I am still very happy with this drone so far and would definitely buy another Holy Stone product and recommend them to my friends. Hope this helps you decide.

text: I just received my Holy Stone HS720 4k foldable drone.  When I open the box I surprised of the quality of the padded box it came with.  Everything was packed nicely as well. As I flew it I got a little more comfortable with it and took it up to 300'.  No problems with the controls and handle the upper winds just fine. title: Has a mind of its own.
text: This was third Holystone drone. I‚Äôve had it for a few months and flown it numerous times without a problem. I took it out today and initially everything was going fine. However, I put the drone in orbit function and after it made approximately six loops around me it suddenly took off in a straight line and kept going. The drone would no longer respond to the remote control and I had to just stand there and watch the drone fly away. I thought that once it had gone far enough to lose the gps signal (which it did) that it would automatically return home. Unfortunately, it did not do that. This drone was an upgrade from my last Holystone drone, which had done the same exact thing, I suppose I should‚Äôve learned my lesson after the first drone flew off never to be seen again. That‚Äôs two Holystone drones that stopped responding to their remotes and I‚Äôve had to watch them both fly off along with my money. My next drone will not be a Holystone.

title: All I can say is Wow!
text:
This is my second drone from Holy Stone. After buying the small HS165 and having a great experience with both the drone and their customer service (not to mention the "omg this is so fun!" feeling when flying it), I decided to buy this drone as an upgrade.

The construction feels very sturdy and the drone has some real "heft" to it. The case fits everything perfectly, so it will be well protected and easy to transport. The manual is clear and concise, and getting everything ready to go for the first basic flight was just a matter of reading a few pages of the manual and following the instructions.

Once it was flying, I noticed a few differences between this and the smaller drone. This one has a very different sound to it because of the larger brushless motors. It's not loud, but there's a solid "angry bees" sound to it. You can tell there's some serious power turning the blades. The responsiveness is amazing. It maneuvers very quickly and is quite fast. It was a bit windy on the day of my first flight, but it made virtually no difference to this drone and I was able to fly it around the house and over a bunch of trees with ease and good stability.

I've only taken a few pictures and videos, but the quality seems to be good (especially when I pay attention to where the sun is. Ha!) and it's simple and quick to snap pictures and start/stop the video.

I'm looking forward to trying out some of the more advanced features (follow-me, point of interest, pathing, etc), but my house is surrounded by some trees and power lines, so I'll wait until I get get in a more open area to check those out.

I'd like to give a final shout-out to the Holy Stone customer service folks. I've been in contact with them a few times and they've always been amazingly response and helpful. I have no qualms at all about their products because I know they'll stand behind them and be there to support me when I have questions.

title: Great Drone with many features at good value and quality.
text: [[VIDEOID:50ca744c49521f75dd4fcb2b03564953]] Nice features at a great value, easy to learn and operate.

title: Easy to fly
text: All the features I was looking for and easy to fly. We loved ours so much we bought one for our 12yr old and with a little help shes flying with us!

title: Ok for big open spaces. Great customer service
text:
My son got a cheap drone for Christmas, so I purchased the HS720 to give us something to do together. The main things that drive me to chose the HS720 was the GPS/RTH functions. I received the drone on a Friday and started flying it the next day. It was very easy to learn, especially since I had been using my son‚Äôs drone for the last several weeks. On Sunday, I decided to be brave and use some of the additional features that the HS720 has to offer. I flew the drone up over the tree line and programmed a route on the map using the trace function about a quarter to a half of the size of a city block. The drone should have never been out of my line of site. I watched the drone go to its first point on the trace and it just kept going. I hit the RTH button several times only to watch it keep flying away.

That evening, I contacted Holy Stone. I fully expected them to tell me to go pound sand. After a few discussions and some negotiations, their rep Engy agreed to send me a brand new drone.

I received the new drone a couple of days later and immediately began flying again. This past Saturday I took the drone to a public park to do a little flying. First two flights went great. Flew over the ponds, got some cool alligator pics, etc. I flew until my first battery was about dead.

We did some walking and came to another spot where I wanted to get some pics. I did all of the set up, like I have always done (rotate horizontal 3x, rotate very 3x). Got the solid red and green lights. Set it in the ground and prepared for take off. I hit the auto take off button. Normally, it would raise about 5‚Äô and hover steady. This time, it would not stay still. Before I knew it, it hit a shrub tree and was in the pond. Don‚Äôt know what caused it to go off course, but it absolutely would not hold its position. I now have one lost drone and one wet drone.

With all that said, this drone would be great for wide open spaces where you are going to fly very low and there is no possibility that you could have a water landing. The times we flew over the big fields, the drone did great, but I didn‚Äôt have to worry about hitting anything if it made any unanticipated moves. If you are planning to fly in anything other than an open field, then this is. It the drone for you.

title: A good quality drone for a beginner
text:
I wanted a drone to take video footage for our travel blog, and I spent quite a lot of time reviewing the available drones. The Holy Stone HS720 seemed to be have a good feature set at a reasonable price, so I took the plunge.

After receiving the drone, I read the manual, watched a few videos on flying drones, and charged the battery. Then I found an open area and took it out for a spin. Here are my observations:
- Construction and quality. I was immediately impressed at the overall quality of the drone. Everything folds up and stows nicely in a padded, lunch box sized case.
- Easy for a beginner to learn. This is my first drone, and I wanted enough artificial intelligence to prevent me from crashing it or watching it fly away over the horizon while I learned how to fly it. I had no trouble getting the hang of it.
- Good camera. Since the whole purpose of the drone was to take video footage for our blog, the camera should be stabilized and have reasonable resolution. This isn't a $5000 ( or even a $1500) drone, so I wasn't expecting cinematic quality footage. Overall, I found the video quality to be quite adequate for our needs and better than I anticipated.
- Return to home (RTH) feature. The RTH function is, in my opinion, the most important AI feature of the drone. If the communication link is lost, the battery becomes dangerously low, or the RTH button is pressed, the drone rises to a safe altitude, returns to the take-off point and automatically lands. My biggest fears were that I'd watch my new drone fly over the horizon, never to be seen again, or the motors would quit, causing the drone to crash. I pressed the RTH button when the drone was several hundred feet away, and the drone returned and landed exactly as advertised.
- Circle a point. An experienced drone operator can pilot a drone in a circle around a point, keeping the camera aimed at the object of interest, and maybe I'll be there someday. In the meantime, the HS720 will, with the press of a button, do this automatically. I haven't quite mastered the process - the drone has to be positioned at just the right distance from the object of interest or it won't be the center of the circle, but I still got some reasonable footage on my first attempt.
- Follow an object. On command, the drone will follow the remote at a distance of 50 or so feet, useful if you want some footage, for example, of yourself while walking or jogging.
- Battery life. The battery lasted almost 20 minutes, considerably longer than I expected. Since this was my first time flying this drone (or any drone for that matter), I did a lot of hovering and slow speed maneuvers, so this may have contributed to the long battery life.

Overall, I was quite pleased with the drone, but there were a couple of annoyances.
- Manual. The manual wasn't bad, but assumed I knew more about drones than I did. I found some of the instructions confusing and hard to follow. Perhaps a more experienced operator would have had an easier time.
- Battery charge time. It takes about six hours to recharge the battery, way too long in my opinion. Having a couple of spare batteries would help, but at the time of this review, spare batteries are not available (although they are promised soon), and it's unknown what the cost of spares will be.

All in all, I'm quite happy with my new drone.

title: Great drone and a lot of fun!
text:
I previously had the HS120D drone and decided I wanted one with a 4K camera so I purchased the 720 model and I've been very happy with my purchase.

The camera quality is great and the battery life is tremendous. About half way through the battery life, the drone has limits on height and distance to make sure it's within range if the battery gets critically low, which I appreciate. The drone also has different speed modes which are helpful.

The full battery distance and height ranges are really impressive and the app has a lot of features. I like seeing the distances on the remote and makes landing it in the right place much easier. I also like being able to see the location on the map.

All in all, this is a great drone that's easy to fly and take care of. The travel case it comes with is much appreciated and makes traveling with the drone very easy.

title: Would be a 4 but...
text:
Pros:
1. Low cost for premium features
2. Decent flyer in windy conditions
3. Long flight time
4. 90 degree camera rotation
5. Good control and reasonable transmission at long range
6. Simple app with no registration required
7. GPS, home, orbit, and follow-me all work very well (as long as you have at least 9 satellites)

Cons:
1. Shaky camera - not as noticeable at lower fps
2. Requires current premium phone with 5ghz wifi - my iphone 7 only allows for a max of 200m wifi range, making the camera useless in real time at long range.
3. Camera has a dead sensor, and there is a white pixel in the near center of all the video I record.
4. Does not have obstacle avoidance, and if auto-flying by GPS it will fly into anything in it's path without your control (unless you turn off GPS auto flight functions).
5. Transmission is slightly delayed, so controls are not as sharp as other drones of the same type

I will be contacting Holystone regarding the dead sensor to see if that can be fixed, or if it needs exchanged. If it weren't for the dead sensor on the camera, (and no way to remap the camera sensors manually, though hopefully this happens automatically, like in sony cameras), I would give this drone a 4 based on it's reasonable performance at such a low price.

title: Specifications listed in the product have been spot on.

And the RTH (Return To Home) has been flawless - either when pushing the button manually, when I flew it too far and it lost signal, or when the battery is getting low.  A very compact and sturdy drone for beginners.  I did have an issue with the charger which apparently died for some reason, but tech support was great and promptly shipped me a new one without question and this one has been working fine for multiple charges.  Distance, range, and running time have been spot on with my experiences.  I love it when a vendor doesn't exaggerate their product claims.
