title: An Awesome Drone!
text:
[[VIDEOID:cd9fb75b16f516cc7b82c553f63470d6]] The Holy Stone 720 is awesome! Not only is it a compact drone packaged in a very convenient and well-appointed carry case, but it is fast and nimble.

I‚Äôve flown the 720 just a handful of times but have a good sense of its capabilities.

The drone is packed in a zippered hard case with a carry handle. Inside it has cut-out foam placements for the drone, transmitter and box of accessories containing spare props, a screwdriver and charger. The case is a convenient way to transport your drone without it getting damaged.
Start-up procedures/steps seem more streamlined than the HS270 and HS700, so it was short order to get the 720 airborne.

The build quality is excellent. It feels solid and well-made to the touch.

The transmitter is small to hold, but the fold-out palm grips help and make it feel more secure in your hands. I like the LCD display which provides relevant status of all components, such as GPS satellites, battery status, height and distance. The dual antenna and smartphone mount are quite close to each other, so I struggled a little to mount the smartphone on the transmitter, but once in place it felt quite secure. If you have big hands you might find it more cumbersome.

Flying the drone is a dream! It is the fastest of the three drones I own, and very responsive to flight control inputs. Battery time is very good, but initial charge time is long; 5-7 hours from zero charge.

You can record first-person-view (FPV) video directly to a connected smartphone using the Ophelia app, or to an optional 32 GB TF card and then download to your PC. Video quality is good depending on the resolution of your playback device. Of course, you don‚Äôt have to record video to use first person view (FPV) in flight, and you don‚Äôt need a smartphone/Ophelia software to fly the drone visually.

In summary, HS720 drone has great flight characteristics, it is compact and easy to transport in its case.

title: Fly in open area until you get good
text: Great product and customer support is the best ive experienced

title: This is the drone  you're looking for!
text:
Pros:
- Smooth, very stable, and easy to fly
- Excellent Battery life (so far I've got about 22-23 min)
- Controller is top notch compared to others in this price range
- High build quality on the Drone
- Camera is adequate
- Love the landing lights for night flying!
- Case is very nice and sleek! Love it!
- Holystone has very helpful customer support that actually responds to you!

Cons:
- Phone holder on the controller was a little tricky to figure out. At first I couldn't get my phone to stay in, but then I realized the arm was not fully extending. I had to pull a little harder in order for it to fully extend. My iphone XS then fit in it like a glove. It also took a little force getting the arm to go back in the controller.
- The charger is capable of charging two batteries at one time which is cool, but it does seem a little on the cheap side. Every USB C cable I tried, including the one it came with didn't seem to fit securely into the input jack. It also takes 5-7 hours to charge which is on the higher side compared to similar drones. You will definately want a 2nd battery.
- The camera quality is ok compared to other drones at this price point and could use better stabilization or a gimble. I'm also still learning so I'm hoping my videos will improve with my flying! =)

Overall Review:
- 1st time GPS drone user here so I did mega research and went down a rabbit hole of similar drones! Despite it's very few and minor shortcomings I'm glad I chose this one and I think you will too, especially if it's your first "real" drone.

title: Fantastic Drone for a First Timer!
text:
This is the first drone I have ever flown. I knew exactly what I was purchasing through some YouTube and written reviews research. I give the Drone 5 stars for what it is, and how easy it was for me to get set up and fly. I Was even able to record and snap photos of my test flight. I thoroughly read the instruction/owner's manual before flight. I even went legit, and registered the drone with the FAA, as this drone is required due to it's weight (over 250 grams) It's super easy to do and it's only $5 bucks.

You will need a micro sd card for this drone for it to perform to it's full potential. This drone can accept a MAXIMUM of 32gb micro sd. No larger from what I understand. Also, you will need to purchase a 5v / 2.0a usb adapter to properly charge batteries. *Not included* I wish I would have known this prior to purchase. It does inform of this in the manual though.

Long review short, I really enjoyed my first flight with this drone. It was very easy to fly, and land, and I'm really looking forward to getting more flight time in! Hope this was helpful!

title: Good drone for beginners who don't want to buy toy junk.
text: This is my first drone purchase so take it with a grain of salt. The kids and I have a lot of fun with this. It works well and the pitch automatically adjusts for wind. The follow me setting works well too and waypoints are accurate. It flies quite fast and does really well low to the ground. I've used other drones that do not fly well in tight spaces. This one does excellent. Once you get the hang of the controls it's quite stable and steady. Even in wind it keeps position well. It keeps altitude quite well too in wind. The video and photos are good but you would expect that from an HD camera so less impressive given the expectations but the video quality meets expectations. I was a little concerned with battery life but it actually does quite well. I can routinely get 30 min of fly time out of it. All in all I'm very pleased with this drone. As a side note FAA registration was very simple and fairly cheap.

title: Excellent beginner drone
text: This drone is an excellent drone for beginners. Also it takes amazing video and pictures. You need memory card for 4K video.

title: Fun for flying, camera moves a lot
text:
It was easy to learn in the outdoors.
What I liked:
The GPS really works so it does try to stay in place and returns to home fine so I don't fear losing the device as much
Having no experience flying before, a few sessions in a safe location free of trees, power lines and people. Using the controls was quite easy

What I don't like:
The camera on this model moves a lot so videos are unstable as the drone moves around to compensate for wind and maintaining GPS position

The wifi connection to phone drops out like 2-300m away so no way to see what camera is seeing beyond that distance.

That aside, I find flying it fun

title: Great product, functions as advertised, and great customer service!
text: Packaged well, with a great case. Easy to fly, with great video/camera quality. Real stable, with a little expected shake and drift from sustained wind aloft or gusts of about 10 knots. Once you practice and get orientation down you can take some very smooth video. Max range I have taken it was about 600' feet distance and 130' feet elevation. Take your time and do the calibration right, and understand the app settings. The only thing quirky is the follow me function, which I found works okay to good 50' or below, but is a tad slow adusting (follows the controller). Return to home and auto takeoff/landing work as adverised. Really a great value enhanced by fantastuc customer service.

title: Fun and easy to fly!
text:
I've been thinking about purchasing a drone for some time and finally got serious about it. After a lot of research and reading many reviews I decided on the HS720 because of its price, star rating, positive reviews and high remarks for its customer service.
When the drone arrived, I read the instructions and watched a couple of YouTube videos on how to fly. First flight didn't disappoint. The take off and landing assist worked great. The gps return to home feature is awesome and pictures quality is good. Battery life is more than adequate for beginners. If you're thinking about getting a drone I'd highly recommend this one. It has great features for the price.
Unfortunately being a novice flier, I attempted to fly the drone in higher winds then recommend and I crashed the drone, damaging the right front arm. I emailed customer support and they responded within 24 hours, I explained to the representative (Summer) the circumstances and she send me a replacement drone. Needless to say in this day and age it seems like contacting customer service is a huge pain and it's difficult to find someone that can actually take care of your issue. I was pleasantly surprised how quickly HS addressed my problem and I was completely satisfied with the outcome. My new drone arrived today and I can't wait to get the batteries charged and fly again!

title: HS720 - Easy to use, Great image quality, Affordable !!
text: Absolutely GREAT image quality. As a previous owner of a Holy Stone HS100 (which I still have and use regularly) I was in the market for a more compact drone I could easily travel with around the country to job sites.  I searched much more expensive competitors but still came back to Holy Stone and the HS720 and I‚Äôm glad I did.  The unit is compact, cones with an included travel case, and us extremely BBC affordable line other HS products. Set up and calibration was a little more specific than the HS100 but only took about 10 min to get flight ready.  And WOW !!! Flight times were far greater than expected at about 23 minutes even with a 10 minute video of my project location. Image quality with the 4K camera was greater than I expected. Travel speed is adjustable and I spent most time at high speed.  Video is relatively stable in the breezy conditions I flew in and the range was much better than my HS100 could achieve. I piloted are about 425‚Äô elevation with max range of about 675‚Äô away (I‚Äôm in a terrible satellite/WiFi location) so for what I‚Äôm planning on utilizing the drone for I think it was an excellent decision to stick with Holy Stone who is not 2 for 2 on 5 star ratings on my Drone purchases.  EASY TO USE, GREAT IMAGE QUALITY, VERY AFFORDABLE makes this another Smart decision.

title: Nice compact drone
text: Awesome company that stands by their product. Easy to fly even indoors

title: HS720E Ophelia GO APP IS EXTREMELY DANGEROUS!
text: I am an experienced drone operator.  Out of the box HS720 EIS 4K Drone & Controller have been repeatedly perfectly "calibrated", no wind, and "beginner mode auto take-off."  Drone raises, hovers, and looses it's mind!  Remote shows 11 GPS satellites and GPS is turned "on."  Then I found dozens of YouTube videos complaining of the latest Android APP making this drone both crash and extremely dangerous!  This sux, as I ordered 4 spare batteries, chargers, landing gear, prop guards, and 2 SD Cards for an unsafe drone!  I am returning everything to Amazon and filing written complaint with video to the FAA!!!  This could be a good drone IF Holy Stone cared about fixing their dangerous APP.

title: First Load the required app!! If it immediately crashes then you will fly by the seat of your pants.
text: The required app was updated and now it crashes and closes immediately. It seems that the app might now have some clickbait promising some free battery. The app is : Ophelia Go. I would suggest loading the app on your phone and see if it works. Perhaps wait for next update to correct this problem before purchasing this drone. When it worked it was a nice beginner drone but I think I should have purchased the other more expensive, more popular drone that everyone else got. Also this drone is to be registered with the F.A.A.  due to its weight....pain in the butt.  JULY2022 so everything seems to work fine now. This drone goes up about 400 feet, we send it far without any problem and it returns to the exact spot.The video transmission is great and the Recording is ok. Upped rating to 5five stars

title: Great Drone for the price
text: This is my second Holy Stone Drone that I purchased on amazon. My 1st drone was the Hs 100 which is a great drone that I purchased about two years ago and is still working perfect and now I purchased the Hs 720 which I have had for about 2 months. The HS 720 is very nimble and in my opinion the sports car of drones. It is fast and maneuvers very well and it is also a fun drone to play with and teach others to fly drones with ( I taught my 12 year old son on this drone and now he wants his own). The battery lasts about 20 minutes with continuous flying. The remote control takes batteries, instead of having to charge it which I like much better. I sometimes have trouble with the remote of the HS100 saying it is not charged when it is and it takes a little bit to register. The only complaint with the Hs 720 is the camera for me. The camera works fine to take overhead pictures when playing with it but if you are trying to focus in on some fine details, it isn't the best. Also the camera is on a shock which helps but the wind does blur the pictures sometimes. I do prefer the camera on the HS 100 over the HS 720. However, looking at the price of the drone, the quality of the drone, the fact that it flies so well, even in windy conditions, and the ease of flying this drone, it is a no brainer when it comes to purchasing this drone. I do recommend this drone and I am glad I purchased it. If you are comparing it to a very expensive drone you will be disappointed but if look at the price point and take that into account, you will be very happy with your purchase. Joey.

title: Fun flights
text: This is my first real drone. I found the flight controls pretty straightforward and easy to learn. Auto take off and land worked well. The home function brought it back very close to where it took off. I used my Note 9 as a screen and I had great live video as I flew. I've taken some pictures and they all came out clear. In fact, the drone pictures are probably clearer than the Note 9 pictures. Again as a newbie, the battery seemed to last a really long time. I keep stopping to check the battery level out of paranoia, but it just last and last. All in all very pleased.

title: BLUF: Great little drone for the money!
text:
OK - I'll start out by saying I purchased this - my first drone - and received nothing in return for writing this review. I've had it for about 2 months (it was an early Christmas present to myself) and flown it several times a week over that period. I bought it mainly to document the construction of my new house and have taken a couple hundred pictures, and a few videos to date. It's been a great tool for that purpose.

Things I like: It's easy to fly, behaves as I expect it to, and as far as I can tell all the features and functions work as advertised. The folding feature is great, making it truly easy to transport, and the battery life is impressive. I love the well made case - I can toss it in the back of my Jeep (complete with the spare battery I purchased) when I head to the job site and not have to worry about anything getting damaged on the way.

Things that could be better: The camera is certainly adequate for my purposes, but it's not great. I take mostly still photos, and those are fine, but video taken on anything but a dead calm day can be nauseating to watch. I understand the physics of a small, lightweight air vehicle struggling mightily to remain stable on a breezy day; it does the best it can, but don't expect Steadicam-like HD video from something in this price range. Also, for those of us used to today's cell phone cameras and modern DSLRs, 2K pixels is not what we'd call high resolution. But again, you get what you pay for, and a drone with a better camera is going to set you back several more Benjamins. Finally, as others have noted, the Ophelia App used with this drone is somewhat annoying - it takes multiple button pushes to get it up and running, and that includes answering several mysterious questions in Chinese. However it does work well once you get past that. But come on guys - you sell a boatload of these drones in the U.S. - can't you afford a few bucks to produce an English language version of the software?

Conclusion: The above gripes notwithstanding, I'm very happy with my Holy Stone HS720. It's fun to fly and does what I bought it for. On breezy days you can tell it struggles against the wind, but that's just physics. I could have purchased a drone with a better camera, but didn't want to spend the extra money, especially given this was my first drone purchase. For what I spent I'm very pleased with this purchase.

title: Great drone
text:
I purchased a HS720. When I received it I was very excited to fly it. I had purchased a drone from another company, that I had for my first one. I thought that was the bomb. After flying that for about 2 weeks I realized I needed a better quality drone to play with. I didn‚Äôt want to spend a fortune, I got online and did some research and for what I wanted to spend this was one of the top choices. Being new I had no idea good or bad so I went with it. Glad I did very easy to fly GREAT PICS have not made any videos yet but I will. I did have some problems on first take off and trying to land it, but I figured it out, still had plastic on lenses, guess I needed to read directions better. Then I received an email from your company advising me not to forget to do that, I had to kinda laugh at myself. That was another thing I thought was great, I have received a couple emails thanking me for my purchase and tips. That is the kind of service after the sale I like. I have not owned it very long but sure hope the customer service is there always when needed. That brings me to another point I have, being it‚Äôs so new I fly a lot, but with only 1 battery I‚Äôm limited to one flight per day pretty much. Again I reference my first drone, it said the flight time was 15 min, I was lucky to get 8-9 minutes. Your drone says flight time is 26 minutes I flew it the first night for almost 25 min before I looked about empty. That is a very good selling feature also. ( flight time is actually what the box says). My brother wants a drone also but has to wait till Christmas his wife says, he came over and seen mine, flew it and fell in love, I think I have him sold on this one. Looking to purchase another battery but I cannot find it on your web site. The drone looks and feels like the expensive ones, I have never owned an expensive one but I cannot see how much better they could be next to this one. Love the looks, the little case is a great addition, my previous sat on bench, this one I can keep contained, very nice quality in my book. Thank you for your time, if the battery is available let me know so I can get one please. Thank you for your time.

Dale Gross

title: Full function high quality drone for a third of the price!
text: [[VIDEOID:69045a594ecad2f374900eded479468]] So right off the bat after opening the box I realize that all holy stone really stepped up their game on this drone. The packaging was nicely done and the case was very nice also.  when I first picked the drone it just felt really well built as did the controller. There‚Äôs definitely a lot of technology in this drone so I would recommend it for Younger beginners but hey for 300 bucks it‚Äôs better than crashing one of those $1000 ones into a building or a tree.  Flight time was as advertised and the for the first I took it out and it was holding position at about 200ft with at least about a 25mph wind.  I honestly would have given it 4 stars if I were to compare it to one of those high-end droneS because of the range and camera setup...but that would be completely in fair at a third of the price. I gave it 5 stars because of the value It presents to an aspiring drone pilot who wants a full function gps drone with a remote tilt camera. This thing is the real deal and not a toy quad copter and I highly recommend it. And as always Holy Stones customer service was spot on!

title: Compact full featured GPS Drone for getting started
text:
I was looking for a small foldable GPS drone to carry in my 4x4 truck for use as utility and for fun. My goal was to get a unit that small enough to hang in the ceiling net of the truck, up and away yet handy when needed. After several hours of watching YouTube reviews (CAPTAIN DRONE) this unit stood out. The 2k camera on a 1 axis gimble and what looks like enough power to fly at higher altitudes (In the Mountains, not above more than 400ft above the surface) all packed into the folding design made this drone the right choice.

With more than an hour of flight time, I am not disappointed. I am looking forward to using it above 2000ft elevation in a few days and above 9000 early next year (Updates Coming). I was impressed with how quiet the unit is during flight. Above 50ft, the prop noise blends into the background here in the city.

While not having much to compare to, the speed of charging seems slow but lets do the math to see if this is reasonable.

Battery Basics: The battery is listed as 7.4v, while the charger is rated for 3.7v. This information means that the battery for this unit has 2x 3.7 Cells inside. The battery is rated for 2800mah, and because the two cells are in series to make 7.4v each of the cells has 2800mah capacity.

Charger Basics: The charger is rated at 3.7v with a max of 2amps. The 2 amps charging for 1 hour provides 2000mah of capacity to reload these batteries. While we are talking about the charger, I would like to see a more 'secure' connection between the battery and charger. My use in a moving truck to recharge has required me to tape or secure them together to avoid unintentional disconnection.

But wait, there is more math to this. Because the charger uses 3.4v to charge, each of the two cells in the battery are charged in parallel, dividing the charging capacity in 1/2 (1000mah). Also, because this charger can charge 2 batteries (4 cells) at the same time but with the same max capacity...the charging rate may be a 1/4 of the listed rate (500mah). Why is 500mah important? Because each cell can hold 2800mah, meaning it may take 5-6 hours to recharge both batteries. So with the math...the only way to get faster charging is to update the charger and its power supply (3.1A USB-C). *Charging 1 battery is 2x faster than 2...so if you just need a quick flight, just juice up one and wait til later for the 2nd.

title: HS720 Review - Great Drone
text: I have flown a number of drones for a while now and most of them are hard to figure out. It seems the more you spend on them, the harder they are to figure out. I had one that I could never figure out and sent it back having never flown it. I tried videos, reading all the materials and everything I could think of and nothing. I finally stumbled on the Holy Stone 720 after researching many drones and it comes with many accessories and has good long-lasting batteries as well which is really important when trying to fly for any length of time. I had another expensive drone that took great video, but the gimbal was so open that it got damaged very easily, I had to send it in for repairs and 200 dollars later, I got it back. For about the same money, I could have gotten this Holy Stone drone which has good protection around the camera area. The other thing I did not like about a number of drones was that there was just no stop button, you had to just hold the toggles down until they decided to stop which led to a couple of accidents as well. The Holy Stone 720 is easy to figure out, to fly and takes great video and pictures. I would recommend it to anyone, especially those who are newer pilots like myself that don‚Äôt want to spend what I have spent just trying to figure all of this out. Hope this helps, Bryan

title: Not Sure
text: I got this as a Christmas gift. Took it out on a snowy day and it lifts right off the ground and then took off to the South. Trying frantically I got it down into the snow. Figured it was too cold or something. Come spring I tried again and it took off to the South again this time I saved it by hitting a tree about a 100 yards out. At this point I had to replace 2 of the 4 propellers. Come today, a nice calm evening and the piece of s#($ takes off to the South again with little response from the controller. It got stuck in a bush where I was able to retrieve it and throw it as hard as I could into a boulder wall then stomp on it and smash it with another rock! The extra chinesium in this was out of control! The controller is nice. Oh I had RC cars and planes as a kid so there was no guessing as to how the physics of flight work. I have also read several articles on these where they take off to the south.

title: First Timer
text: Never have I flown a drone before I wanted to give it a try. A lot of ratings brought me to buy this HS720. It come quickly and complete in a very nice case. I read through the paperwork that comes with the drone and also some YouTube vids. Charged the Battery to the top and next day I was a pilot. it fly's smooth and easy to learn to maneuver. Second time out I was excited to lift off and didn't have all the sat. signal. and did have to chase it a bit when the wind kinda panicked me and it got away about 100 yards. Never again have I had any issue, flown it half a dozen times, cut some nice pictures, a couple vids. i'm really liking learning how to fly. Enjoy...

title: Great drone, nice case, easy to fly
text: This is my first "real" drone. In the past I had got my kids the toy versions which were actually harder to use and less responsive than this drone. This drone is great! I particularly love the case that it comes in and how compact it is. Makes it easy to take anywhere and can worry less about damaging it in transport. The flying capabilities/functions are very easy to pick up, even for a beginner. The camera is also fantastic and takes some rather incredible footage. Very fun toy! One thing that I would like changed is the ability to turn OFF the "Return to Home" function. I see an issue with that if I'm going to be going around obstacles or take it on a long ride. I don't want it to suddenly try to go home if home is a mile away or something... and thus try to fly through trees or buildings, since it's line-of-sight. In the meantime, I just have to pay close attention to the battery level and shut it down before it gets to that point.  Instead of "Return to Home" perhaps "Return to Ground" would be safer/better. Otherwise, it's a great little toy and I look forward to Spring and Summer when I can use it more.

text: Very nice drone!  My son is 11 and has no problems learning to fly the drone.  We did have 1 fatal crash.  I reached out to holy stone's customer service, not expecting much because the crash was totally our fault.  They were awesome, they had me take a pic of the damage with a short description of what happened.  With a few days of back and forth emails.  They decide the damage was to great to repair and proposed a solution that I could not believe......they decided to send me a brand new one and they would pay for shipping.  About a week later we recieved a brand new unit  (not a refurbished).....in today's day and age it is nice to see that kind of customer service.  I will definitely by another Holy Stone when the time comes to get my youngest son one.  Not only because the unit is awesome and the pics and vid are crystal clear, but also because of the stellar customer service!!

title: Great quality and easy to fly and take video/pictures
text: I have tried to fly r/c helicopters in the past, with limited success, so I was a little apprehensive about flying this drone. But, it was so easy to control and learn to fly that I had the confidence to take it up and over my house for a video during my first test flight. Even though is was a bit breezy that day, the drone stayed where it was supposed to and I got some great video that I pulled some still pictures from. I was also able to maneuver it around the trees in my yard without any problems. This feels like a solid, well built drone with some great features and I would recommend it without hesitation!

title: A great idea for family fun outside.

I like the 2 blades instead of the fixed 1. It would make a great gift for the family outside. I would recommend it.

Wifi disconnected mid flight and drone got a little unstable in the air, was a little nervous to be honest. besides the compact design no big difference compared to my previous HS700D. i returned it for a DJI Mini SE that was just $100 more and a waaaay better camera, app, build and a more stable flight experience even with a breeze.

Battery life seems to be good, though 7 hours to charge is a little crazy! Seems to be a quality made product. It's a little heavier than the F181W so it should handle wind a little better.

title: Easy to Fly
text: The Holy Stone HS720 is a great machine.  Compact but efficient drone.  As a new user, the learning curve was quick.  I was able to fly and control the drone is a very short time.  Landing, takeoff and return was very easy.  Flight times were great with this drone.  The price is good. I recommend this drone,

title: So disappointed! A few issues. Not real 4k!
text:
I received the item today and found a few issues after trying a few minutes. First of all, there is no user manual in my package which makes me suspect that what I received is not a new drone, and some other reviews seem to echo it. Second, the camera is not 4k, or at least the video it produces is 2560x1440, not 3860x2160. Third, I tried hard to connect the drone to my cellphone but failed. I followed a lot of tutorial videos I can find on youtube but I still could not make it working. Last, the drone is not stable at all (with 14 gps satellite connected). The video shot is very shaky and I can see the propeller blades in the video when the camera is in the up position.

I feel so disappointed with this drone and I am going to return it.

title: The Holy Stone HS720 drone is great!!!!!
text: [[VIDEOID:334216bc02a6a7778773a307eb98c6d0]] This drone was so easy to setup and fly. Great battery life, 21 minutes of flying after full charge. Very well built drone and great looking. Big thanks to Holy Stone for a very nicely priced drone that is going to provide plenty of fun. Camera is great and the zoom along with being able to tilt the camera up and down from the RC/camera makes this drone great for checking out any issues on the roof/gutters too. Looking forward to continuing doing business with Holy Stone!!!!!!!

title: My First Drone
text: I have never had or flown a drone until I bought this one. This thing is really stable and have had no problems flying it. I think the controls are really easy to use and understand. The app for the phone is equally easy to use. The range of the remote seems very good and the GPS features work well. I was flying my drone and the battery level was down to a single bar and the drone came back to its home position and landed within a few inches from its take off point. I have been getting about 20 minutes of flight time. The video is good but a little unstable. I use a 32gb micro SD card in the drone and download the files on my PC (MP4 format). The case is very nice to keep everything together. The only complaint I had was getting a spare battery and props for the drone. They were not easy to get and the holystone website doesnt even list them. I did get a battery from Amazon but it took several weeks to get it. The props I still have not found anywhere.

title: Great drone for beginners
text:
After doing a lot of research I decided that the HS720 was the perfect drone for a beginner like me.
You can‚Äôt really be sure of the quality of an online purchase, but Holy Stone hit this one out of the park. As soon as I unzipped the carrying case I knew I made a great choice. The build quality of the HS720 is obvious. This is by no means a toy but a genuine UAS.
The first time I flew my HS720 I was pleasantly surprised. It was easy to control and responded as expected. A great drone for a beginner.
Thanks Holy Stone for producing a great quality product with plenty of features at an affordable price.

title: Excellent Drone ...so much fun to be had
text:
You might look at this and say "oh that is too much $$ for my first drone". I'm here to say that it is perfect for your first drone. This is my first drone, and I was so excited to get this. I t was so easy to set up. The directions were so easy to follow and read. I was flying in about 10 minutes. My first flight was a bumpy ride of my being a bit afraid that I would lose it. The second flight, I was buzzing all over the place going out about 200 meters and flying around our lake.. and chasing a bird >.> <.< The flight time was perfect... I walked in each time I flew it, very satisfied with the 25 minutes and eager to fly it again. The next day though... a STRONG breeze came out of nowhere and knocked it HARD against the side of my house and broke an arm. *insert sad face here* The funny thing was that about 12 hours later I was flying again ... I used gorilla glue, let it sit overnight and the next morning you would never know that the arm had snapped clear off. ( did reach out to Holy Stone ....but I have not heard back from them yet)

the TLDR: - This drone is well worth the $$ - it is very easy to pick up and learn. It is not hard to control at all (unless you get a rough blast of wind). I am a 43-year-old man and very very pleased with this Drone. Do not settle for something less, or "cheaper*

title: Could be an outstanding quadcopter except for - - -
text:
I have used this aircraft since November of 2019 and I now have enough experience with it to provide a comprehensive review.

This quadcopter has the potential to be a fantastic machine. If it was not for its occasional un-commanded and destructive ‚Äúflights of fancy‚Äù I would have given it fully 5-stars with no exceptions or reservations. Sadly, it has a very bad flaw somewhere in its software that can, and did, result in uncontrolled flight ending in violent and destructive crashes.

First the good parts.

I purchased this aircraft primarily because I needed to inspect my roof after some very bad weather events. I had previously been playing with an inexpensive quadcopter from a well known manufacturer so I had a pretty good idea about how to fly these things. However this inexpensive quadcopter was not stable enough to perform close up inspections and photography in even mildly turbulent wind conditions. Reviewing on-line reviews of better quality quadcopters I discovered that this HS720 quadcopter was very highly regarded. Its performance did in fact live up to the best description and comments of various reviewers. In a high and very turbulent wind it is tremendously stable and as a photo platform it is outstanding. I was able to maneuver it closely, within a few feet, around objects in winds gusting to 25kts according to the NWS at my local airport. Its station keeping performance is outstanding. It required minimal control inputs form the remote controller to get the HS720 positioned and keep it there.

For general flying I have taken it out to a large undeveloped open site to see what it could do. It will do, and do well, everything (almost) it is advertized to do. Its ability to ‚Äúfollow me‚Äù is spooky good. It will orbit in its assigned point maintaining the assigned elevation until commanded to be brought back or the battery limit are exceeded. It always goes back to its launch point or as commanded by me. I flew it well out of visual range and tested its ability to ‚Äúreturn to home‚Äù by pressing the RTH button or with the controller shut off indicating loss of signal and after being airborne until its battery was exhausted. It always returned to within three feet of its launch point. The Ophelia app for the smart phone is very good, The only down side of the Ophelia app is that it runs out of WiFi signal way before the controller signal runs out

In almost every respect it is an outstanding flying machine. Furthermore, the Holy Stone customer support is fast, responsive and generally excellent.

Now the not so good part.

If the HS720 is flown in the ‚ÄúTapFly‚Äù mode, pre-programmed to fly a path, it will do so, and quite nicely too. The problem is that some times, and unpredictably, the next flight immediately after the ‚ÄúTapFly‚Äù flight will be totally uncontrolled - what I noted above as its ‚Äúflight of fancy‚Äù.

I have two HS720 quadcopters and both have been destroyed in uncontrolled flight.

The first time this happened it was after I brought the HS720 back from a ‚ÄúTapFly‚Äù flight. I shut it down and removed the photo SD card. I restarted the quadcopter and attempted to launch for a manual flight. As soon as the ‚Äútake off/landing‚Äù button was pushed the quadcopter immediately climbed to no more than two feet and made a hard right turn and flew into the tire of a nearby car. The quadcopter seemed to be unresponsive to control commands but the flight lasted well less than 10 seconds. There was no damage other than some scrapes on the fuselage and dings on one of the props. I powered down the quadcopter and again performed a complete restart procedure. I flew the quadcopter many time after that incident, including some ‚ÄúTapFly‚Äù flights and all went well. On its final flight, again after a ‚ÄúTapFly‚Äù flight, I launched the quadcopter for a manual flight. As soon as the ‚Äútake off/landing‚Äù button was pushed the quadcopter immediately made a 180 degree climbing right turn to about two feet and accelerated hard for about 75 feet when it collided at full speed with a steel bollard. Parts went flying. The quadcopter was destroyed. The quadcopter seemed unresponsive to any control command but the flight lasted less than 15 seconds.

I contacted Holy Stone customer support to enquire into repairing the quadcopter. I told my sad tail was informed that repairs are not possible but I was offered a fair discount on a replacement HS720. I took the offer. I was also provided with instructions about the correct practices for operating the quadcopter to avoid the same issue in the future. As it happened I was already carefully following these procedures.

I flew my second HS720 for a few months in all modes of flight, including the ‚ÄúTapFly‚Äù pre-programmed flight mode. On a couple of occasions after a ‚ÄúTapFly‚Äù flight it started to enter an uncontrolled flight but I was able to ground the quadcopter without incident. On the final flight of my second HS720, again, after a ‚ÄúTapFly‚Äù flight, I restarted the quadcopter, following all the procedures, for a manual flight. As soon as the ‚Äútake off/landing‚Äù button was pushed the quadcopter immediately climbed and went into a left turn heading into trees and a fence. The quadcopter was not responsive to directional controls but I managed to get it to climb so I could avoid objects and see it. It did not respond to the ‚Äúreturn to home‚Äù command and continued to fly erratically away from the launch point. When it was over open ground I used the descend command on the joystick to try to bring it down but lost sight of it. When I finally found it the quadcopter was on the ground about 500 feet from the launch point with a broken left rear arm. It was close to a fence and it may have collided with the fence.

My suspicion is that this is due to a software bug somewhere.

So my review of the HS720 performance is as follows. As a camera platform it is very good. It is very stable in the air even in heavy gusts turbulence and its station keeping ability is excellent even in heavy wind. The quadcopter performs very well in all flight modes. The battery life is good, I was getting well over 20 minuets. The protection function for loss of signal and low battery perform exactly as advertized, it will always come home. The Ophelia app is very useable.

Unfortunately, the ‚ÄúTapFly‚Äù function appears to leave the flight control computer in an unstable condition under unpredictable circumstances which can result in later uncontrolled flight.

Other than that, this is a really nice quadcopter and if all I wanted to do is take photos under direct manual control I would get another one.

title: Not In HIGH Wind Speeds!
text: Very good drones for beginners and great 4k photos and 2.5k video but if this drone gets updated i wish it could have a gimbal of some sort because the camera is little shaky but can handle pretty good in winds and i suggest not to fly in high winds speeds because it's dangerous. Also I wish they would have told you that there are little stickers that cover the landing lights and the optical flow sensor which you have to pull to work. Great drone!

title: Good drone for beginners! Charge time is too long.
text: For the price, its an awesome drone. Comes with extra propellers which is great. Good for pictures, but that's it really not good for video flybys; it isn't stable enough to smoothly do flybys. Be sure you have more than enough room. Had to knock down a star because 1 time it went rouge and was driving itself and crashed into a tree and fell down to the ground. Had my hopes that I just spent money on this junk, but surprisingly the drone held up really good no damage to nothing, just a few scuff marks. Also to charge the batteries takes way too long, but good thing is that they provide you a charge where you can charge both batteries at the same time.

title: Incredibly durable but video is a little shaky
text:
Great beginner drone...everything is easy; easy to fly; easy to connect to cell/app; easy to retrieve footage from SD card. I like this drone A LOT!! In fact it is a BEAST! I have, not intentionally, put this drone through the ringer and it keeps on going! I have flown it into concrete walls, crashed into walls in my house, flown it into countless bushes/shrubs, and have even crashed it into a river where it sat in 3ft of moving water for about 10 mins and, after definite drying efforts, it still operates 100% normally. I got soo lucky!! Point being, it has taken quite the unintentional abuse by me and has given me the slightest issue.
I have to say though, the one and only reason I'm rating it 4 stars instead of 5 is due to the unsteadiness of the video quality. It is pretty clear, no complaints there, but it is pretty rocky and it definitely picks up wind movement.
Again, a great 1st drone to learn or orientate yourself with flying, and also incredibly durable. But the only flaw is the video is not terribly smooth at all. With all that being said I would absolutely recommend it!

title: Awesome.

text: This drone is super fun.  Take head when the directions say to calibrate it outside and not inside.  I had a little accident with it indoors and now my fingers took the toll.  Totally my fault.  The pictures are great and it is super easy to learn to fly if you are a beginner. It says not to fly it on a windy day, I took it out yesterday and it held steady with a good bit of wind. For the money and ease of use this is a great first drone.

title: I could not break this thing (fortunately)
text: Let's be honest we will read just enough instructions to get it in the air and start playing with it. Also you will probably not spend the first two battery charges learning the controls and gently taking off and flying around in a zero wind day. You're going to take off in your back yard fly around and try and film something, well you can. The good news is even after flying into bushes, flying against a brick wall 10 ft off the ground and landing in amongst the bushes this drone still works. I don't know much about drones but this is fun, robust and a darn good buy. I would definitely recommend it.

title: Great drone
text:
I am really impressed with this drone. It has many great features. It is about the idea weight not too light and not too heavy. It handles a fair amount of wind and stays steady. It is fold able which is very convenient, comes with a great carrying case which carries everything you need to fly it. Just pick up the case and go. It comes with a controller that still has a screen. I prefer the screen because it gives you information rather than relying on just lights .
The camera produces great videos and stills. The camera is controllable within a 90 degree vertical angle.
I like the landing lights on the bottom of the drone which can be turned on or off. The micro SD card is easy to insert and remove.
All of the auto functions work quite well--Auto take off, auto return, hovering, orbiting, etc.
In short I have owned 4 drones and this one is by far the best.

title: Gives DJI a run for their money!
text: I'm extremely delighted with the HS720's performance, durability, and clever design. Very easy setup and operation had me flying in minutes. I find the drone's operating range is slightly better when paired the transmitter from the HS700D and you are still able to control the camera gimbal with this controller. The foldable transmitter with the HS720 is very capable of transmission of at least 3700 feet, and is very aesthetically pleasing with it's illuminated LED. The camera video quality is fantastic. No "jello" effect from vibration and the 2k resolution is much more crisp. I LOVE the visual ground sensor as I can now easily take some amazing low flying Star Wars like "Speeder Bike" videos. Can't wait to start sharing some footage.

title: Customer Service
text:
I have owned a HS720 since May 2020.
Recently I had a problem and contacted Holy Stone customer service. Even though my drone is almost 2 years old, they bent over backwards to help. And, I am delighted to say, solved the problem.
I wish all the companies I deal with had after sales service like Holy Stone.
Bob Fleeting

title: Great for first time user
text:
After quite a bit of researching I finally ended up on this drone and I'm glad I did. I'm still getting used to flying but so far it's been super easy to use. I would definitely recommend to other users.

Pros:
1. Super easy to use. If you read through provided directions carefully you can be up and running in a matter of minutes.
2. Camera is pretty great. Very clear. You can see blades in video if it's all the way at the top but you can adjust out of the picture by tilting it down.
3. Great for first time user. On my third short flight, I ran into a tree. The propellers stopped and it dropped about ten feet only to stabilize and and hover in place. There is no way I could have leveled out on my own but whatever internal functioning occurred, it had saved it.
4. All around pretty great!

Cons: Most of the cons so far are to be expected or generally related to any drone.
1. Easily affected by wind.
2. Follow me appears to require a certain distance. I tried to use and instead of following me it moved away almost hitting a tree and my house so I recommend using in a wide open space at first.

title: A fun starter drone but has a bunch of flaws UPDATED 4/1/2020 - 1 star added
text:
I bought this drone based on the reviews and since I am a beginner drone pilot I didn't want to have a large financial investment in case I crashed the drone. I really enjoy flying the drone and overall it is very stable (I have yet to fly in high winds). If everything worked properly, I would give the drone 4 stars. I am subtracting an extra star due to the lack of documentation, features not working properly, and the camera quality not being quite what was advertised (see picture).

UPDATE: Holy Stone has great customer service and sent me a new drone to try out without me asking. The drone works great and is working properly. I would highly recommend this drone as a great practice or starter drone.
The features that are not working on my drone are as follows: the SD card gives errors when recording video and the follow me feature doesn't work. Follow me worked the first time I used it, but has stopped working on subsequent flights.

The instruction manual is lacking and there is little to no information about the use of the SD card. It is important to know that you need to download all of our pictures and video to your phone before shutting down the drone after a flight otherwise nothing is saved on the card. The images that the camera does take are ok but not great, so if you want to use this for pictures or videos this isn't the drone for you. For the price I wasn't expecting a great camera, but I also don't think it lives up to what was advertised.

Also be aware that if you want to purchase spare props, they haven't been released at the time this review was written.

For the price, I think this is a great training drone and I would recommend purchasing it if you know what to expect.

title: Good starter drone with a very reasonable entry level cost
text:
As of today (1-2-20), I have had my HS720 for a month. I have flown the HS720 a total of 21 times. I Love this drone and have derived great enjoyment from flying the HS720. Overall, this is a good starter drone with a very reasonable entry level cost.
Observations:
Very enjoyable to fly. Battery last over 20 min and drone is responsive
The HS720 drone can experience excessive drift both horizontally and vertically. When flying in cluttered non-open areas, constant operator attention and correction is needed to keep drone from flying into obstacles. Maintain 15 feet from obstacles.
Some issues with loss of FPV video link between drone and smartphone. Use controller fold out handles and keep controller in an upright position for improved range performance and to reduce link dropouts. This works well for me.
Camera Performance:
Good camera value for cost and has acceptable performance
The camera easily becomes saturated. Color saturation varies greatly depending on direction of sunlight.
Camera photos and video tend to be a little dark and lacking vibrancy.
Camera can go off mechanical track when over extended
At least on my HS720, camera sometimes needs to be manually put back into gear track to regain angle adjustment capability
The HS720 Drone is rugged and durable which makes it crash survivable.
I have experienced two crashes due to Polygon Flight Feature
Let me explain: When initially trying this feature, I drew a polygon on map and submitted flight path. The drone immediately flew straight for a tree and crashed. I tried again in an open area and the same thing happened. I figured out that this was an operator error because I initiated a polygon path at a location that began away from where the drone was located. The drone flew a straight path towards the starting point in the polygon as designed.
Solution and caution when using the Polygon Flight Feature
Start your polygon at the current position of the drone.
Start this feature far away from and above obstacles
Remember that this drone has no obstacle avoidance
Initial Experience:
HS720 drone camera quit working after third flight
Got drone replaced through Amazon
On 12-2-19, Holystone offered to expedite a spare battery for my inconvenience
The first battery got lost in the mail and Holystone sent a second battery
On 12-31-19, I received the Spare battery from Holystone as promised

title: Trust me, just buy this one!!!!
text: I rarely take time to write reviews but when I‚Äôm this impressed with something I do. Only flew a couple times so far but having never used a drone before it was pretty simple to grasp after a quick read of the instructions. After researching drones for about 5 days, I almost went with a couple different companies until checking on customer service also. I decided on this drone from holy stone because of the awesome features and customer service reviews to match. No regrets. Great drone, quiet, easy to fly, great camera (adjustable in flight), long flight time. You‚Äôll be happy with this one.

title: Really liking this product!
text:
We purchased this after having a cheaper GPS drone for a couple years. This drone includes some nice features that come on the much more expensive drones. It is so convenient that it folds up and goes in the small case. it's very durable. The battery lasts over 20 minutes and we get pretty good video. it's really easy to get it calibrated and into the air for flying fun! The controller is very simple, with only a few buttons--however, I do wish that it was rechargeable and also that the controls lit up. In the evening, it's hard to see and you don't want to push the emergency stop instead of return home. Not a problem when you are used to the controller. Also, I wish there was some more work put into the app (which doesn't come with this), but it does some cool things, but it fails to connect quite often, looses connection, and doesn't really say what the error is when you try something that isn't allowed.
However, if the drone loses connection with the transmitter, it comes right back, so that is more of something that would be nice. The drone has two speed modes that are switchable from the transmitter while in flight, so that is handy. The battery has a real nice flight time (over 20 minutes) but it does take several hours to recharge, so it's worth having the extra battery or two.
Very happy with this drone. It's very fun and has several features that you'd see in a more expensive product..but simplified enough that a beginner or someone more experienced can enjoy a flight!

title: Great Starter Drone with one HUGE design flaw
text: What can be said that hasn't already been said, except that I didn't see the one TERRIBLY FRUSTRATING thing about it the reviews I read (I confess I didn't read them all...)  Here it is:  The spring mount for your phone absolutely WILL NOT HOLD ANY OF THE FOUR PHONES I TRIED to use in it.  I use an Iphone 6 plus, but I tried a standard  Iphone 6,  a standard Iphone X, an Iphone 4, and an LG (whatever) that I had sitting in a drawer.  Aaaand here's what happens:  As soon as you get the phone into the cradle, the tension from the mount immediately pops the phone out.  Not only that, but because there are two dials and two fairly critical buttons on top of the remote, the phone makes them fairly inaccessible, so if by some miracle of physics, you DO manage to get the phone to hold for a few seconds, the tension between the edges of the phone (which typically have buttons like "on/off" and "volume" are depressed, and when you go to tilt the camera or take a picture, you invariably just pop the phone out again.  I called Holy Stone about this, and their customer service just gave me an "Oh well...  Yeah, that happens.  We hear it a lot." and then recommended I purchase an Anbee Foldable extender at the cost of 17 bucks, which they were absolutely NOT WILLING TO PAY FOR.  And is back ordered until at least mid June.  I ended up putting a one inch square of Velcro tape on the back of my phone and another one on the bracket, which kinda works, sort of sometimes, but it's still irritating as all hell for obvious reasons.  I can't understand how a company which makes such an awesome little flying robot could frack up this bad on what should have been easily caught in product testing, corrected before going to market, or at least offered to offset the cost of the only thing that apparently will make it work properly.

title: Easy to Fly - Great Camera

The camera produces Great Pictures and Video, which are very clear.  You have excellent control of the drone and camera.  Even in a moderate wind, the drone tracks very well, remains stable, and is easy to control.  This drone is perfect for a beginner, but will also satisfy a novice.  Performs flawlessly.  Highly recommended for anyone.

title: Great travel drone for beginner to intermediate.
text: After having a beginner drone and spending more time fishing it of trees than actual fly time, this drone is a dream.  The camera is high quality.  It handled cross winds great at above 5 to 10 feet.  I pushed it to its limits to see how far I could get it and it performed well. The control seems to have a better connectivity than the 5g video to a phone, so I would suggest for farther trips with video get an sd card.  The auto fly features produces much better video than manual control.  I have had issues with the spin calibration initialization to get the compass set.  So it takes some time to get to fly time.  I have not pushed the limits of the battery, but I would be concerned if the battery got low and it would descend in time for a  return to home safe landing.  Without a headless mode it takes some head work to understand the correct orientation.  Overall its a great compact little drone which lives in a nice case.

text: I received this drone as a gift.  It's high quality and easy to use.  I was able to take great pictures and video on my first flight.  The manual could be improved slightly; however, it has all the information you need to fly using the controller and the smartphone app.

title: Buyer Beware! Read this first!
text: This done is junk. The first one worked great for a couple days. Then, one day, the controller started beeping and all lights on the drone went red. It was unresponsive and flew straight into a group of trees. I got it down but when it fell (about 30 ft) one of the arms broke. I asked for a replacement that arrived in about 8 days. Took it out, followed all instructions perfectly. I thought I would try it inside first to ensure it didn't do what the other did and because it has a feature with a light for indoor flight. At first it seemed to hover fine. Then, without touching anything, it slowly banked into a wall. I went over and picked it up and discovered another arm was broken. It's junk. Very expensive junk. Returning for full refund.

title: Great starter drone!!!!!!
text: [[VIDEOID:15694e6ab11a3f680306ef884d020815]] This thing is awesome, didn't want to get too crazy since this is my first flight with my first drone, the crazy will come soon enough.  It's great for beginners, the auto fly/hover GPS works great, the part I like best is if you get disoriented you just let go of the thumb sticks and it will stop and hover.  The resolution on the camera is fantastic for a $280 drone.  If you need a drone to start with, this is the one for you.

title: Buyer Beware
text: Awful. Used it once, 2nd time it took 20 min to connect and take off. After it took off it barreled uncontrollably toward trees and traffic.  Remote was in range, but had a mind of its own.  Got run over by a car after falling into the road and when I went to pick it up the rotors cut my hands in several places.  Guess I should have invested in a shovel to pick it up, and bury it in the trash where it belongs.

text:

title: Awesome customer service!!!
text:
I‚Äôm not new to Drone flying as I also own a dji Spark. I‚Äôm writing this review and could possibly change my opinion if Holy Stone stands by their product. I owned this HS-720 for roughly an hour. I did everything the manual said to do. I launched the drone and took it skyward about 40 feet and 10 seconds later the remote started to beep and the drone took off like a bullet to the right. I couldn‚Äôt believe my eyes. I‚Äôve searched my entire neighborhood and to no avail I cannot find it. The drone looked great and the packaging looked great, everything was going great at hover mode of 3-5 ft. I‚Äôve emailed Holy Stone and and waiting to see what they say but after reading other negative reviews I see a lot of people have had this same issue. At this time I feel like I spent $300 for about 3 minutes of fun and 2 hours of cardio exercise (brisk walking while drone hunting)

Update...
Holy stone has sent me a replacement drone there customer service is absolutely top notch, however after what happened the first time With the drone flying away I will be returning this one and going with the dji mavic mini. I‚Äôm not saying don‚Äôt buy this drone as the price point is great and not everyone has had there‚Äôs fly away.

title: Only drone haven't liked
text: This quad I did not have any luck with. I gave several drones in all price ranges and this one flew away twice. Both times I put on follow me mode it took off. To this day I dont know why.  Customer service was horrible. They wanted me to video record the odd behavior, do I did. When I submitted they wanted even more video  worst drone I've ever had.  I did give the transmitter 5 stars for its information center, I do really like all the info at a glance

title: A Lot of Fun
text: The Holy Stone HS720 is a solid drone with a lot of features for a very reasonable price. Easy to fly (I had very limited previous experience with drone before buying the 720) and takes nice pictures and video. This drone is ideal for 90% of hobbyists who just want to have some fun. My biggest issue was with the range, but that was easily improved with an inexpensive set of antennas. Been flying it for two months now and still take it out at least once or twice a week.

title: Good value for money, but I had to get it refund.
text:
It arrived in a very nice case, something Stuart other companies don‚Äôt do. So thats great.
Nice remote. Extra propellers.

Build quality seems reasonable and solid for plastic.

I really wanted to keep this product and enjoy it, but had to send it back since the one that I got was very wobbly when flying and that effected on a smooth video taking. And I want my video to be stable and nice to the eye.
I did proper calibration every time and all indicators seems fine For flying.
But still sometimes he was tilting to hard left or right without me moving it when he was just on hover mode. And that felt dangerous to me since I was hoping to film my 7 year old twins.

I don‚Äôt know if I got a faulty one or this is how it is with this model, Since other reviews seems good.
In general good value for money if not for stabilizing issue.
Wish the camera would be 4k but I guess you should pay extra money for high quality drowns.

I asked for refund over a week ago and still haven‚Äôt got it.
Really hope it will happen soon and I won‚Äôt need to bother myself with more actions.

title: For Beginners
text: Pretty sturdy drone with cool features for the price but I must point out of you are looking to use this professionally, you might want to spend a little more and get a dji. I didn‚Äôt like how gps is always not available to fly and use the return to home feature. Tried the follow-me feature but wasn‚Äôt impressed and then what photo to me was the quality of the video. I always had to manually set the white balance before I fly depending on the weather to get seemingly good picture quality but I couldn‚Äôt get over the shaky video recording. The Image stabilization claimed is not really stable for professional or even recreational video recording. Like I said earlier, it‚Äôs a good fun drone for the price but if you want something with a more professional video recording output you will have to spend that dji money.

title: This Drone is Cool!!
text:
I've had a couple of lower end drones before so I was excited when I received my HS720....this is one being one of the upper end models from Holy Stone. I did a fair amount of research before choosing this model, thinking it would be the right combination of ease of use, durability, price vs. value and company reputation. I wanted a foldable wing version this time.

Straight out of the box this drone seems to be well constructed, compact and feature laden. Love the carrying case and because the this is a folding wing drone the case is very small and makes it easy to tote around and take with you.

Set up was straight forward and it was easy to get flying very quickly. I recommend thoroughly reading the flight manual and getting familiar with all the controls and features.....

I opted for the automatic features initially....auto hover, return to home, safe return, etc. before diving into some of the more "daring" things. Tried a few photos and a short video....jury's still out on how well these will turn out. I've learned from my other drones to take my time and practice flying these thing so you don't crash and break on the first day.

Overall this drone seems like it'll be a good upgrade from my other ones....being easier to fly and more feature driven.

Very happy with my purchase thus....far. As soon as the Midwest weather allows I can't wait to get more "daring" when flying this cool little toy.

title: It‚Äôs an excellent beginner‚Äôs drone
text: Initially, there were some glitches with the app that would not allow me to use some of the features, such as the ‚Äúfollow me‚Äù, or GPS mapping. These issues have been corrected with the latest updates. It takes decent quality pictures and videos, which can be recorded on the SD card or directly to the phone.

title: Good till you need parts
text: Don't buy, replacement parts are impossible to find.  Call the help line they say the parts will be on Amazon (nope).

title: Great budget  next level drone for advancing in  the  hobby
text: Great product with excellent quality. . Works extremely well. Have flown multiple times with great success and fun. My daughter ( who is 14 ) is enjoying it too.  Do recommend getting the extra batteries. Battery life is good though ( ~27 min ) but if you want multiple flights in day an extra one is necessary.  Very important to make sure you calibrate the internal compass correctly--3 full turns etc.. When this is not set right drone will drift and controls become unresponsive.  ( all this is is the well put together manual )  Make sure you test it out by keeping it close by before flying further. Again this is a great product for the cost.

title: Top notch drone and easy to fly
text:
This was my first real drone other than Walmart junkers so needless to say I have no experience!!
I was a little scared to spend the money at first for the sake of maybe crashing it on the first flight. This was not the case I am super pumped on how easy it was to fly. There really is isn‚Äôt any way you could crash it if you start to lose control just let go and it holdS position. Auto take off and return to home take away the chances of crashing. Arial photos and videos are legit. My first flight started at 4:45 and I landed at 5:12 so the flight time was very satisfying. I would like to purchase a few more batteries to spend more time in the air. This drone is top notch for me and a great buy!!!

title: Grety for beginner!!!!
text: Hey guys so I purchase the holy stone hs720 as my second drone my first drone was a snaptain, which didn't have GPS and man what a difference that makes. Litteraly you don't have to do calibration in the air the drone just hovers where it's at. The home command is on point. And the battery is pretty accurate to what they say. Only down side is it take so long to charge. Def and entry drone for the buck. Love the compact design and foldable propeller. the camera . I wished it came with a gymbal and not a dampning system as strong winds does make it shake. But on a no windy day. It's pretty good.

title: Item arrived used!
text:
Item arrive scuffed and used. Box was open and there was dirt still on it.

Update: I changed my rating up from 1 to 4 stars. For some reason the product arrived used but called Holystone support and they were right on top of it and they resolved my issue quickly.

As far as the product is concerned....this thing is so much fun! It loses wifi signal but I think thats as designed so don't expect to be able to see the video from large distances. With that said, I flew mine out of range and then was worried it was lost. I clicked the little return home button and low and behold it came back. Whew! Would recommend not just for the product but great support by the company.

title: Great Drone and Great Customer Service
text:
First, the Drone itself is great, especially for the price. It handles well, and responds to controls seemingly immediately, which is a must for an object that flies through the air with the power and speed contained on this drone. The only limiting factor is the connection with my phone, which starts losing visual connection well before the remote itself loses connection. The drone maintains its position splendidly. The GPS features are quite handy. I do wish the follow me feature enabled the drone to follow at a closer distance, however, I think that would be a huge safety risk as well, so I cannot count that against it. The orbit mode is also great whether you are photographing your family in the park and flying above houses capturing the full beauty of the sunset.

Second, the customer service. This is the real selling point for me. The customer service for the drone is spectacular. The company sincerely cares about the experience consumers have with the product and responds quickly to resolve any issues or concerns they have. I know this because I had an incident with my drone after two months of use. Customer service representatives responded quickly to resolve my concern and ensure that I was satisfied before the end of the day.

title: Amazing
text: Great first drone. Exceeded my expectations. My kids and I have a blast with this. As long as you read the instructions before trying to operate you‚Äôll be good to go.

title: Holy Stone HS720 Fold-able first flight
text: This is my first Drone, the package was done very nice & the unit is compact, next downloaded the manual. I reviewed the startup procedure & how to sync my phone to the unit. So far all was easy. There was a strong wind blowing at this time which made me concerned due to I am not experience with flying a drone. I was careful and practiced just getting the drone in the air and landing, I only went 20 to 25-Ft high at this time, had the drone hold it altitude all went well. A strong gust of wind came the drone did a good job holding its position.  Next to try some features, I flu the drone about 100 yards away and tried the return home worked fine. Next I used follow me and walked around for 10 minutes, I start getting low battery alert returned home. My 1st Drone and my overall experience was very good.  The construction of the drone & controller is a good quality. I did call the customer service and they were very helpful.

title: Excellent Customer Service
text: Holy Stone customer service was a five-star service. I ordered an HS720-4K on Tues, the package was delivered at my door on Thurs. I loved it right on the first flight, it was very easily controlled, flew it every day. On the 10th day, after taking off, the drone kept tilting to the left although I calibrated it before flying. This caused my drone crash into the garage and broke its arm. I called HS Customer Service (CS), the CS lady, after listening to me about the issue,  asked me to email them the issue description along with the purchase order information. Two days later, a new HS720 was delivered to my door, along with an email that no need to send back the broken drone, and it can be kept for spare parts. HS provided excellent services.

title: Excellent product. Well designed.
text: Product works well but drifts a bit in the wind. Be careful. Customer service was extremely helpful with my questions and issues.

title: Stays in control when it flies
text: I was super impressed with how stable this drone is when it flies. Even when there is a breeze it stays in control. I am so blown away by how well it will adjust itself to the wind, and I was flying it around one day and the wind started to pick up mid flight and instead of going out of control it recognized that it was getting too windy and gently lowered itself back to where it took off. I am thoroughly impressed and very satisfied with this buy!

title: Good entry level GPS drone
text: Good entry level drone. This is my first gps drone. Flys well with good range. Wifi connection is not that far but FAA rules state line of sight flight only so not bad. Battery flight time is anywhere from 20-27 mins depending on conditions. Compact with a carry case. Would definitely recommend for an entry level drone at this price.

title: Customer Service
text: I‚Äôve had this drone since Sept. 2022 and love it. I crashed it last week and broke one of the arms. Contacted customer service on a Friday night and a new arm was shipped to me the next Monday morning. Cannot say enough about the help I received. Thank you.

It'll move up, down, left, right, etc. It just won't respond to controls to rotate left and right to face the direction I want it to.  That makes me a bit nervous to push it too far in case case it just decides to do its own thing. I'll push it a bit more when I have a more wide open area. Until then it's a high 3/ low 4 star rating.

title: Impressive Drone, ease of use, good video quality.
text:
The HS720 is the first drone I have owned and flown. Unboxed, charged over night, downloaded app. Next morning went through quick start guide and was flying in minutes. The features with this drone are awesome for a first time pilot. I did read the entire manual so understood the capabilities of HS720, first flight was a success, flew around my home checking to see if the gutters needed cleaning. Maneuvered heights, around trees and roof lines with ease on first flight. I do not have anything to compare to, but don't see how it can get any better. Easy to fly, great pictures and video. Because of being a first time pilot the flight was not smooth, but did not see any jelly in the video, I was quite surprised at the video quality. 26 minute sure does pass quickly when you are having fun, so suggest a spare battery, if you can find one.
Holy Stone/Amazon what is the status of Spare batteries for this great drone???

title: This drone is for beginners. Not worth the money. Meant for indoor flight, NOT outdoor friendly
text: I gave this drone 2 stars because it is advertised as a competitor to the DJI Mavic drones with slightly less cost but it does not compare to the DJI line in any way. This drone is so light that even the slightest breeze will send it wobbling all over the place making your outdoor video footage useless. The RTH function does not work properly and the Drone will not travel more than 25 feet from the Takeoff point. Once the battery reaches half reserve you better land it or it will crash wherever it is at the point of flight. If you are looking for a beginner drone just buy a $30 drone. That is what this drone compares to, Not a $300 drone at all.

title: Good for the price
text: Overall quality for price is good. The instructions it comes with on how to fly are poor and I ruined a pair of blades teyi g to get it off the front the first time but there ismt much better for the price.

text: I was afraid to spend hundreds on a Drone for fear of loosing it or worse a crash the first time out.  WOW,  how things have changed in the RC world. Only disappointment if one could call it that is the Software Phone to Drone using WIFI is difficult to link and video feed so far is only about 600 foot linier distance before loss.

title: Intelligent Drone

title: A Best Buy!
text:
Update. After flying a few times, I got to enjoy HS270 even more. I now connect the drone/controller with my iPhone. Changed the flight parameters to 100m distance and 62m altitude and took some pictures. You can tell when the max distance or altitude is reached by the counter on the iPhone screen so that is good. The drone will stop or go back a bit to be within the limits. Will go to max altitude allowed for rec drone of 400ft (120m) soon!

Pictures are crisp. See attached.

I‚Äôve tried the auto-return. That is a good feature to have.for some reason you can‚Äôt control the done, just press auto-return. In addition, auto-takeoff & landing is just as great.

This is my first drone and I am very happy.

title: Great Drone with High Skill Ceiling
text:
Received this drone as a birthday gift and I was super excited starting at opening the box. You could tell everything was made from high quality material. The drone also comes with everything you need to get started right away. My favorite feature is probably it's collapsible arms making it extremely compact and would be easy to stick it with its case in a backpack for a fun adventure.

Since this was my first drone, I didn't master the controls right away and had a few accidents. The drone survived hitting a wall and multiple trees with only a few scratches and nicks. It has noticeably heavy duty construction that's made to absorb some beginner mistakes.

title: Drone works as told

title: Excellent customer service

title: For the price and preformance the HS770 was well worth my first investment.
text: Well written assembly instructions.  As a beginner it was amazingly easy to setup and learn the flight basics. The plastic film over the controller display and the drones lower camera lens needs a tab similar to the one on the main camera lens for ease of removal.  The battery charge time of 5+ hours would require having two battery's to fully enjoy a day of flying.

title: Almost average but still falls short
text: Look wise it‚Äôs built well and is genuinely visually appealing. Flight time is spot on, even in higher wind conditions which was a pleasant surprise. And it flies smoothly and incredibly precise. When you are in its very small range of operation. If you‚Äôre ok with flying by sight and not by the poor quality camera that‚Äôs by no means close to 4k go for it. But if you‚Äôre looking to stretch out a see what it sees through a quality lens, keep searching. I tried using it for photos of apartment complexes and would lose signal as I barely got above the buildings and then complete black out a few feet later. Hope this saves you from making the same poor investment as I made.

title: Great drone for a newbie
text:
My drone promptly arrived from Holystone undamaged and in perfect condition because of it's excellent packaging.
The kit itself had everything I needed to get started taking pictures and video. Also included was the drone battery and extra blade replacements for the rotors. I ordered and extra battery from Holystone and it came perfect too.
My suggestion: The instruction guide seemed to me to have been written before this drone was updated and so some of the directions were un-necessary. The drone was much easier to set up than directed by the instructions.
Also, the drone kit does not come with a TF chip to record pix or video, this too you can buy thru Amazon.
In summary, I'm exceptionally pleased with my purchase and the performance of this product.

title: This Chinese company bribes purchasers with free battery if a 5-star review is written.  Not 5-star.
text:
I was weary of the incentive of the battery and I did not review because I did not want the inability to review later.

The app is a bit shady requiring a lot of access phone files. It also keeps switching to Chinese characters where I am no longer able to determine what I am agreeing to.

After an initial maneuver flight to make sure the drone was operational, we took it out for a second test run. The drone was unstable in 10-15mph winds and crashed into the ground. One of the plastic arms was damaged beyond repair. There goes $300. The propellers come with replacements in case of damage, which must occur fairly often. I was hoping the damage was limited to that.

This drone was a gift for one of my kids and this drone crashed under my control. I am a manufacturing engineer with a fair amount of technical capacity and hand-eye coordination. I would hope I would be able to stabilize and fly the drone.

I would not purchase another Holy Stone drone.
